loans.name: Mrs. Meng Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of fourteen people, all of whom are villagers I. Preaek Ksev village I. Kandal province. Mrs. Meng K. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the group members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Meng K. is a fruit seller and her husband, Mr. Chorm Rors, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support his family. The couple has a child who is a seamstress I. a garment factory. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Meng K. wants to expand it B. she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she has decided to request a loan to buy more fruits for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for resale

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla P. is from the village of Sto Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish, shrimp and sometimes dried fish, in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Perla joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Perla is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ma. Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina S. is from the village of Salay, Angadanan, Isabela Province. She is 45 years old. Ma. Cristina is the group leader for a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ma. Cristina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising and fattening pigs for sale. Ma. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP every four months for this kind of activity.

In 2008, Ma. Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. has already requested a loan twice from Kiva through her membership of Kiva partner, ASHI. These loans have been of great benefit in growing and increasing the volume of fish she buys and resells at the town’s public market. Now, Cecilia intends to buy a motor fishing boat for her husband to manage since he has to borrow a fishing boat from their neighbor when he wants to go fishing.
Cecilia really hopes that her business growth continues. She wants to be able to increase her profits so that she can support the needs of her two children, especially her youngest who is still just a high school graduate. Once her business becomes profitable and sustainable, she feels she will have no need to worry about him anymore. Aside from her dreams for her business, Cecilia wants to use her business profits to complete the renovation of their house to make it a comfortable home and provide her family with a different kind of life.

loans.use: To purchase a motor fishing boat

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina M. is 54 years old and married to Diogracios, who is 64 years old and an electrician. She has four adult-aged children, and lives in Talim Island, Rizal province, in the Philippines. Rufina is a God-fearing and courageous mother. She and her husband have helped each other to overcome the poverty that impeded their family.
In 1997, Rufina joined Kiva partner, ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI in the Philippines, in order to acquire capital for her fishing business and embark on her bamboo set (furniture) making business. As a member of ASHI for almost 13 years, she has a remarkably good performance in her credit rating and is therefore being trusted by ASHI to obtain larger loans.
This loan is her fourteenth – she has made good use of her previous loans to expand her business and income. Rufina has applied for a new loan of 35,000 PHP to buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope, fish traps, and other supplies. The remaining money will be used in her bamboo set making business.
Rufina dreams of expanding her business into a fully-fledged fish farm. She also dreams of sending her grandchildren to school until they finish college and find good jobs. Until that dreams happens, she is happy with the way in which ASHI and Kiva have changed her family's life and given them a good possibility of making their dreams come true.

About ASHI
Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., or ASHI, has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen methodology to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. ASHI, as the first practitioner in the field, saw how poor women and mothers work hard to earn money for their family and provide their children with a better life. Since the microcredit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly in their villages on the doorsteps of their houses, these loans give the hope that someday they will “rise above poverty” (the English translation of 'Ahon Sa Hirap').

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope, fish traps, and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Sopha Sang Village  Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of fourteen people, all of whom are villagers in Kampong Svay Leu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sopha S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the group members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mrs. Sopha S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow brown sapote and vegetables, which she sells to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Yoeurn Y., is a construction worker. In growing brown sapote, Mrs. Sopha S. has a problem because the field has a lot of insects and she does not have enough money to address this problem. Therefore, she has decided to ask for loan to buy pesticide to protect her field. With the rest of the loan she would like to build a toilet for personal use. Mrs. Sopha S. is a mother of five children – one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pesticide

Marie Gay Rose is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh loan from ASKI. About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela S. is from the village of Maguikay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Estela owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products, such as bamboo chairs (as seen in the picture), to local businesses and community members. Estela has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Estela joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Estela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie R., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Geraldo R., a tricycle driver, she is blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been a tricycle operator for quite some time now.
Lennie has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she is now able to borrow quite a few times more from CCT’s cooperative. Lennie is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her tricycle business.
Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying new tires and paying for a tune-up for the tricycle. Lennie dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy new tires and pay for a tune-up for the tricycle

loans.name: Mr. Chorn Chel Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank is made up of fourteen people who are villagers in Kampong Svay Leu village in Kandal province. Mr. C. C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use their loan for different purposes. He is a tobacco seller door-to-door and his wife, Mrs. Lai Heng Lort, is a brown 'sapote' (fruit) seller and besides this, she is a pig breeder as well. 

However hard they try to work with their businesses, they can earn only a little income because they do not have enough money to support their piglets. Thus, in order to improve their family's living conditions, Mr. C. C. decided to seek a loan to buy pig feed for breeding pigs. He is a father of four children who are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for breeding pigs

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
The loans Adelina requested and has received from ASHI since she joined in 2008 have opened her mind to discover a lot of things she needs to develop within herself in order to become an entrepreneur.  One is the realization that she is very lucky to have access to loans and increase her business capital. This is important to her because being a poor person who does small business, gaining her neighbors’ trust to lend her money is difficult. Before ASHI, her life, along with her 67-year-old husband's, was never easy. All of their children have their own family now and they can’t even support their family’s own needs. 

Therefore, Adelina and her husband agreed to request for a loan from Kiva through ASHI to be able to sustain and grow their small vegetable-selling business. They also chose their own terms of payment according to their capacity to pay since both of them are already old. However, despite their age, they still want to do business because this is their only way to support their own needs, especially for their medicines and body supplements.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

Thirteen people who all live in Kampong Svay Leu village in Kandal province have made up this village bank loan. Mrs. Savry S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use their loan for different purposes.

Her husband, Mr. Bory Koev, is a cigarette seller who can earn only a little money to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.name: Rachabali

texts.ru: Одинаев Рачабали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 23 года. Холост. Высшего образования не имеет. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупно- рогатого скота. Имеет небольшой коровник. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этот вид деятельности приносит доход. Животноводством занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Rachabali O. lives in the Yavan district. He is 23 years old and single. He does not have a higher education. Rachabali earns a living by breeding cattle. He has a small cowshed. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. This business brings him an income. Rachabali has been involved in animal husbandry for 2 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en:
Davaasambuu is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house which they own. His older child, a daughter, is at university and his son is in secondary school. His wife, Otgon, currently operates a small construction business. 

Davaasambuu operates a Korean spare auto-parts trading business at a local market in the city. He started his business in 2005 and has built a successful operation with a loyal customer base. Today, his working capital exceeds 3,500,000 tugrugs (~ 2463 USD) and his daily revenues average 50,000 – 150,000 tugrugs (~ 35 – 105 USD). 

Davaasambuu is a very hard-working person and has many plans for the future. He says  “I would like to one day open my own shop so that I can financially support my children when they go to university." He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~ 1760 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of spare parts such as doors, lights, etc.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg is 37 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house which they own. Her son currently attends a local high school. 

Erdenechimeg operates a second-hand products trading business with her husband at a counter at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. She and her husband sell a variety of second-hand products such as clothes and blankets. Erdenchimeg started her business in 2003 and has had steady growth over the years. Today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs (~ 2111 USD) and her daily profits average between  10,000 – 20,000 tugrugs (~ 10  USD). 

Over the years, she has gained great business experience and she has used her earnings to support her family and grow her business. Erdenechimeg is a very hard-working and hopes to continue her success in the future. She says, “My dream is to purchase a larger house for my family.” She is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~ 2465 USD) loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sina Chann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina C. is the village bank president who has been selected by eleven members; they will each use their loan for different purposes.  They have made a village bank loan in Pou Ta Pang village in Kandal province. Thus, in order to improve family living conditions, Mrs. Sina C. decided to ask for a loan to grow vegetables in this current year. loans.name: Zulhumor Musaeva's Group

texts.ru:
Мусаева ЗУлхумор 44 года. Она замужем и воспитывает одну дочь. Ее супруг выехал в Россию на заработки. Зулхумор вместе с дочерью работает в кафе. В данное время она работает как наемный работник, полученный кредит она планирует чтобы открыть собственный аналогичный бизнес. Имеется договоренность об аренду соответствующего помещения. Это все позволит ей существенно увеличить свою прибыль.

Муборакхон, 20, лет, пока не замужем. Она проживает вместе со своими родителями. Муборакхон занимается пошивом дорогих штор, женской и мужской одежды на дому. Этому ремеслу она научилась у матери. Кредит будет использован для закупа материалов для шитья штор. 

Халмамахату 53 года. Он женат и отец 13 летней дочери. Его супруга работает в городской больнице санитаркой. Клиент занимается услугой пассажирских перевозок. Кредит планирует использовать кредит для оформления документов своего пассажирского транспорта. 

Бузайнапу 23 года. Она замужем, супруг занимается реализацией ТНП/ продуктов питания. Сама же клиент занимается реализацией женской одежды:кофты, блузки, топики. Товар ей привозят с Бишкека. Кредит будет использован для расширения женского ассортимента продукции. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zulhumor M. is 44 years old. She is married and raising one daughter. Her husband went to Russia to find work. Zulhumor together with her daughter work at the cafe. At this time she works for hire and wants to use the loan to open her own similar business. She already has an agreement to rent out a corresponding space. This will help to significantly increase her profits. Muborakhon is 20 years old, she is not married. She lives with her parents. Muborakhon makes and sews drapery, women's and men's clothing from home. She learned this skill from her mother. The loan will be used to buy fabrics for sewing of drapes. Halmamahat is 53. He is married and is a father of a thirteen year old daughter. His wife works as a nurse at the town hospital. He provides transportation services. He plans to use the loan to get all the paperwork in order for his passenger transport business. Buzaynap is 23 years old. She is married, her husband sells food products. She sells women's clothing such as sweaters, blouses, tops. The merchandise comes from Bishkek. The loan will be used to expand the variety of women's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start up new cafe business

loans.name: Mrs. Try Toar Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Pou Ta Pang village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Try T. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She and her husband, Mr. Sophat P., are farmers who hire a piece of land to grow vegetables which they sell to support their family living.

This family has a problem because it’s the season to farm their vegetable field. Thus, in order to improve their production of vegetables, Mrs. Try T. decided to ask for a loan to grow vegetables this season.

Mrs. Try T. is the mother of four children, who are all in different employment such as laborer, seamstress, and chef.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Zurahan Karmyshakova's Group

texts.ru:
Зурахан 60 лет. Она уже на пенсии вместе со своим пенсионером. Вместе с ней также проживают сын и невестка. Все они занимаются сельским хозяйством, а именно полеводством и животноводством. Сейчас они заняты подготовкой к весенней посевной, подготавливают землю для посева картофеля. Кредит нужен для закупа семян и удобрений, а также оплаты работы наемных крестьян. 

Айысте 47 лет, она замужем. Она мать 3 детей:2 сына и дочь. Дочь замужем, а сыновья с отцом работают строителем. У них земельный надел где выращивают овощи. Кроме этого ее дочь занимается реализацией произведенного молока и молочных продуктов. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 500 кг азота- удобрений. 

Уркия, 33, замужем. Ее супруг работает водителем в России. У нее 5 детей: старшему 14, а младшему 1 годик. Она занимается выращиванием овощей и фруктов. У нее есть парник, где посажены лук и помидор. кредит нужен для весенних полевых работ. 

Парида, 41. У нее 4 детей. Супруг работает таксистом в столице Кыргызстана- Бишкеке. Она как и другие члены группы занимается полеводством, в данное время готовит землю к посеву картофеля. Кредит запрашивается для закупа семян картофеля. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zurahan is 60. She is already retired together with her husband. Their son and his wife also live with them. They all do farming mainly working in the fields and animal husbandry. Currently they are busy with preparation for spring sowing and getting the land ready for sowing of potatoes. They need the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for work of hired help. Ayista is 47, she is married. She is a mother of three children: two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is married and the sons work in construction with their father. They have a plot of land where they grow vegetables. Additionally her daughter sells produced milk and milk products. The loan is needed to buy 500 kilograms of nitrogen fertilizer. Ukriya is 33, she is married. Her husband works as a driver in Russia. He has five children: her oldest one is fourteen, and her youngest child ins one years old. She grows fruits and vegetables. She has a greenhouse where she planted onions and tomatoes. She needs the loan for spring planting season. Parida is 41 years old. She has four children. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the capital of Kyrgystan, Bishkek. She also works in the fields as other group members and at this time she is preparing the soil for sowing of potatoes. She is asking for a loan to buy potato seeds.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald D. is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old and is single. Ronald works in a business operating motor transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ronald joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his fourth from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Sokheoun Leng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Pou Ta village in Kandal province, this is a village bank loan consisting of thirteen people. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sokheoun L. is the village bank leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family.

Her husband, Mr. Sophorn Laut, is a plow laborer in the local village. In this activity, they have a problem because their oxen are plowing a lot of places, and the oxen do not find it easy to relax because they do not have a place for their oxen. Thus, Mrs. Sokheoun L. decided to ask for a loan to build a stall for breeding oxen.

Mrs. Sokheoun L. is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local public school and the other is too young to work or go to school.

loans.use: To build an ox stall for breeding oxen

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house which they own. Her oldest son, Uuganbileg, attends a local secondary school and her husband is currently unemployed.

Tserendulam operates a business in her town making gold and silver goods. She started her business in October 2009 and has quickly made progress. Before opening her business, and to gain experience in her trade, she received three months training from her friend, who operates a similar business. She has since built a successful operation with a loyal customer base.

Tserendulam has many plans for the future and hopes to improve the design and selection for her customers. She is a very hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good communication skills. Her business is very important for her and she says “I will work hard to expand my business in the future.”

Tserendulam is requesting a 620,000 tugrug loan to purchase equipment such as jewelry molds for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her business

loans.name: Agapita's Group

texts.en:
Agapita O. is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 50 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Agapita is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like, shampoo, soap, coffee, noodles, eggs, salt, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Agapita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Agapita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma F. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 27 years old and is married. Felma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruit like water melon and pomelo (a citrus fruit) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Felma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Felma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kudayberdieva Nurbu`s Group

texts.ru:
Нурбу 52 года, она замужем уже более 30 лет. У нее есть 7 детей. Самому старшему 33, а самому младшему 21. Ее муж занимается строительными работами. Она занимается откормом и разведением домашнего скота. В бизнесе ей помогает супруг. Кредит запрашивается для вспахивания земельного участка, закупка удобрений и 5 баранов. 

Хуруниса, 48, вдова. Она воспитывает 6 детей. Клиент вместе с детьми занимается сельским хозяйством, а именно выращиванием риса, пшена. Земельный надел расположен около ее дома. Кредит запрашивается для покупки и перепродажи скота. 

Гулжан 48 лет. Она замужем и мать 8 детей. Ее супруг работает строителем. Клиент занимается полеводством: выращиваниет риса, пшена и картофель.  Кредит запрашивается для покупки 100 кг семян картофеля, 200 кг удобрений и на посев. 

Зулайхо, 39, замужем. Супруг занимается частным  извозом по маршруту Узген-Ош. Она занимается выращиванием табака и риса. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 1990 года, с момента развала СССР. Кредит запрашивается для строительства парника, где она собирается выращивать перец, помидоры и лук. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nurbu is 52 years old. She has been married for over 30 years and has 7 children. The oldest is 33, and the youngest is 21 years old. Nurbu’s husband does construction work. Nurbu is involved in livestock fattening and breeding. Her husband helps her with this business. She is requesting the loan for plowing their plot of land, purchase of fertilizers and purchase of 5 sheep. Hurunisa is 48 years old and a widow. She is raising 6 children. The client and her children are involved in agriculture, specifically growing rice and grains. Her land plot is located near her house. Hurunisa is requesting the loan for the purchase and resale of livestock. Guljan is 48 years old. She is married and a mother of 8 children. Her husband works as a construction worker. The client is involved in farming. She grows rice, grains and potatoes. Guljan is requesting the loan for the purchase of 100 kg of potato seeds, 200 kg of fertilizers and for sowing. Zulayho is 39 years old and married. Her husband provides transportation services on the Uzgen-Osh route. She is involved in growing tobacco and rice. Zulayho has been in this business since 1990, from the moment the USSR broke apart. The loan will be used for building a greenhouse, where she will grow peppers, tomatoes and onions.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing land, purchase of fertilizers and purchase of 5 sheep

loans.name: Jantsanhuu

texts.en: Jantsanhuu is 61 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house which they own. They have been living there for the past 20 years. Jantsanhuu operates a carpentry business with the help of his wife and two sons at home. They manufacture a variety of wooden furniture. He and his two sons are responsible for the carpentry work and his wife paints the products. Jantsanhuu has been operating his business since 1994 after previously working as a musician at the local music center for 26 years. He has steadily grown and expanded his business into a successful operation over the last 16 years. He has gained much experience operating his business and has become an experienced wood craftsman. Jantsanhuu is a very open-minded person and is working hard to continue his success into the future. He has been planning to expand his production line to include full carved furniture used in gers, which are traditional Mongolian tent homes. He says, “My life is going well. As it stands, I am concentrating on making effective use of the loan to reach my goals.” Jantsanhuu is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug loan to purchase necessary materials such as timber, nails and paint for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Liezyl owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling soft drinks, candies and soda in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Liezyl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Liezyl is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo O.'s main source of income comes from providing internet services in his community. He is 32 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the city of Arellano Extension, Tuguegarao City. Romeo has been in his business for over four years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from ASKI. He is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be his third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mahmudchon

texts.ru: Одинаев Махмудчон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Махмудчон подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Махмудчон создал все условия для продвижения своего бизнеса. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mahmudchon O. lives in the Yavan district. He is 37 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Mahmudchon works as a construction worker for-hire. Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. Mahmudchon created all of the conditions for moving his business forward. He wants to expand his business and improve his family's financial situation. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kuanputun A Group

texts.en:
Kuanputun A is a group of nine farmers from Bone Village – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara. This group is led by Oktofianus J., who is 30 years old. Oktofianus was born to a farming family. He is married and has been blessed with a cute daughter, Nadia, who is 3 years old. Oktofianus only has secondary education as his childhood was mostly spent on the farm rather than at school. He loves farming.

Oktofianus and his family live in a modest house. As a farmer, he relies on agriculture for income to meet his family's needs. He plants vegetables, tomatoes, chilies, bananas and coconuts on the farm. According to Oktofianus, vegetables and tomatoes are the most important agricultural products that he harvests and sells to traders. He works on the farm from 6 am to 4 pm every day. As the breadwinner, Oktofianus has to work hard to generate more income to provide his family, especially his daughter, with sufficient and nutritious food. 

Oktofianus says that he doesn’t have to sell his agricultural products at the market since his customers come to buy directly from him. His customers mostly come from Inpres Market which is situated about 37 km from Bone Village. They usually come to buy his crops every two weeks. The income that he generates is unstable. He can generate up to 600,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) over a two week period. 

Oktofianus has a goal to improve his family's standard of living, but he only has limited skills. He faces difficulties in meeting his family’s daily needs as food and other necessities are quite expensive at the market. This situation drives him to find other ways to better meet his family's needs.  Recently he heard information about the TLM Cattle Fattening Program that assists poor farmers like him. He is interested in joining the program as he has fertile land where the grass grows well for cattle food.

Oktofianus is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 IDR to buy a young cow to be fattened over a 12 month period. Just like Oktofianus, the other group members are also requesting loans to buy young cattle so they can improve their quality of life.

Note: Melkianus and Lodia were replaced by their family members when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita M. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Juanita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling candies, some snack foods, eggs, cooking oil, vinegar, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Kuanputun B Group

texts.en:
Kuanputun B is a group of eight members in Bone Village – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. It is situated about a one-and-a-half-hour drive from Kupang City. The community supports their family needs by farming and selling the agricultural products in the market.

This group is led by Natalia J., a 24-year-old lady. She was born and grew up in Bone Village. Because her parents are poor, Natalia only has a secondary education. She lives with her parents in a modest house. Natalia has two brothers and one sister: Antonius J., who is in Elementary School Grade 5; Bartasar, who is in Elementary School Grade 3; and Margarita, who is not at school yet. Her family relies on the agriculture sector to meet their daily needs. 

As the eldest child, Natalia usually helps her father on the farm as her mother is recently unwell and her siblings are still too young to help her father on the farm. Natalia is a diligent girl; she usually spends her day on the farm, helping her father from 11 a.m. up to 4 p.m. Natalia and her father plant vegetables, cassavas, tomatoes and then water the coconut and banana trees. She also cuts dried leaves to make the plants grow well. She usually sells the agricultural products in the Inpres Market in Kupang City every Tuesday and Thursday. It is situated about 37 km from Bone Village. She usually gives the income she generates to her father to meet their daily needs and her brothers’ education costs. The income that she generates from selling the agriculture products is unstable, between IDR 300,000 to IDR 450,000 per week depending on how many crops she can harvest from the farm. 

With the difficulties that Natalia and family face, she got information from the TLM Field Officer about the cattle-fattening program. As a poor farmer, Natalia doesn’t have enough capital to buy young cattle. She is very interested in joinging the Cattle Fattening Program. Natalia is optimistic that she can fatten the cattle well as she has cattle feed available on the farm that belongs to her father. Natalia dreams of improving her family's living standards and supporting her siblings’ education. 

Natalia is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,200,000 to buy a young cow to be fattened over a 12-month period. Natalia is sure that the loan will provide her and the other group members with benefits in the future.

Note: Elias and Taroci were replaced by their family members when the picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina I. is a young and vibrant woman. At her age of 23 years old, she can already imagine herself not just a plain housewife of her fisherman husband and a mother to their only child but as a successful businesswoman. She became more excited with her vision when she joined ASHI, a Kiva partner, recently. For her, it is not impossible to achieve because she can obtain a loan once she requests it. Despite being poor, she believes in her capacity to pay back because the loan she will be receiving will be used in a business. Aside from the fact of having her own business and profit to support the needs of her family, especially her only 3-year-old child, Gina will also be able to improve her personality by gaining high self-esteem.

The loan Gina is requesting from Kiva through ASHI will be used start up a fish vending/selling business. It was her husband and neighbors who inspired her for doing such business because she saw from them that despite small capital, they can earn income and can provide cash flow for the family. It is more salable compared to other products because food is one of the basic needs of people.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell directly to people

texts.en:
Honey Fe G. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Honey Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as snack food, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Honey Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Honey Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

Natividad owns and operates a business offering motor transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from GDMPC. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Alima Farida Group

texts.en:
Anis Gull is the group leader of the Alima Farida group. She lives in District 15 of Kabul Afghanistan. She is married with six children who are all school students. She is a hard working woman and has a shared business with her husband. Her husband sells vegetables and fruits in a cart in the market. 
She buys the fresh vegetables and fruits at low prices and then cleans them all and packs them too. Then her husband sells them at a very good price.
They are very glad to be working together and supporting their children. She needs the loan to purchase different kinds of vegetable and fruits, especially the ones that are more in demand in the market. She hopes this shared business will grow in the future and she will be able to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa B. is from the city of Garang, Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Elsa is widowed and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of products such hair accessories, umbrella, and some of kitchen utensils in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Mrs. Yoeng Yorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 10 people who are villagers in Pou Ta Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yoeng Y. is the village bank president. She was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who rents a small piece of land to grow vegetables to sell to support her family. Aside from this, she is also a farm laborer and her husband, Mr. Da Phorn, is a chef. Through this activity, the couple supports six children. Two of the children are laborers and the others are enrolled in the local public school. In order to improve her vegetable production, Mrs. Yoeng Y. decided to ask for a loan to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Candida's Group

texts.en:
Candida G. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 60 years old. Candida is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Candida is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Candida owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Candida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Candida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Candida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Мавлонов Мурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Имеет среднее образование. Одновременно занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет увеличить количество скот.
texts.en:
Murod M. lives in the Yavan district. He is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. He does construction work for-hire. Murod has a secondary education. He is also involved in animal husbandry and primarily fattens and sells livestock. He has been working in this field for over 10 years. Murod wants to use this loan to increase the livestock quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina T. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V. is from Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya Province. She is 41 years old. Evelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Obidullah Group

texts.en: Fozia is a member of Obidullah group. She lives in the fifteenth district of Kabul, Afghanistan and is married with three children — 12, 8, and 4. She has a bakery in her house and is famous for the bread she bakes, so she has lots of clients every day. She would like this loan to buy flour, fire wood, etc. for her business. Fozia is glad that, through her business, she can help support her children by buying notebooks and pens for their school. She wants her children be educated and also to  grow her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Vary Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vary K. is the leader of a fourteen-person loan group in Pou Ta Pang village in Kadanl province. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Sau Lay, is a construction worker. They have two school-age children. The family has a problem because their step is too old to use so Mrs. Vary K. is asking for a loan to build a new step.

loans.use: To build a new step

loans.name: Mfano Group

texts.en: Zainabu  C., 45, is  married with three children aged 22, 17 and 13. She has had a clothes shop for six years where she works from 6.30 am to 6pm daily, earning a monthly profit of about $104. This will be Zainabu’s first loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. With it she hopes to open a general store. Zainabu will share the loan with her 17-member loan group, Mfano. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. Zainabu is second from the left in the first row, wearing a green dress.

loans.use: To  buy more clothing for her store

texts.en:
Abdull Qader G. A. is the leader of Halima Rahima group. He is thirty-five years old and is married. He lives with his own family of eight members in Kabul, Afghanistan. He sells ice cream. He has been involved in this business for more then ten years. Now, he wants to repair his shop for the coming season of spring in Afghanistan, but he needs money to buy new chairs and tables for his shop and to organize it in the proper way.       
He hopes the loan will help improve his business and help with his family. He is very happy with this small-loan process in Afghanistan that helps the poor.

loans.use: To repair his shop for the spring and to buy new chairs and tables

loans.name: Adjouavi Charlotte

texts.fr: A. Adjouavi Charlotte est née le 17 Juillet 1978 et vit depuis 23 ans à Fidjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AMANDOU Sèmiou, un transitaire, Adjouavi Charlotte est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Adjouavi Charlotte vient en aide à son mari et contribue à assurer avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Adjouavi Charlotte a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a 15 ans, Adjouavi Charlotte mène comme activité la vente de tissus de façon ambulante dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Adjouavi Charlotte vend également des pâtes dentifrices. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Adjouavi Charlotte s'approvisionne. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Face à la demande multiple de sa clientèle, Adjouavi Charlotte sollicite un quatrième prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Charlotte A. Adjouavi was born on the 17th of July, 1978 and for the past 23 years she has lived in Fidjrossè Kpota, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Sèmiou Amandou, a forwarding agent. Charlotte Adjouavi was educated just to the high school level. For 15 years, Charlotte Adjouavi has had a business selling cloth throughout her neighborhood. In parallel with this business, Charlotte Adjouavi also sells toothpaste. Charlotte Adjouavi supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is an old client of ALIDé, having benefitted from three loans, all of which she properly repaid. In order to handle the needs of her clientele, Adjouavi Charlotte is requesting a fourth loan, which she will use in order to strengthen her business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cloth and toothpaste

loans.name: Bangelyn

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Bangelyn C. has been selling fish directly to people around her village and raising chickens in her backyard since the time she first received a loan from ASHI. Her husband is a fisherman, but he seldom goes fishing because he doesn’t have his own fishing boat. He has been borrowing their neighbor’s boat when it is not being used. Bangelyn realized that her family's profit is much bigger when her husband makes a good catch. That is why she hopes that someday, through the loan she would receive, she will be able to buy her husband his own fishing boat to manage. She also wants her small backyard poultry business to grow and become profitable enough to act as a source of income to support the needs of her two children, a three-year-old and a ten-year-old. 

To market her chicken, Bangelyn plans to sell them to meat vendors in the market once she can finance a bigger poultry business. For now, she is happy selling her own chickens to people around her village and to those she knows from other villages.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and chicks for a poultry raising business.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pov H. is 45 years old and the leader of a four-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Boeng Khpob village in Kandal province. The members of the group will use the loan for different purposes.  Mrs. Pov H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Song Hok, is a construction worker who can receive a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Pov H. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to support her crops. This couple has four children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other three are students in the local school and support their parent's business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Gull Nar

texts.en: Gull Nar, daughter of S., lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and her father has died. Her family has economic problems at home.  She has a shared business with her husband who has a fresh fruits and fresh vegetables shop and he needs money. His wife is taking a loan from AFS (Ariana Financial Joint Stock Company) for their shared business to buy more fruits and vegetables for the shop to make a good life for the family. She hopes to progress this shared business and wants to find close relationships with people to find more clients to make a better life for the children. Therefore, she requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani. With this loan, her husband wants to complete his stock and further the shared business to help their family and make a better life in Afghanistan for all the family.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom B. is 44 years old and lives in Roka village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing crops. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chhoum, is a construction worker who can earn a small income to support his family. Although they try to work hard with their different business, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom B. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.name: Marcelino Jose

texts.pt:
Marcelino José C. nasceu na cidade de pemba, Província de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique tem 59 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 18 e 15 anos de idade, todos vã a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe e parou quando foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Pomba para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar, e depois de reformar não voltou mais para sua terra natal. Ė Pensionista do Ministério da Defesa Nacional a mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e recebe uma pensão mensal de 4.089.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua casa.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do chefe do seu bairro. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, blocos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra de construção da sua residência. O empréstimo anterior foi de 7.200.00mt para a mesma actividade.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com a construção da sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelino José C. was born in the city of Pemba, Cabo Delgado Province, in northern Mozambique. He is 59 years old, married, and father to two children, ages 18 and 15. Both go to school. Marcelino only finished fourth grade and quit when he was drafted into military service. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his nieces and nephews, who live with him. Marcelino left Pemba for Maputo while completing his military service, and after his discharge he did not return to the land of his birth. He has received a pension from the National Defense Ministry for more than ten years. He has no employees and receives a monthly pension of 4,089 meticais, which he uses for household expenses and sometimes saves some money at home. Marcelino has never taken out loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through the head of his neighborhood. This is his second loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, iron, blocks, sand and other materials) to keep building his home. The previous loan was for 7,200 meticais and was used for the same purpose. In the future, he wants to ask for more loans so he can continue building his house and can furnish it. For this reason, he promises to pay off this loan promptly.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, iron, blocks, sand and other materials)

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yuon Y. is 56 years old and she lives in Krang Roluos village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Chey, are farmers who own a 1.50 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Savoeun Chey is a palm juice collector from sugar palm, earning a small income to support his family.

Mrs. Yuon Y. is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming and to buy bamboo and firewood to support her husband's business. Mrs. Yuon Y. is the mother of three children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the last one is an electrician. 

Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to buy bamboo and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fazila Musafer Group

texts.en:
Fazila is the daughter of M. M. and the leader of the Fazila M. group. She lives with her family of six in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is single and has an embroidery business. She works hard to support her family. 

Fazila wants buy a new machine and other necessary things for her embroidery business. She plans to pay her loan on time. She would like to thank everybody who helps with loans in Afghanistan and other poor countries.

loans.use: a machine and other supplies for her embroidery business

loans.name: Titos Carlos

texts.pt:
Titos Carlos C. nasceu na Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 50 anos de idade casado e pai de 1filho de 6 anos de idade, vai a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um enteado que vive com ele.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo afim de se formar como pedreiro, mais tarde começa a trabalhar uma empresa como serralheiro, possui uma experiência nesta área trabalha já há mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado, tem um salário de 4.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, pedra, ferro, barrotes e outros) para proceder com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.500.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt todos foram aplicados para área de comércio.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimo para concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Tito Carlos was born in the Gaza Province, South of Mozambique. He is 50 years old, married and the father of a 6 year-old who is in school. He only went to school until the 6th grade due to lack of financial resources. He lives with his family in his own house and supports a stepson who lives with him. He left Gaza to go to Maputo to learn how to be a mason. He later started working for a company as a locksmith. He has 10 years of experience in that area. He does not have any employees. He earns 4.000.00mt per month that goes to household expenses and a savings account. He has never requested loans from other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through his neighbors who are also partners of the bank. This loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt is his fourth. He intends to buy building materials (sand, stone, iron, beams and others) in order to continue to build his home. The previous loans were for 7.500.00mt, 10.000.00mt and 10.000.00mt and were all applied towards trade. In the future, he would like to request more loans to finish his construction and provide better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (sand, stone, iron, beams and others)

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is 29 years old and married with three children, ages 4, 7, and 9. The two oldest currently attend school. She owns and operates a farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where she has been farming for over five years. Her primary income comes from the sale of maize and beans. She also sells vegetables at her small stand in town. She says that the main challenge right now is competition with selling her goods and at times some of her produce spoils.

Janeffer has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing two loans of KES 10,000 and KES 20,000. She is requesting this loan for KES 35,000 to further diversify her farming operations and expand her poultry project. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet her family's basic needs and also enable her to see her children through school. In the future, Janneffer would like to purchase more land and also open her own grocery store so she can earn more money.

loans.use: diversify her farm and expand her poultry project

loans.name: Sron

texts.en:
Mrs. Sron C. is 59 years old and lives in Toul Doun Kam village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Seakhai Hort, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living for their family. In addition, Mr. Seakhai Hort is a fisherman who can make a little income to contribute to the family's living. 

Mrs. Sron C. is requesting a loan to buy fishing supplies to support her husband's fishing business. Mrs. Sron C. is a mother of two and both of her children are teachers.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Kanvenkoto Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
W. Justine is a 39-year-old married female with four children, all going to school. She has been in the retail business for the last nine years in Gwafu cell, Mukono.

In doing this business, Justine has to grapple with a number of challenges including a limited capital flow. However, with her good customer care skills she has been able to discern some small improvements. For example, she says she usually makes almost 40,000 UGX a week.

Justine is optimistic she will be able to open up a boutique and provide for all her children’s education needs under the auspices of this loan system.

Justine appears at the top left in the small photo and also in the group photo.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items for her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old and married with 3 children. Her eldest child is 17 years old while the youngest is six years old. Her children still attend school and she hopes to give them all a quality education.

Mary sells bags of charcoal at retail prices to her customers in Ibadan, Oyo state. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is also happy because during the rainy season her sales of charcoal will increase. She hopes to be a major distributor of bags of charcoal in her community in the future. Mary is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mrs. Vuthy S. is 35 years old and lives in Preak Phum village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder, earning a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, therefore she has decided to ask for a loan to buy 10 additional piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Hor Horn (pictured on the left), is a construction worker who helps to support his family on a small salary. The couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy 10 more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en:
Adeola is a 38 year old businesswoman, living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is married and blessed with 3 children.

Adeola sells soft drinks to her retail customers to make a living. She has been in this business for 8 years and has used the proceeds to save and assist her husband in caring for their children’s needs and education.

Adeola would like to see great improvement in her business, therefore she is requesting a loan for the amount of NGN 70, 000 to purchase more drinks. This will attract a bulk-discount, in order to increase her sales and profit. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions. Adeola says thank you in anticipation of such a loan being granted to her.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Zulfa Elias

texts.pt:
Zulfa Elias M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 46 anos de idade solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de 28, 24, 21 e 16 anos de idade, destes os 2 últimos vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe e não continuou devido a doenças espirituais. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta a sua nora que vive com ela.
Nunca mudou de cidade, sempre viveu em Maputo com os seus pais. Tem um negócio próprio desde o ano de 2005, possui um empregado que lhe auxilia no seu negócio. Consegue um rendimento em media de 300.00mt por dia, equivalente a cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa cerca de 1.500.00mt por mês na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de negócios que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, hamburgueses, ovos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade e diversificar o produto.
