O empréstimo anterior foi de 9.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o crédito para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimo para abrir um novo estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Zufa Elias was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name. She is 46 years old, single and the mother of 4 children who are 28, 24, 21 and 16 years-old. The youngest two are in school. She only went to school until the 4th grade due to emotional problems. She lives with her children in her own house and supports a daughter-in-law who lives with her. She has never left Maputo, has always lived there with her parents. She has had her own business since 2005 and has one employee who helps her with it. She has an average income of 300.00mt per day, equivalent to 9.000.00mt per month which goes to household expenses. She also puts 1.500.00mt into a savings account. She has never requested loans from other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through her business associates who were already partners of the bank. This loan, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, is her second. She intends to buy supplies (beer, sodas, hamburgers, eggs and others) in order to increase the quantity and diversify her products. The previous loan was for 9.000.00mt applied towards the same activity. She is committed to duly paying her loan in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans to open another business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (beer, sodas, hamburgers, eggs and others)

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun S. is a widow with three children, living in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. Two of her children attend the local school while the youngest one is 4 years old.

Mrs. Khoeun S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living for herself and her family. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 Riels from AMK to buy corn seed, sesame seed and fertilizer to support the growth of her crops.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, sesame seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Oladayo

texts.en:
Oladayo is 35 years old and married with four children, living in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. Her children attend school and this gives her great joy, as she hopes they become graduates in the future.

Her husband sells bags of cement to support their family, while she sells foodstuffs and groceries. Oladayo hopes to grow her business and is requesting a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sophie Nadiathe

texts.fr: V. Sophie Nadiathe est née en 1975 à Abomey dans le département du Zou au Bénin. Mariée à ZABADA Nicolas un chauffeur, Sophie Nadiathe est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Sophie Nadiathe vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Kowégbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs 15 ans que Sophie Nadiathe s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Sophie Nadiathe a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour assurer toutes ses charges, Sophie Nadiathe vend depuis près de 20 ans, divers produits (ustensiles de cuisine, produits de toilette, bombons, biscuits, tissus, habits, etc.), de façon ambulante. Sophie Nadiathe s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Lomé au Togo. Sophie Nadiathe est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu trois crédits et qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans l'optique d'agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sophie Nadiathe sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Sophie Nadiathe ambitionne plus tard acquérir une parcelle, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité.
texts.en:
Sophie Nadiathe V. was born in 1965 in Abomey, within the district of Zou in Benin. She is married to Nicolas Zabada, who is a driver. Sophie Nadiathe is the mother of five children, all of whom are attending school. Sophie Nadiathe lives with her children and husband in the neighborhood of Kowégbo in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin. She has lived in this neighborhood for about 15 years. The couple take care of the needs of the family together. Sophie Nadiathe attended school just until high school. In order to take care of the their needs, for the past 20 years Sophie Nadiathe has sold a variety of products (cooking utensils, toiletries, candies, cookies, cloth, clothing, etc.) - she sells her goods throughout the town. Sophie Nadiathe supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also in Lome, in Togo. Sophie Nadiathe is an old client of ALIDé and she has previously received three loans, all of which were properly repaid. With a view to grow her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Sophie Nadiathe is requesting a new loan with ALIDé. Her ultimate goal is to use the profits from her business to purchase a parcel of land.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils, cartons of candies and cookies, and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Daniel Kiptui

texts.en:
Daniel Kiptui is a man of twenty six years, married and with two children aged two years and nine months respectively.

Daniel has been farming for the last seven years. He grows maize and passion fruit which he later sells after harvest to earn income. He sells the maize to his neighbors. He also runs a barber shop as a secondary income-generating business in his home area in Sergoit location, Eldoret. 

Daniel is a client of KADET and he has applied for a loan which he will use in his maize business.

Daniel's goal is to buy more land, own another barbershop in Eldoret town, feed his family and educate them too.

loans.use: To be used for maize farming

loans.name: Adesola

texts.en:
Adesola has a bakery where he bakes and sells loaves of bread at wholesale and retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He has been in this business for a long time and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain more customers.

Adesola is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more baking materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell. He hopes to own a classic bakery in the future.

Adesola is 32 years old and married with a child who is 5 years old and attends school. His wife also sells groceries to support their home. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials for his bakery

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mr. Chim A. is 52 years old and lives in Preaek Ta Ong Ti Pir village in Kandal province. He is a mechanic who is able to earn a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Yeoun Mean (shown on the right in the photo), is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows crops to earn income.

For his wife’s farming, Mr. Chim A. does not have enough money to support it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy gasoline and sesame seed, to pay for plowing, and to pay for renting the sesame field.

This couple has three children, one of whom stays at home and also supports the mother farming, another one is a soldier while the last one is a seamstress in the garment factory.

loans.use: To support his wife's farming

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria M. is a 34-year-old member of ASHI. She is the mother of three whose ages range is from 4 to 13 years old. She has a loving and supportive husband and is inspired by her husband’s determination to change their standard of living. Thus, she wants to do her part in earning money on his behalf to support the needs of their children.

Just last year, Victoria joined ASHI and was able to receive a loan which was used to operate her own hog/pig-fattening business. When she sold the pigs after four months of raising, the profit she earned from this business was fair enough. With that she was able to make a step towards achieving her goal for her family.

Presently, Victoria is requesting from Kiva a much larger loan so as to be able to grow her business further. She hopes that her profit will grow and she will be able to have enough savings to purchase a fishing boat for her fisherman husband. At present, in order for him to go fishing, he borrows a fishing boat from their neighbor when it is not being used.

Despite the present economic situation of her family which is very poor, Victoria is still optimistic that someday, through her business, their way of life will be changed and all of their children will graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Ngango 1 Women's Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. David is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a hardworking and friendly 42-year-old married man with three school-going children.

For the last six years, David has been selling agricultural produce. He operates his business at Igorora trading centre in Ibanda and he anticipates his business brings him close to 50,000 shillings a week.

One of the major challenges David has faced is competition from other traders although his strong points, like good customer care skills, enable him to succeed.

David needs a loan as he plans on expanding his business by buying more produce and thereby lifting his family out of the poverty trap.

loans.use: To buy more fresh produce to sell

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon P. is 55 years old and lives in Chrouy Pisei village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn for her family.

In order to support her crop-growing Mrs. Samon P. decided to ask for a loan to pay for plowing labor and the rest of the loan she will use to buy corn seed.

Mrs. Samon P. is widow with a child who is a seamstress in the garment factory.

loans.use: To pay for plowing labor and to buy corn seed

loans.name: Waheeda Habib Group

texts.en:
Habibullah son of M. R. is the leader of Waheeda Habib Group. He is 49 years old, married, and is the father of four children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Habibullah has a small shop from which he sells fresh fruit and vegetables in the city of Kabul. He needs a small loan for his business to make it strong and help his family.
 
Habibullah requested a loan to enlarge his business. He wants to expand and progress his business. Besides, he wants to buy necessary materials and complete his shop’s stock and continue working hard.

Habibullah is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank everyone invoved, especially the Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expend his business

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
Taiwo has a fashion design stall where he designs lovely Nigerian and Western patterns for his customers. He loves his business and he says that fashion designing is an interesting business because he makes his customers look beautiful in his designs.

Taiwo hopes to grow his business in future by having a fashion institute where he will train young boys and girls how to design clothes. He hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to boost his tailoring business.

Taiwo is 42 years old and is married with four children. His eldest child is 15 years old and the youngest child is 2 years old. His children attend school and this makes him happy. He duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to boost his tailoring business

loans.name: Folake

texts.en:
41-year-old Falake is a trader; she sells foodstuffs like yams, garri (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), eggs, etc. She has been in this trade for over eight years and she likes doing this business. She hopes to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs to sell.

Falake is asking for loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, e.g. tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc. In combination with what she has in her shop, this will improve her sales and attract more customers to her shop.

Falake is married and has four children. Her youngest child is 8 years old and they are doing fine in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Falake is a member of LAPO micro-finance with a good repayment record. She promises to repay her loan on its due dates. She thanks LAPO micro-finance and Kiva for this initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Bunchhoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunchhoeun P. is 58 years old and he is a villager who lives in Phlov Trei village in Kandal province. He is a teacher in the local school where he receives a small salary to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Rann Nov, is a mango middleman in the local market.

Mr. Bunchhoeun P. now is requesting a loan to purchase more mangoes to enlarge his wife’s business. With this loan, he hopes to increase her income to improve the family living conditions.

This couple does not have any children. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more mangoes for his wife's business

loans.name: Najmuddin

texts.ru: Абдулоев Нажмуддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Вместе с отцом занимается строительными работами. Короме того разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке. Животноводством занимается более 5 лет. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода. Кредит берет для закупа мелко- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Najmuddin A. lives in the Yavan district. He is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Najmuddin and his father do construction work. Besides this, Najmuddin breeds cattle at home. He buys young bulls, fattens and resells them at the market. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. This business is a sufficient source of income for Najmuddin. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Omotayo

texts.en:
Omotayo is 42 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is an accountant and he also supports their home.

Omotayo makes a living selling shoes and bags at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She loves this business because it is highly profitable and she has the opportunity to meet one-on-one with her customers.

Omotayo hopes to grow her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Savoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoen K. is 50 years old and is a villager who lives in Phlov Trei village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ol Nov, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Savoen K. is also a food and cucumber seller who earns a small income to support her family.

Mrs. Savoen K. is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her crop.

Mrs. Savoen K. is the mother of four children, three of whom are farmers who support their parents’ farming, while the other one is a student in the local school. Mrs. Savoen K.’s husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for her rice farm

loans.name: Rhonalyn's Group

texts.en:
Rhonalyn L. is from the village of Minien East, Santa Barbara, Pangasinan Province. She is 22 years old. Rhonalyn is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rhonalyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Rhonalyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rhonalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rhonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhonalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Rhonalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty makes a living selling shoes and bags at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell.

Betty loves this business because it is highly profitable and she has the opportunity to meet one-on-one with her customers. She hopes to grow her business.

Betty is 37 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 9 years old while the youngest child is 5 years old. Her children are still in primary school and they are making good progress and this gives her joy.

Betty says thank you to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a local rice farmer. She is 29 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are going to school. A source of family income comes from her husband who works as internal staff for a hotel.

The current income S. and her husband earn is not adequate to cover all their family's daily living expenses. S. desires to pursue another business by investing in pig-raising. Because she doesn't have capital yet to start this process, she requested a loan of $500 to buy piglets to begin raising.

loans.use: To buy piglets to begin raising

loans.name: Sènami T. Carine

texts.fr: K. Sènami T. Carine est née le 29 Juillet 1981 et vit depuis 27 ans environs à Vodjè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Carine est une célibataire qui est mère d'un enfant, scolarisé. Carine vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses différentes charges. Carine a fréqenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Mais depuis 13 ans, afin de se prendre intégralement en charge, Carine vend des tissus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou, que Carine achète ses produits. Carine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Carine reçoit des demandes de plus en plus importantes de la part de sa clientèle, mais elle n'arrive plus à répondre à toutes ces demandes. Dans le but d'augmenter le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face aux exigences des clients, Carine sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Carine Sènami T. K. was born on the 29th of July, 1981 and for the past 27 years she has lived around Vodjè, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Carine is single; she is the mother of one child, who is attending school. She lives alone with her child and takes care of her child's needs alone. Carine attended school just until high school. But for the past 13 years, in order to take care of her needs, Carine has sold cloth in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She purchases her products from the market of Missèbo in Cotonou. Carine is an old client of ALIDé and has already received 3 loans, all of which were properly repaid. Carine has growing requests from her clientele, but she has not been able to respond to all of their demands. In order to grow her business and to better respond to her client's needs, Carine is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is an entrepreneur who runs a business selling socks, women’s lingerie, tops, shirts and other clothing at Albion Market in her home town of Uzhgorod. Ildika has been in this business for fifteen years.

Ildika has loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her inventory and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. She earns about 5,000 UAH of net profit each month.

This year, besides clothing, Ildika began to sell honey. She purchases it in bulk from her friends who keep beehives and sells it retail. Her loyal customers enjoy buying some honey along with clothing.

Ildika is requesting a loan of 17,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She would like to purchase additional clothing for the spring season so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin P., 41, lives in a rural area of the province of Siem Reap. She and her husband currently make a daily income of $5 per day working as porters in the fish market. The couple has five children who are single; most of them are not long in school. To help respond to the family's needs, two of their children work as porters at the same place.

The family has been building their house for a long time but the construction process is never completed. That is why P. has decided to seek a loan to buy housing equipment to finish building their new house.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment to finish building their new house

loans.name: Tosin

texts.en:
Tosin is 29 years old and is married with a child who is 8 years old and attends school. Her husband sells clothes to support their home.

To make a living in Ibadan, Tosin sells bags and jewelry at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a bag factory in the future.

Tosin has a good relationship with Lift Above Poverty Organization. She is requesting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags and jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry and bags to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Akossiwa K. sells charcoal, beans, and corn outside her home in Lomé, Togo. She is married to a mechanic and has four children.

Mrs. K. began her business in 2008 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase sixteen sacks of charcoal to sell. This loan will help ensure that her customers have enough fuel to cook hot meals throughout the upcoming rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Doeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Doeurn R., 48, grows different kinds of crops and she sells the produce to buyers every three months when the crops mature.

Doeurn R. is the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local primary school. Her husband works as a temporary laborer and also works with her in the farming business.

To support the family's food requirements needs a little more income. Doeurn R. needs a loan to hire a machine to plow their farmland, on which she will plant her crop.

loans.use: To hire a machine to plow their farmland

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia S. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Delia owns and operates a business providing trisikad (a bicycle with a rider seat attached on the side) services used to transport passengers, a business managed by her husband in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose M., from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City, is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling soft broom and firewood to local businesses and community members. Mary Rose has operated her business for over 10 years, earning approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mary Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Gisèle vit depuis 19 ans environs à Cadjèhoun, un quartier de Cotonou. Gisèle est mariée à AMINOU Charles un photographe, et est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Gisèle vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Gisèle n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Gisèle vend divers produits de toilette à la devanture de sa maison. Gisèle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Gisèle exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Gisèle rembourse bien ses crédits. Gisèle voudrait renforcer son capital en vue d'agrandir et de diversifier son activité. Mais compte tenu du peu de ressources financières dont elle dispose, Gisèle sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin, Gisèle B. has lived in Cadjèhoun, a neighborhood of Cotonou, for the past 19 years. Gisèle is married to Charles Aminou, a photographer. She is the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. Gisèle lives with her children and her husband. The couple takes care of the family's needs together. Gisèle did not attend school. In order to take care of the family's needs, Gisèle sells a variety of toiletries from her home. Gisèle supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Gisèle has had this business for the past 8 years and she has received three loans from ALIDé. She has fully repaid all of her loans. Gisèle would like to strengthen her financial capital in order to grow and diversify her business. Due to the small financial resources at her disposal, Gisèle is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toiletries for resale

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Adijat, her husband, and their three children reside in Lagos where she bakes and sells bread and also owns a shop selling food items. She has been in these businesses for some years.

Adijat is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more baking items including flour and baking powder. This will enable her to bake more bread and meet the needs of her numerous customers, her dream being to expand the operation into a large business and improve her family's standard of living. Adijat says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support..

loans.use: To purchase more baking items.

loans.name: Earn

texts.en:
Mrs. Earn Y., 43 years old and married, has lived for years with other family members in a medium-sized wooden house in the Siem Reap Province. She earns a living selling fresh fish both in the local market and her village, acquiring her products from her husband's fishing or buying them from her wholesale suppler. Earn has six children, two of whom are employed.

In order to earn additional income, Earn is applying for a loan to buy pigs for her stall. She will use any remaining cash from the loan to mend her old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy pigs for her stall.

loans.name: Rafiu

texts.en: Rafiu, a resident of  Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, is 33 years old and single, but hopes to marry very soon. Rafiu loves his business because he is the only one in his community selling aluminum at retail prices to his customers, usually contractors building houses for people. His business is especially gratifying because he has the opportunity to meet and interact with his customers, and he hopes to expand in the future. Rafiu is now requesting a loan of N1000,000 to purchase more aluminum to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more aluminum to sell

loans.name: Hernando

texts.en:
Hernando M. is from the village of M., Gingoog City. He is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Hernando owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Hernando has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Hernando joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Hernando has decided to request a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a 60-year-old married man living near the town of Kitale, in western Kenya. He has twelve children, ranging in age from 15 to 30 years old, with three of them currently attending school.
Sammy has been running his mixed farm for over ten years now, and sells a wide variety of products at the market. His primary income comes from the sale of maize, beans, milk and eggs, while he also earns income from his ownership of a motorbike. He says that lately the main challenges to his business are the fluctuation in market prices and changes in climatic conditions, which negatively affect production.
Sammy is a new client of Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to start a poultry farming operation. He says that the extra income from this loan will ensure that his family's needs are well catered for. He has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years, and his main goal is to increase the number of dairy animals and poultry stock he owns, thus generating more income.

loans.use: To start a poultry farming operation

loans.name: Natalyia

texts.en:
Natalyia is divorced with two children – Ivan, who is 3 years old, and Yaroslav, who is 9 years old. She sells clothing at the local market in Khoost town as well as neighboring small towns. Natalyia has been in this business for four years and her income is 4,000 UAH per month.
Natalyia sells good quality clothing, and this attracts customers. This business is the only source of income for her family. She would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita Q. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling copra, or dried coconut, in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Nenita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oredibe

texts.en: Oredibe sells tires at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually friends and residents. She hopes to grow her business in the future by adding the sales of motor spare parts. She has been in this business for 4 years and she is experiencing progress in her business. She is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a good relationship with LAPO. (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN120,000 to purchase more tires to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tires to sell.

loans.name: Hayitali

texts.ru: Гулов Хайитали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 59 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хайитали занимается торговлей. Он привозит рис с других районов и продает в оптом на рынке. Одновременно занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль он намерен отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Hayitali G. lives in the Yavan district. He is 59 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Hayitali is involved in sales. He brings rice from other districts and sells it wholesale at the market. At the same time, he is involved in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. Hayitali has been in this business for over 6 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock and wants to use resulting profits to repair his house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia M. is from the village of Sto. Nino Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Aurelia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a furniture making business (wood, cabinet divider, doors and more) to local community members. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Dare

texts.en:
Dare is 41 years old and married with 3 children. His children attend school and they are excelling in school. Dare sells gas cylinders. His wife also sells sarongs to support their household. 

Dare is well known in his community. Demand for his cylinders is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more cylinders to sell. He hopes to grow and expand his business. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sao U. is a 48 year-old local farmer in the province of Siem Reap. She is married and blessed with five children. One of her children is married and the other four are going to school. 

Sao U.'s family depends on the income from her husband. He has musical instruments that he uses to provide an entertainment service. Sao U. and her family have trouble traveling anywhere because they don't have a vehicle. Sao U. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: D. Françoise est née en 1957 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Françoise réside depuis 12 ans au quartier Saint Jean à Cotonou. Mariée à COCOUVI Pierre, un dépaneur, Françoise est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble et le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Françoise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Dans le but de se faire de revenu pouvant l'aider à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Françoise mène comme activité la vente de tissus, de façon ambulante. Parallèlement, Françoise vend également des papiers hygiéniques. Françoise s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Françoise exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans et a déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé. Françoise n'a pas connu de grande difficulté dans le remboursement de ses crédits. Françoise sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Plus tard, Françoise ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Françoise D. was born in 1957 in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin. For the past 12 years, Françoise has lived in the neighborhood of Saint Jean in Cotonou. She is married to Pierre Cocouvi, a repairman. Françoise is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives together and the couple takes care of the family's needs together. Françoise did not attend school. With the goal of creating revenue to help take care of the family's needs, Françoise created a business selling cloth - she sells her goods throughout the town. Additionally, Françoise sells toilet paper. Françoise supplies herself in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Françoise has had this business for the past four years and she has already obtained four loans from ALIDé. Françoise has not had trouble repaying her loans. She is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé, in order improve her business and to better satisfy the needs of her clientele. Later on, Françoise's ultimate ambition is to open a store where she can sell her goods.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toilet paper and clothing for resale

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 58 years old and married with three adult children, ages 20, 29, and 35. Her youngest is still enrolled in school. She has been running her farm for over twenty years in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. Her primary cash crop is maize, which she sells at the local market. She says that the main challenge right now is the sharp fluctuation in market prices for her goods. 

Annah has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for 46,800 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet the family's basic needs. In the future, she would like to supply milk to the Kenya Cooperative of Creameries and reap the full benefits of increased milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa I. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Ma. Theresa is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling electronic load (mobile phone prepaid credits or airtime) in the local community. Ma. Theresa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Ma. Theresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Theresa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Theresa from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 46 years old and married with two children. His wife is a caterer and she also supports her husband in meeting the basic needs of their family. Moses is well-loved in his community, especially by children, because he sells ice cream. He sells his ice cream at retail prices to his customers. 

He hopes to expand his business. His greatest challenge is funds and he hopes to overcome the challenge.  He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more ice cream to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel M. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Maricel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maricel makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies like banana toron and hotcake bake sipao in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Maricel from HSPFI,a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en: Yanjmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. They have been living in their current home for five years. Yanjmaa's four children attend a local secondary school.  She operates a clothing trading business with her husband. Yanjmaa has been purchasing clothing from China, and reselling them to Russian border cities for a profit since 1997 and has steadily grown her business. Yanjmaa gained valuable experience in previous years, and her business stabilized. Furthermore, her sales revenue is quite good. She has been planning to rent a counter at a local market in Ulaangom soon.  Yanjmaa is an honest person who has a great business mind.  The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. Yanjmaa says, “My oldest daughter will enroll in a university next year. Therefore, I have to save money for my children's education.”  She is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase a variety of clothing from China to resell them to Russians for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, V. Philomène réside depuis une trentaine d'année à Sikècodji un quartier de Cotonou. Philomène est mariée à HAZOUNME François, un chauffeur. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Sikècodji. Philomène participe, avec son mari, à l'éducation et à l'alimentation des enfants. Philomène n'a pas été à l'école. Pour se prendre en charge et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Philomène mène comme activité la vente de tenues pour bébé à la devanture d'une maternité à Cotonou. De façon secondaire, Philomène vend également des parfums. Philomène s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Il y a près de 10 ans que Philomène exerce cette activité. Philomène a bénéficié une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et l'a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Philomène s'agrandit de plus en plus. Pour mieux les satisfaire et se faire plus de revenu, Philomène  sollicite un autre crédit en vue de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin, Philomène V. has lived in the Cotonou neighborhood of Sikècodji for the past thirty years. She is married to François Hazounme, a driver. The couple has three children in their care, two of whom are their biological children. Only some of the children attend school. The family lives together in Sikècodji. Philomène and her husband take care of the educational and nutritional needs of their children together. Philomène did not attend school. In order to take care of the needs of her children, Philomène started a business selling baby carriers from the a maternity store in Cotonou. As a secondary business, Philomène also sells perfumes. She supplies her business in Lome in Togo, the country next to Benin. Philomène has had this business for the past 10 years. She has received one loan from ALIDé and fully repaid the loan. Her clientele continues to grow more and more. In order to better satisfy the needs of her customer and increase her profits, Philomène is requesting a second loan with the view of strengthening her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase baby carriers and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 46 years old and married with four children. His children are excelling in school and this makes him happy. He sells clothes at retail prices to his customers in the market. He hopes to own a classic boutique in the future. He loves this business because his customers pay cash when they come to purchase clothes. He does not want to incur debt in his business. He is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. He duly says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en: Ablavi S. has been selling charcoal in the Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé since 2000. This location is always busy and ensures that demand remains high. She is now asking for her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to purchase 16 sacks of charcoal for resale. Mrs. S. is a widow and has five children. This loan will help her support both her business and her family.

loans.use: To purchase of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Pot

texts.en: Mrs. Pot S. M., 20, sells cooking ingredients and her husband, Mr. Mok Toch, 28, is a farmer. They both have a minor child who is dependent on their income. Recently Pot S. M. sold some of her grocery items.  She hopes to acquire more items to continue selling but she doesn’t have capital to buy more. Therefore, she is asking for loan in order to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Titi

texts.en: Titi sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to make a living. Sarongs in Nigeria are worn at all occasions and are mostly worn by women and young ladies. She hopes to be a major distributor of sarongs in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is 43 years old and married with three children. Her husband sells medicines to support their home. Titilayo is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Awa D.  est une aide-infirmière  au niveau de l’hôpital régional de Thiès. Elle est née en 1972 et c’est après sa formation en 1994 qu’elle a été recrutée dans cet hôpital. 
Elle est à sa troisième demande de prêt pour, dit-elle, régler des besoins personnels.Cependant, elle voudrait bénéficier d'un crédit d'urgence (produit de U-IMCEC mis en place pour faire bénéficier très rapidement un prêt inférieur ou égal à 150 000 fcfa à ses membres qui ont un revenu régulier).  Ainsi, Mademoiselle D. sollicitait 100 000 FCFA pour régler des charges d’électricité de la maison.
texts.en:
Miss Awa D. is a nurses' aide in the regional hospital of Thiès. She was born in 1972 and following her graduation in 1994, she was recruited to this hospital. She is requesting her third loan, in order to manage personal needs. She would like to receive an emergency loan (which the microfinance group U-IMCEC can offer its members with steady incomes very quickly for loans less than, or equal to 150,000 FCFA.) Therefore, Miss D. has requested a loan of 100,000 FCFA in order to pay for electricity for her home.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for electricity for her home

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, S. Mireille est mariée à SOGBOSSI Sylvin et est mère d'un enfant, scolarisé. Mireille a un autre enfant à sa charge. La famille vit ensemble à Cotonou et le couple assure les différentes charges familiales. Mireille n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a environs 5 ans que Mireille s'est mise dans la vente de vêtements et de produits de toilette à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Mireille vend du maïs. Mireille achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, mais elle s'approvisionne en maïs au Nord du Bénin. Mireille est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Mireille reçoit beaucoup de demandes et elle souhaite renforcer son activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est ce qui amène Mireille à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin, Mireille S. is married to Sylvin Sogbossi. She is the mother of one childr, who is attending school. Mireille also has another child in her care. The family lives together in Cotonou and the couple takes care of the family's needs together. Mireille did not attend much primary school. For about 5 years, Mireille has sold clothing and toiletries from her home. The second facet to her business is selling corn. Mireille purchases her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin; she purchases the corn in northern Benin. Mireille is an old client of ALIDé, having already received three loans, all of which were properly repaid. Mireille receives many requests and she hopes to strengthen her business by better responding to the needs of her clientele. It is for this reason that she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toiletries and clothing for resale

loans.name: Hatanbaatar

texts.en: Hatanbaatar is 33 years old and lives with his mother and sibling in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Hatanbaatar operates a religious trading business along with the consumer goods trading with his mother. In their business, his mother sells their goods and Hatanbaatar helps her with purchasing and transporting products. They started their business in 1995 and have steadily expanded their business. Hatanbaatar has been planning to continue this business in the future. Besides operating a religious articles trading business, he operates a taxi service business during the summer. Hatanbaatar is a very hardworking person who is very enthusiastic about the future. He says, “I would like to increase my business profit and purchase own plot of land with a yard and a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent for my family.” Hatanbaatar is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to increase his working capital for his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 36 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is a friendly and honest woman. She sells drinks at retail prices. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Jadambaa

texts.en: Jadambaa is 25 years old and lives with his wife and a son in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Jadambaa operates a carpentry business in his own yard. He started his carpentry business with his father in 2006, and successfully expanded the business with a loyal customer base. Jadambaa has gained experience in past years and he has good communication skills. He has been planning to expand his business and to create a carpentry workshop in the future. Besides his carpentry business, Jadambaa works as a plumber for a private company and earns monthly 120,000 tugrugs (~ 85 USD) from this job. He is a very hardworking person and says, “I would like to stabilize and expand my business.” Jadambaa is requesting a 550,000-tugrug loan to purchase more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mr. T. was born in 1965 and is a resident of Siem Reap province. He has a skill of making wooden furniture by hand, from which he earns a living. He is married but divorced his wife when his children were small. T. has eight children. Half of his children are married and the rest are single. He has a daughter who helps contribute to the family by selling a few groceries. T. needs a loan for his daughter to use as capital for her grocery sale enterprise.

loans.use: To use as capital for a grocery sale enterprise.

loans.name: Mui's Group

texts.en:
Mùi Thị Nguyễn is 31 years old. She is married with two school-aged children. She lives in Ngoc Loi village. Her husband is a carpenter at home. She helps him make doors, tables, chairs, beds, etc. They have a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND. She is the group leader of a six-member group loan from SEDA. In 2007, she has joined SEDA activities to again access to financial resources. Her loans, which were used to support her workshop, were always repaid punctually. For the next loan, she would like to borrow 5.014.000 VND to invest in her workshop (to buy wood, machine, etc) in the hope that it will make a profit so that her family can afford to buy more good furniture.

 About other borrower in her group:

 Man T. L. is 46 years old. She sells wood. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND for her small business.

 Ve T. N. is 27 years old. She has a workshop at home. She makes chairs, tables, beds, etc. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy wood.

 Lua T. N. is 24 years old. She sells vegetables in the market and breeds poultry. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy poultry feed.

 L. T. N. is 25 years old. She sells chickens in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to invest in her business.

 Huong T. L. D. is 22 years old. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her workshop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a businesswoman who loves selling groceries at retail prices to her customers and hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting  a loan of N50,000 from LAPO, with whom she has a good relationship, to purchase more groceries to sell. A 35-year-old mother of four children, Janet is married to a commercial driver who also supports their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hisayn

texts.ru: Аюбов Хисайн проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хисайн более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает мужскую одежду. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hisayn A. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 27 years old, married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Hisayn has been involved in retail sales for over 5 years. He has a store, where he sells men's clothing. This business brings in an income. Hisayn is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Frorah

texts.en:
Frorah, 62 years old, is married to Paul Mboko and they have five children who are all in college. She has been practicing dairy farming for eight years now in the town of Njabini.

Frorah was introduced to KADET by her friend, and this will be her sixth loan, her previous ones all having been repaid on time. She is planning to buy another cow with the loan, and she expects this purchase will lead to an increased milk output that will help her to meet customer demand. She hopes to become one of the leading local dairy farmers, selling up to 100 litres of milk per day.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Ayobami

texts.en:
Ayobami is a successful and hardworking woman. She is 45 years old with 3 children. Her husband is a businessman and works hard too to provide for his family's well being. She sells underwear and tailoring materials. She supports her husband in taking care of the home with her proceeds from the business. She has been in the business for over 15 years and she manages it with the support of her children. Her children are aged 4, 7, and 12 years old. 

Ayobami is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more underwear and tailoring materials to sell. She hopes to repay back her loan at the due date. She has been a member in LAPO microfinance for years. She thanks Kiva and LAPO for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Marie-Thérèse

texts.fr: D. Marie-Thérèse est née le 02 Octobre 1976 et vit depuis 8 ans à Sodjéatinmey, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie-Thérèse est mariée et mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Marie-Thérèse n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la couture. Marie-Thérèse a ouvert son atelier de couture dans son quartier et exerce pleinement cette activité. Parallèlement à cette activité, Marie-Thérèse vend des tissus dans son atelier. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Marie-Thérèse s'approvisionne. Marie-Thérèse est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Marie-Thérèse sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marie-Thérèse D. was born 2 October, 1976 and has been living for the past eight years in the Sodjéatinmey neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and mother of two children, both attending school. The couple share the handling of family expenditures. Marie-Thérèse has not been to school, but she has learned to sew. She opened a workshop in her neighborhood and now works full time at her trade. As a parallel activity, she sells fabrics in her workshop. She gets supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Marie-Thérèse is a steady ALIDé client, who readily reimburses her credit loans. She is now requesting another loan, to increase her stock supply and improve customer satisfaction.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Safarboy

texts.en:
Safarboy is an entrepreneurial man who lives with his wife and three children who all help him in the business of the production and sale of traditional bread, called “lepeshka”. He began his business in order to help with the household expenses, while also covering the costs of education for his children and their basic upkeep.

Safarboy began his business 4 years ago by selling from both his house and the market, and he already has an almost fixed clientele. At the same time, he provides taxi services during his free time. Safarboy is asking for a loan of $1500 to buy flour, coal for baking lepeshka, and spare parts to repair his car. Safarboy and his family thank you very much for the help which you give him in being able to follow through in creating his business and being able to continue with it in the future.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing flour to bake the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Tabe Sadat Group

texts.en:
Ali J., who is the son of A. J., is the group leader of Tabe Sadat group. He lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 41, and married with 5 children. He has a business of making handicrafts. He has been involved in this business for more than five years and is quite experienced. He is a responsible man and all of his family members benefit through the income he generates. He wants the loan to buy essential materials like silk cloth, beads, etc. to develop his business.
 
He hopes to be the best business dealer in the future and bring new changes to his business as well.

loans.use: To expand and develop his handicrafts business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a fashion designing stall, where she designs lovely Nigerian and western patterns for her customers. Mary loves her business and she says that fashion designing is an interesting business because she makes her customers look beautiful in her designs. She hopes to grow her business in the future by having a fashion institute where she will train young boys and girls how to design clothes.

She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to boost her business. She is 34 years old, and married with 2 children. Her eldest child is 4 years old and the youngest child is 2 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to boost her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a small house which they built themselves. They have been living together in their current home for 10 years. Ganzorig operates a vegetable trading business, and his wife and family help him with his business.

Ganzorig started his business in 2006 with his father, and planted potatoes in 1-2 hectares of their land, carrots in 0.5 hectare of their land, and rutabagas. Ganzorig's father has 5 hectares of land with an irrigation system in Bornuur soum. Ganzorig has steadily grown and expanded his business and has become an experienced vegetable trader. Ganzorig uses Mongolian seeds for his business. However, he has been using the seeds for many years, and the seeds have been spoiling and loosing their quality. Therefore, there is a need to renew the seeds in order to increase their vegetable crop.

Besides the vegetable trading business, he has been planning to enlarge his house and to operate a tire repairing service in his yard. Ganzorig is a very open minded and hardworking person. He says, “I would like to expand my business and increase the crops to improve our family's quality of life.” He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase 2.5 tons of seeds for 1,250,000 tugrugs and also for fuel for his vegetable trading business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds.

loans.name: Chhoum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoum L., 39, is married, but divorced her husband years ago, and she lives in Siem Reap Province. She is a farmer and earns around $3 per day. She has three young children. One of the children works in construction to provide an income. Chhoum L. has been planning to invest in a new suitable business in order to provide more money for her family. Her proposal is not possible because she has no capital to start a new business. Due to that, Chhoum L. decided to ask for assistance to begin selling roast beef.

loans.use: To begin selling roast beef.

loans.name: Sikirat

texts.en: Sikirat is married to a civil servant and they are blessed with 5 children. Her children are doing well in their business, jobs and school and this gives her joy. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells motor spare parts and engine oil at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts and engine oil to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil and motor spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Рачабов Махмадали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количества.
texts.en:
Mahmadali R. lives in the Yavan district. He is 44 years old, married and has 6 children. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. Mahmadali fattens and sells cattle. His wife helps him with this business. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells spiritual articles like candles, incense, olive oil and prayer books at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually friends, neighbors and residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She loves this business because she is able to support her husband in meeting the basic needs and necessities of the family. She is 45 years old, and married with 3 children. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports the home. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more spiritual articles to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spiritual articles to sell.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. P. and her husband are in the picture. P., 22, is an internal staff member in a Hotel, earning a salary $120 a month. In addition, her husband works as a security guard for a small firm. This couple has a young child who is enrolled in the public primary school. P. finds it difficult to get to her work location, because she has no vehicle. Because of this problem, P. requested a loan in order to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is a business woman and she loves doing business. She sells clothes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She is 48 years old, and widowed with 4 children. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maruush

texts.en:
Maruush is a 55 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Maruush operates a business selling household goods, and his wife and children support his business. He has been operating this business since 2000, following a flour selling business between 1996-2000. Originally, he operated a food trading business, from 1992-1996.

Maruush has gained a lot of experience operating his business and has successfully expanded the business. Besides selling household goods, business, he works as a caretaker for a local organization. During those workdays, his wife and children operate the business. Maruush is a very hardworking person and has great communication skills. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to expand my business in the future and to be financially available to afford university tuition fees for my daughter until she graduates from university.” He is requesting a 1,800,000 tugrug loan to increase the working capital for his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.en:
Hoshim K. is 47 years old and was born in Penjikent, Tajikistan. He is the father of four children, and his main work consists of breeding cattle. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, Hoshim would like to buy a greater number of cattle and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, Hoshim is asking for a loan of $1400 US Dollars for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family. With your help this will be possible.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Shahiqa Jan Group

texts.en:
Sultan M. is a member of the Shahiqa Jan group. He lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has 3 children. He has got a cart, from which he sells cosmetics and runs a small business.
 
He needs this loan to purchase more, and different kinds of, cosmetics to increase his income and to support his family members in a better way. 
He hopes to grow his business and have a small shop in the future. He would like to mention that Kiva is a really effective process for entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek A. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two children. Ulugbek is an animal farmer. He owns cows and sells their milk, together with the help of his wife and brother. In order to further develop his business, Ulugbek wants to take out a loan to buy more cows and feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.
