While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly twothirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to develop his business.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady D. âgée de 44 ans  s’active dans la restauration depuis 10 ans. Elle vend des produits alimentaires comme les nems, des beignets  et des fatayas qu’elle prépare elle-même.Elle vend dans sa maison sise à coté de l’hôpital régional de Thiès et travaille trop souvent sur commande.
Marié et mère d’une jeune fille, Madame Khady D. souhaiterait mettre en place sa propre buvette devant chez elle pour mieux attirer la clientèle et rendre plus visible son business. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un prêt de 300 000 FCFA  afin de créer la buvette et de l’équiper.
texts.en:
Mme Khady D., age 44, has been involved in food preparation for the past ten years. She sells edible goods such as spring rolls, doughnuts and fried fish cakes that see prepares. She sells from her home which is located next to the regional hospital of Thiès and works to often on demand. Married and the mother of a young girl, Mme Khady D. wishes to instal a refreshment area in front of her house to better attract customers and make her business more visible. Thus she is seeking a loan of $650 to create her refreshment area and to stock it.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: install a refreshment area

loans.name: Adeola

texts.en: Adeola sells religious articles like candles, incense, olive oil and prayer books at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are usually friends, neighbors and residents. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She loves this business because she is able to support her husband in meeting the basic needs and necessities of the family. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Her children are doing well in school. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the home. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more religious articles to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more religious articles to sell.

loans.name: Abduvosit

texts.en:
Raising calves is a very common business in the village of Uzbekkishlok in Dj. Rasulov region. Abduvosit has dedicated himself to this business with great effort in order to provide for his wife and three school-aged children. To support his family, he sporadically purchases calves to raise them, fatten them, and then sell them or butcher them to sell the meat. Today, his major need is acquiring a calf for his business. For this reason Abduvosit looks for support to IMON International, to buy more cattle that will make his family’s sustenance possible.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to develop business.

loans.name: Nasantogtoh

texts.en:
Nasantogtoh is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. He operates a retail business and purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. Nasantogtoh has been operating this business since 2004.

Furthermore, he has also been operating a transportation business since 2007. Previously, he operated a second hand product trading business between 2002-2004. Over the years, Nasantogtoh has expanded his business and gained valuable experience. He has been planning to expand his business and to open a store in the future. Nasantogtoh is a very hardworking person and says, “I would like to open my own store for my business with the business profits.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to increase his working capital for his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.en:
Kamoliddin B. is 32 years old. He is married with two children. He raises and sells cattle at the market. This is a very profitable business, especially during the season of the celebrations. He has been in this business since 2000. Kamoliddin has a friendly family who always try to help each other. He is requesting a loan in order to be able to purchase more cows and feed for them. This is especially important for his commerce, because the price for them has declined. With your help, Kamoliddin can improve his family’s living conditions.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle for developing business.

loans.name: Jangiboy

texts.en:
The business activity from which Jangiboy makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business 7 years ago with a small number of livestock, but as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives. According to Jangiboy, he works very hard so that he can take care of his children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve his family's living. Currently, he needs a loan of 6000 Somoni in order to purchase more cattle to later resell after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to develop his business.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 43 years old, and married with 4 children. Her husband also works to support their family. She is a friendly and hard working woman. Bola is well loved in her community, especially by children because she sells ice cream. She hopes to expand her business. Her greatest challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
D. Ali is a very courageous man who is able to handle tough jobs like raising livestock and farming. He's the father of two adult children and with his son (who we see in the photo) is responsible for supporting their family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, Ali has been able to get ahead by buying animals to breed on his property. His main goal now is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Ali comes to IMON International for a loan to buy more animals to breed.

loans.use: to buy cows for breeding

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en:
H. Abdulatif is 22 years old and makes a living by providing taxi services. He has been in this business for the last two years and has gained a lot of experience in that time. Abdulatif has always worked hard to provide quality service at an attractive price. He is doing his best to make his business stable and profitable because he is the main bread-winner for a large family and must work from early morning till to late at night in order to keep his current customers and win new ones. He is applying for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to repair his car. Abdulatif thanks everyone for their interest and support, and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner because he is so committed to expanding his business and improving the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Jamshid

texts.en:
K. Jamshid is 28 years old and widely known as a very diligent and hard-working man. He makes a living providing taxi services and for the last six years has been the main source of income for the family. He is committed to the well-being of his relatives, and has applied for this loan to provide needed repairs to his vehicle. He promises to repay the $900 loan promptly and thanks everyone who decides to support him.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Hasena Group

texts.en: Hasena leads a loan group which is also called Hasena. She lives in Afghanistan, in Kabul's 11th district, is married and has four children. She is a tailor and works hard to earn enough money to meet her family’s needs. Hasena is applying for a loan to buy a new sewing machine for her shop because her old one is in very poor shape. She would also like to hire a student to work for her. To achieve these goals, she has applied for a loan of 15,000 Afghani. She is excited by the prospect of expanding her small business, and extends sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their willingness to help the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.en:
S. Elmurod is a gentleman who has devoted his life to farming and raising livestock, working with his wife (who we see in the photo). Elmurod is a hard-working man who is doing everything he can to provide for his family and educate his children. He is applying for this loan because he needs help to buy more cattle to raise. To make this possible, he has turned to IMON International to obtain a loan. Elmurod and his wife are grateful to everyone who chooses to support them. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: To expand a small farming and livestock business by buying more cattle

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: V. Odile est née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à SESSINOU Jules, un plombier, Odile est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille s'est installée au quartier Saint Jean à Cotonou, il y a deux ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. C'est depuis 15 ans que Odile mène comme activité, la vente de sous-vêtements (slips, soutiens-gorge, etc.) de façon ambulante. Odile s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Odile est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu quatre prêts qu'elle a eu à bien rembourser. Aujourd’hui, Odile ambitionne agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. C’est la raison pour laquelle Odile sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Odile V. was born in 1972 in Cotonou, economical capital of Benin. Married to Jules Sessinou, a plomber, Odile is mother of four children who are all attending school. The family has lived for about two years in the Saint Jean area in Cotonou. The couple is providing together for the various family expenses. Odile has been selling lingerie and underwear (such as panties, bras, etc.) for 15 years as itinerant vendor. Odile buys her supplies in Lomé, Togo, a neighbor country. She is an old client of ALIDé, and she has fully repaid her four previous loans. Now Odile would like to enlarge her business in order to respond to her customer demand and to increase her revenue. For this reason she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underwear and lingerie

loans.name: Aishat

texts.en:
Aishat is 50 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports their home. She is a hardworking woman. She makes a living selling shoes at retail prices to her customers. 

She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more shoes to sell. She loves this business because it is highly profitable and she has the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to grow her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel tiene 50 años de edad, está casada con el señor  Alcides, viven en un barrio muy populoso de la ciudad de Itá, el matrimonio tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya son independientes.
 La señora Isabel es costurera, cose camisones, vestidos y otras prendas en su domicilio, se dedica a esta profesión hace más de 15 años. Cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus hijos quienes son asalariados y de su marido quien posee una carpintería en donde fabrica diversos tipos de muebles como roperos, mesas, sillas, fiambreras, placares, cómodas y otros muebles..
Isabel opera exclusivamente con la Fundación Paraguaya en forma excelente, ella trabaja con mucho empeño y se puede notar  lo cual se puede constatar con  el progreso de su trabajo y el nivel de vida que llevan, el préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de telas en gran cantidad, además su esposo desea invertir en la compra de maderas.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel is 50 years old, and is married to Señor Alcides. They live in a highly populated neighborhood in the city of Itá. They have 2 children who are already independent. Isabel is a dressmaker. She sews nightgowns, dresses and other garments in her home. She has been carrying out this activity for more than 15 years. She has the economic support of her children, who have salaried jobs, and her husband, who has a woodworking shop where he makes various types of furniture such as wardrobes, tables, chairs, lunchboxes, cabinets, chests and other pieces of furniture. Isabel works exclusively with the Fundación Paraguaya and her credit is in excellent shape. She works very hard and it is possible to observe the progress in her work, which has brought up her living standard. The loan that she requests this time will be used to buy large quantities of fabrics, and in addition, to buy wood for her husband's business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Sanusi

texts.en:
Sanusi A. is 36 years old and married with three children. His children are excelling in school, and this makes him happy. He sells clothes at retail prices to his customers in the market. He does not want to incur debt, so he loves this business because his customers pay cash when they come to purchase clothes.

Sanusi is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes to sell. He hopes to own a classic boutique in the future. He duly says thank you to Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle to resell both in retail and wholesale markets.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidora tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, 2 varones y 2 mujeres casadas. Vive en su propia casa.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropas por las calles, pero con los mediante el esfuerzo logró pudo triunfar como micro empresaria.
 Con el tiempo Isidora fue estudiando la carrera de modista de alta costura y en la cual pudo ya ella misma confeccionar sus propias prendas para su posterior venta y así fue ganando confianza hasta abrir un negocio a pasos del mercado de Itá en la cual la encargada de administrar ese negocio es su hija.
La Sra. necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como ser: mochilas, prendas de vestir, etc. y telas para el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isadora is 56 and the single mother of 4 children: 2 boys and 2 married girls. She lives in her own house. In the past she worked selling clothing in the streets, but by her efforts, she succeeded in becoming a micro-entrepreneur. Over a period of time Isidora studied high style dress-making. She was able to make her own clothing to sell later and in that way gained the confidence to open her own business right outside the Itá market. Her daughter is in charge of the business. Mrs. Isidora needs a loan to buy merchandise such as: backpacks, dresses, etc, and fabric for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, backpacks and fabric

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is 35 years old and married to a policeman. They have three children, all of whom attend school, and this gives her joy. Maria makes her living selling shoes and sarongs to her customers. She loves this business because it is highly profitable, and she has the opportunity to interact with her customers.

Maria is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more shoes to sell and so grow her business. She says thank you to Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) and all Kiva lenders in anticipation of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph sells electronics to earn a living in Ibadan. He hopes to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He is 42 years old, and married with 3 children. His children are doing well in school. His wife sells electrical materials to support their home. Joseph hopes to lift his business and family above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell.

loans.name: Rachabali

texts.ru: Джураев Раджабали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 22 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Живет вместе с родителями. Его жена - домохозяйка. Отец находится в России на зарабатках. Сам Раджабали занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Создал все условия для продвижения своего бизнеса. Он, в основном, откармливает и продает скот. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 3 года. Кредит берет для покупки крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Rachabali DJ. lives in the Yavan district. He is 22 years old, married and has no children. He lives together with his parents. His wife is a homemaker, and his father is in Russia for work. Rachabali is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock at home. He created all of the conditions for moving his business forward. He primarily fattens and sells livestock. Rachabali has been involved in this business for 3 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Fumi sells colorful sarongs and beads at retail prices to make a living. Sarongs in Nigeria are worn at all occasions and are mostly worn by women and young ladies. She hopes to be a major distributor of sarongs in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is 47 years old, and married with 3 children. Her husband works to also support their home. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She duly says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a businesswoman and she loves doing business. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is widowed with 4 children. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift above poverty organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
Papa D. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock pairs of trousers and dresses, etc. to sell. Papa is 29 years old and is married to with a husband who is a nurse. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock pairs of trousers and dresses etc. to sell.

loans.name: Martiriano

texts.es:
EL Señor Martiriano A. C. tiene 55 años y está casado con la Señora Victoria Zapata López de A.  por más de 30 años total tiene 9 hijos lo cual 5 casados y 4 dependientes de el, que estudian, El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,  papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa le ayuda en la producción agrícola aparte de ser ama de casa y cuidado de sus animales.   
                                                                                                                                                                                     El señor Martiriano A. C. vive en Colomi calle Cbba zona sud a media cuadra del Estadium Municipal  es una zona que está dentro de la urbanización  del pueblo de colomi, el crédito que está sacando de CIDRE; El señor Martiriano A. C. utilizara este para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y compra de semilla de papa  para agrandar mas su producción agrícola.        
                                                                                                                                                           El señor Martiriano A. C. nos comenta que su sueño es seguir mejorando sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar su calidad de vivienda para vivir mas cómodos con su familia; Por ultimo nos cuenta que sembrara en mas superficies sus cultivos de producción agrícola (aumento de producción), porque son los primeros de la canasta familiar a nivel Bolivia, a la vez es un recurso económico para mantener y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Martiriano A. C. is 54 years old and has been married to Señora Victoria Zapata López de A. for more than 30 years. He has a total of 9 children of whom 5 are married and 4 are still students dependent upon him.

The gentleman is engaged in the production of potatoes, beans, oca (an edible root), and papa liza (a tuber grown in the Andean region). He sells his crops at the weekly market in Colomi. His wife helps him with agricultural production, in addition to being a housewife and caring for their animals.

Señor Martiriano A. C. lives in Colomi on Cbba Street in the southern zone of the town a half block from the municipal stadium. It is an area which is within the housing development in the town of Colomi. He will use the loan that he is getting from CIDRE for the purchase of organic fertilizer (poultry droppings) and potato seed in order to in order to increase his agricultural production.

Señor Martiriano A. C. tells us that his dreams are to continue improving his economic resources so that his children can continue studying until they become professionals and also to improve his quality of life so that he can live more comfortably with his family. Finally, he tells us that he wants to increase the amount of land that he has under production because his crops are the most important for Bolivian family pantries and, at the same time, are an economic resource for maintaining and feeding his family.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer and potato seed.

loans.name: Kiliyona

texts.en:
Kiliyona L. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Kiliyona is 23 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. They have not produced any children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Махмадиева Зулфия проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 29 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж, фотограф. Сама Зулфия работает в ателье. Она в основном занимается пошивкой национальных платьев. Целью кредита является покупка машины для вышивки. Зулфия хочет занятся вышивкой, чтобы привлечь внимание клиентов. Так как спрос на платье с вышивкой увеличился.
texts.en:
Zulfiya M. lives in the Yavan district. She is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is a photographer. Zulfiya works at an atelier. She primarily sews national dresses. The goal of this loan is a purchase of an embroidery machine. Zulfiya wants to get involved in embroidery in order to attract customers because the demand for embroidered dresses will be higher.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an embroidery machine

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan R. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at home, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Susan is 20 years old and is married to a policeman. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a pharmacy.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
EL Señor Juan V. Fernández tiene 46 años y está casado con la Señora Primitiva Calle Mamani de V. por más de 23 años tiene 4 hijos que estudian, El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca y papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa también se dedica a la producción agrícola y ama de casa.  
                                                                                                                                                                                      El señor Juan V. Fernández vive en la comunidad de Primer Toncoli a 2 km hacia el norte de Colomi,  es una zona que esta cerca del pueblo de colomi, el crédito está sacando de CIDRE; El señor Juan V. Fernández utilizara este crédito para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza)  para agrandar más su producción agrícola.
 
El señor Juan V. Fernández nos comenta que su sueño es mejorar sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar su calidad de vivienda para vivir mas cómodos con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan V. Fernández, 46, has been married to Primitiva Calle Mamani de V. for over 23 years; they have 4 children that are students. He farms several varieties of potato, tubers and broad beans that he sells in Colomi’s weekly market; his wife is also a farmer and housewife. Juan lives in Primer Toncoli, 2 kilometers north of Colomi in an area near Colomi. He is getting financing from CIDRE and will use the funds to buy organic (chicken) manure to increase his crop yields. He mentioned to us that his dream is to improve his financial resources so that his children can stay in school and become professionals; he also wants to improve the quality of his home so that the family can live with more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy organic manure.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol, where she runs a small clothing sales business. Natalya sells women’s outer clothing items in one of the local markets. She is an experienced market vendor, and has been running this venture for 12 years. Currently, Natalya has 150,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her income amounts to 9,000 Grivnyas a month. 

The approaching spring season means increased buyer activity. After a long winter, many Ukrainians are ready to get out and shop. Natalya recognizes a good opportunity to broaden the selection of goods she offers and increase her sales volume. Natalya is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase the selection of clothing merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. Natalya is known as an open and lively woman who cares about her customers' needs. As she provides for the needs of others, she will be able to generate the necessary funds to adequately provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty C. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread, which is cooked by frying in cooking oil, and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials, e.g baking flour and cooking oil. Betty is 45 years old and is married to a teacher. She has 6 children and 4 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is an honest and hard working woman. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her home. She would like to lift her business and family above poverty. To make a living in Ibadan, she sells foodstuffs like cooking oil, rice, beans, and tubers of yam at retail prices. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She has been in this business for a long time, and she uses her experience in business to attract and retain her customers. She is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband works to also support their home.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married with a 4 year old child. He lives in Kamenka. Ruslan owns an auto accessories store in his hometown. His little vending place is located right in downtown Kamenka, which makes it a popular stop for car owners. He sells tires, acoustic systems, and car parts. Ruslan started this business 11 years ago. Presently, he has about 150,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. His turnover capital is about 30,000-40,000 Grivnyas. Net profit amounts to 5,000-6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Ruslan is hoping to invest this loan of 18,150 Grivnyas in the purchase of summer rubber tires that always sell well in spring and summer. He believes a diversified assortment of merchandise will help meet clients’ demands. Ruslan has proved to be a responsible borrower, having repaid all previous loans without any late payments. One of his long term plans is to start a second venture and open a grocery store some day.

loans.use: To purchase summer rubber tires.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana, divorced with two grown children, is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine selling retail household items in a busy place in the local market that attracts many potential customers. Tetyana has been in this trade for nine years and presently has 50,000 Grivnyas of gross income. Her monthly net profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas.

Tetyana is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted merchandise to diversify her stock. Operating her business with integrity and skill, she is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. Additional merchandise, combined with Tetyana’s work ethic and experience, will enable her to expand her business, increase her income, and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Asenso

texts.en:
Asentso J. sells bread, charcoal, and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Asentso is 36 years old and a widow with three school-age children. With the extra profits the loan will make possible, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is married with two children. She runs a small men's clothing store in the local marketplace in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She has had this business for 14 years and currently has an inventory worth 10,000 Grivnyas. Her monthly profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas. 

Anzhela is seeking a 6,500 Grivnya loan to re-stock her seasonal inventory. Better selection of merchandise will help her increase her sales and her income as a result. She is a skilled and experienced market vendor who has built up a loyal clientele.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Aynura's Group

texts.ru:
Город Балыкчи издавна был известен рыбным промыслом и множеством промышленных объектов, так как город находится на берегу красивейшего озера Ыссык – Куль. Сейчас же, в городе довольно таки плачевная ситуация. Огромная пустота, и лишь бледные каскады огромных предприятий напоминают о былой мощи этого города. Чуйтиева Айнура, лидер данной группы, живёт в г. Балыкчи. Ей сорок один год. Айнура – заботливая мать, жена, а также добросовестный педагог. Она растит троих сыновей. Старшему сыну уже восемнадцать лет. Он учится в консерватории и мечтает стать народным артистом. Среднему и младшему по четырнадцать и двенадцать соответственно. Оба пока ходят в школу. Муж Айнуры пасёт скот и занимается животноводством. Он откармливает скот, забивает и сдаёт мясо оптом. Айнура работает учительницей русского языка в средней школе. Поскольку Айнура сама тесно связана с сферой образования, она понимает всю его значимость для будущего своих детей. И на протяжении многих лет, Айнура вместе с мужем планировали финансирование обучения детей. Четыре года назад они на свои сбережения начали покупать мелкий рогатый скот, который затем распродавали на рынке и среди своих знакомых. Так у них появилась возможность немного зарабатывать дополнительные средства. Однако, одной зарплаты мужа-пастуха и зарплаты учителя средней школы, а также небольшой доход от своего бизнеса конечно же совсем не достаточно для того, чтобы дать детям полноценное образование. Сейчас Айнура нуждается в кредите. Ей надо погасить задолженность за обучение сына. 

У Айнуры три партнёра по группе:

Султаналиевой Айгуль сорок два года. Муж Айгуль работает в отряде специального назначения. Айгуль – учительница средней школы. У неё очень низкая заработная плата всего 1850 сомов. Однако зарплата мужа выручает всю семью. Айгуль обратилась за кредитом, с целью купить мебель  или холодильник.

Абыкеевой Назгуль тридцать восемь лет. Муж Назгуль работает диспетчером. Вместе с мужем Назгуль воспитывает троих детей. В этом году дочь Назгуль заканчивает одиннадцатый класс. В связи с этим, Назгуль обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить дочери одежду. На оставшуюся сумму Назгуль хочет купить домашнюю утварь. 

Мусагуловой Дамире сорок семь лет. Дамира работает в средней школе библиотекарем, а заодно ещё и учительницей. У Дамиры пятеро детей. Из них двое уже учатся в институтах. Муж работает в котельной горбольницы. Дамира решила обратиться за кредитом, так как ей нужно погасить контракт дочери.  У неё есть мечта купить машину для сына. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The town of Balykchi has been known for its fishing trade and many industrial sites for a long time. This is because the town is located on the coast of the beautiful Yssyk Kul Lake. The current situation in the town is fairly sad. Emptiness and pale cascades of huge factories remind us of the former might of this town. Aynura C., who is the leader of this group, lives in Balykchi. She is forty-one years old. Aynura is a caring mother, wife and also a conscientious teacher. She is raising three sons. The oldest son is already eighteen years old. He attends a conservatory and dreams of becoming a national artist. The middle and youngest sons are fourteen and twelve years old respectively. They both attend school for now. Aynura’s husband tends livestock and is involved in animal husbandry. He fattens the livestock, butchers it and sells the meat wholesale. Aynura works as a Russian language teacher at a secondary school. Because Aynura is closely involved with the education sphere, she understands the importance of education to the future of her children. Aynura and her husband spent several years planning the financial aspects of their children’s education. Four years ago, they started using their savings to buy small livestock, which they then sold at the market and among their acquaintances. This is how they found an opportunity to earn some extra money. However, one salary of a shepherd and a salary of a school teacher, and a small income from their business are not enough to provide their children with a valuable education. Currently, Aynura needs a loan. She needs to repay a debt for her son’s education. Aynura has three partners in the group: Aygul S. is forty-two years old. Her husband works at a special purpose squad. Aygul is a secondary school teacher. She has a very low salary of just 1850 som. However, her husband’s salary saves the whole family. Aygul requested the loan in order to buy furniture or a refrigerator. Nazgul A. is thirty-eight years old. Her husband works as a dispatcher. Together, they are raising three children. Nazgul’s daughter will complete eleventh grade this year. Due to this, Nazgul requested a loan in order to buy clothing for her daughter. And she wants to use the rest of the money to buy household goods. Damira Mysagulova is forty-seven years old. She works at a secondary school as a librarian and also as a teacher. Damira has five children. Two of them already attend colleges. Her husband works at the boiler-room of the municipal hospital. Damira decided to request a loan because she needs to repay her daughter’s contract. She dreams of buying a car for her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repaying son's education loan

loans.name: Zerifa

texts.en:
Zerifa Lucy is in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. She is 22 years old and married to a farm worker. They have two children who go to school. With the extra profits her loan will make possible, she hopes to be able to build a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Christiania

texts.en:
Christiania O. sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this drink business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell. 

She is 54 years old and a widow with four children. Her children are doing well in their jobs and school. She is also happy because she is a grandmother. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and stronger. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en:
Bisi sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this drink business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell. 

She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her children are doing well in their school. She is also happy because her children attend school. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and stronger. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ragaya

texts.en:
Ragaya R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and beans to sell.  Ragaya is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has nine children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal and beans to sell

loans.name: Durbubu's Group

texts.en:
The heroes of this story are people of very different ages! The feature they have in common is the smile on their faces. Durbubu B. is the leader of this group. She is sixty five; her husband is retired. Together they have raised eight children and Durbubu is currently raising her grandchildren. She also helps her husband look after the livestock. Cattle breeding brings them a monthly income of $227 and they hope to expand their business by increasing the population of their livestock. Durbubu hopes to obtain a loan and purchase some sheep to breed and to plough their field. She believes that daily labor is the best way to give their granddaughter the best upbringing. 

Durbubu’s partners are:

Rima, 40, is a mother of five children. Her husband works as a shepherd. All her children except the eldest daughter still go to school. Rima has applied for this loan to purchase two sheep. She has plans for her daughter to marry soon. 

Medetbek, 56, trades in cattle and his wife is also a businesswoman. They have two children. His son helps him look after the cattle. Medetbek manages to earn around $129 dollars a month. He needs a loan to buy two sheep to raise for resale. 

Gulbubu, 56, has raised five children. To earn their livelihood, she and her husband keep some cattle. Their children do their best to help their parents. Gulbubu has decided to apply for this loan to purchase four sheep. 

Raskan, 44, is married to an electrician. They have four children. To earn their living they also keep some cattle. Raskan needs a loan to purchase four sheep.

Taasirlan, 22, is single. Despite his young age he is already earning his own livelihood. He breeds and trades in cattle on weekends and needs a loan to buy a cow for resale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the "Three-Ps" concept — People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team — Supporters of Kyrgyzstan — at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to breed and to plough their field

loans.name: Setima

texts.en:
Setima A. has a store selling items such as bags of salt, sugar, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. She is 20 years old and single. With the extra profits the loan will bring, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike to carry goods from market to her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more goods in her shop to sell

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two teenage children. He lives in Vodyanoye, Ukraine and grows early spring vegetables for sale in the local markets in his region. Vitalyi owns six arch greenhouses where he does tomato and radish farming. He has been in the business for eight years. Vitalyi currently has 70,000 Grivnyas invested in his business. Annually he spends about 30,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene protective film. 

He is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to buy five rolls of polyethylene film to repair the greenhouses damaged during heavy winter snowfalls and ice. The loan will give him the chance to sow seedlings in his greenhouses on time. One of Vitalyi’s short-term plans is to finish construction of the seventh greenhouse on his property. Profits generated last year enabled Vitalyi to buy a vehicle which helped in many aspects of his business.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film and repair his greenhouses

loans.name: Sepora

texts.en:
Sepora A. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and beans to sell.  Sepora is 40 years old and married to a tailor. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and beans to sell

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is a small-scale farmer from the town of Antonovka in the Kherson region. He grows and sells tomatoes, cucumbers and onions. Petro owns a greenhouse, a garden and a big lot of land. Every spring he buys seedlings and sows them in his spacious greenhouse. Currently, Petro has 100,000 Grivnyas invested in this venture.    

Petro is hoping to use the loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to buy fixtures for his greenhouse, as well as fertilizers and agricultural pesticides for this farming season. Success of Petro’s business has much to do with his father’s rich farming experience. Petro’s father has actively been helping him with this venture with practical advice and assistance. This sphere of business is very productive for this region, where many people are involved in the farming industry.

loans.use: To purchase fixtures for his greenhouse, fertilizers and agricultural chemicals

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA LOYDA B. D. C. TIENE 51 AÑOS Y ES CASADA CON EL SEÑOR C. DESD. HACE 34 AÑOS TIENE TRES HIJOS EL MAYOR D. 33 AÑOS CON FAMILIA PROPIA EL SEGUNDO 30 Y EL ULTIMO  TIENE 20 AÑOS LA SEÑORA LOYDA VIVE EN LA ZONA D. LOS LOTES URBANIZACION GUADALUPE A 15 MINUTOS D. LA CIUDAD.

LA SEÑORA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DESD. HACE 8 AÑOS ELLA ES PROPIETARIA D. UNA TIENDA D. BARRIO EN SU ZONA BRINDANDO UN SERVICIO A LA GENTE D. SU BARRIO ANTE LA NESECIDAD D. SURTIRSE D. LOS PRODUCTOS D. PRIMERA NECESIDAD.

ELLA REQUIERE EL DINERO PARA PODER SURTIRSE D. PRODUCTOS YA QUE LE FALTAN ALGUNOS PRODUTOS EN SU TIENDA Y ASI PODER MEJORAR EL SEVICIO A SU CLIENTELA Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD D. VIDA.
texts.en:
Loyda B. D. C., 51, has been married to her husband for 34 years; she has three children: the oldest, 33, has his own family; the next is 30 years old and the youngest is 20. Loyda lives in the Lotes Urbanizacion Guadalupe, which is 15 minutes from the city. She has been a merchant for the last 8 years; she owns a neighborhood grocery store where she supplies her neighbors with basic necessity items. She needs funding to buy stock merchandise because she needs some products in her store so that she can proviD. improved service to her customers thus improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Atim

texts.en:
Atim A. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, beans, pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas), rice, etc., in a shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice and pulses to sell. Atim is 42 years old and married to a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more bags of rice and pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She works with clothing merchandise, selling it in the central mall of her hometown. Nataliya sells men’s and women’s jackets and suits. She has been in this business for eight years. Presently, Nataliya has about 30,000 Grivnyas of monthly income. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 4,200 Grivnya to purchase additional clothing inventory for further retail sale in her little store. She is hoping to buy new, trendy clothing that sells well among numerous mall customers. Nataliya can be characterized as a solvent borrower capable of current loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Jabe

texts.en:
Jabe T. is currently in the business of selling various items, like soap, sweets, sugar, etc., in a shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice and pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) to sell. Jabe is 35 years old and widowed. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase stock more bags of rice and pulses (groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) to sell

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr:
Ngabo M. Y.  est présidente du groupe de crédit Tuchukuliane, elle lève la main avec sourire éclatante sur la photo , cliente au 15e  cycle de crédit, âgée de 36 ans, mariée. Elle est mère de  4 enfants  parmi lesquels   3  vont à l’école et 1 enfant cadet n’a pas l’âge scolaire. Son mari est infirmier .
 Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce capital lui a permis d’acheter un bidon d’huile d’une valeur de 13$. Son business est de vendre l’huile de palme dans un petit marché du quartier populaire TMK . Notons que  le lundi et le jeudi de chaque  semaine elle se déplace vers le grand marché de Kituku à 15 km de la ville de Goma. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cet activité de vente d’huile de palme.
Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, Ngabo M. Y. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achétant  20 bidons d’huile de palme .
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de ne plus s’approvisionner à Goma et aller directement au centre de production à OICHA, cité rurale du grand nord de la province du Nord Kivu, et à la longue construire confortablement sa maison. Elle compte egalement achéter un véhicule pour le transport de sa marchandise, mais aussi investir dans l’élèvage de poules.
 Ngabo M. Y. rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grace à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Ce groupe Tuchukuliane est  composé de 14 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Ngabo M. Y. is the president of the loan group called Tuchukuliane; she is the one in the photo raising her hand with a brilliant smile. She is taking out her 15th loan. She is 36, married, and the mother of 4 children. Three of them attend school and the youngest is not yet school-aged. Her husband is a nurse. She opened up her little business with her own money that she had received from her husband. This working capital allowed her to buy a container of oil worth $13. She sells palm oil in a little market in the populous neighborhood of TMK. On Mondays and Thursdays she goes to the big market of Kituku, 15 km from the town of Goma. She has been selling palm oil for 13 years. With the loan from the micro-finance institution Hekima, Ngabo M. Y. wishes to increase her sales by buying 20 jerrycans of palm oil. In future, she plans to stop doing her buying in Goma and go directly to the production centre in OICHA, a rural town in the far north of North Kivu province, and in the long run, she hopes to build a comfortable house. She also intends to buy a vehicle for the transport of her merchandise, and to invest in chicken-farming as well. Ngabo M. Y. thanks the MFI Hekima for the loans that she receives without any tangible assets as collateral because it is due to these loans that she manages to support her children. The Tuchukuliane group is composed of 14 members, mostly women.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 20 jerrycans of palm oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is a 34-year-old married mother of two. She has been running an Internet café for four years. She previously worked as an accountant before she saw the need to invest in this business. She has previously taken out three loans from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business.  

She plans to expand her business and open other outlets in the future. She believes that confidence and determination are what drives a person to success. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, to buy a one PC (personal computer) and stationery.

loans.use: To buy one computer and stationery

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia trabaja como empleada domestica por las mañanas y  por las tardes se dedica a la venta de víveres (arroz, azúcar, harina, etc.) que los coloca a crédito para cobrar diariamente, semanalmente, o al mes.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de sopocachi bajo de la ciudad de la Paz 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, aceite).
Es cliente antiguo Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas, demostrando responsabilidad ya que  con este crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Celia works as a domestic employee in the mornings and sells groceries (rice, sugar, flour, etc.) in the afternoons; she sells on credit and collects either daily, weekly or monthly. Her home is in the Sopocachi Bajo area of La Paz. She will use the funds to buy stock items (sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil). She is a long-standing Impro client. Her credit history classifies her as a good client having demonstrated responsibility; this loan will help her improve her income and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil at wholesale to resell to her customers on credit.

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku M. sells bags of sugar, cooking oil, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice, pulses (such as lentils), and beans to sell.  She is 30 years old and married to a chief. They have three children in school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a department store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice, beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fish and vegetables sales

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is 28 years old and married with two children. She has been running a ladies tailoring shop for seven years. Her business is located in Karen market a few kilometers away from the capital city, Nairobi. She hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living. Jackline previously took out a loan from Faulu Kenya to educate her siblings who are in school. She has requested another loan of kes.50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy fabric and dressmaking accessories. She describes herself as diligent and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy fabric and dressmaking accessories

loans.name: Amaar

texts.en: Amaar B. S. 23 years old and single with a college diploma from Beta, Nablus. Amaar is currently living with his wife and parents. He is also supporting two other family members. In 2007 Amaar saw a need and opened a coffee and billiard shop. This shop is unique in that it provides free, unlimited internet access. He is hoping that with the loan he is asking for he will be able to refurbish the billiard tables. His future plans are to open two separate stores — one for billiards and the other a coffee shop.

loans.use: To refurbish billiard tables in his cafe

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es:
Gerbacio es viudo y trabaja como albañil, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la mantención de su familia; tiene 4  hijos con las edades de 4, 6,8 y 12 años. Tiene su domicilio en la  Zona de Villa Ingenio de la  ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, ladrillo, estuco) para la construcción de su casa.
 
Es su quinto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Gerbacio is a widower and works as a bricklayeer; this is his main source of income to support his family of four children, who are 4, 6, 8 and 12 years of age. He lives in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies (sand, cement, bricks, stucco) to build his house. This is his 5th loan with Impro; his good repayment behavior qualifies him to seek another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell millet-meal mush

loans.name: Emily Jepkosgei

texts.en:
Emily Jepkosgei M. is a woman of 33. She is married to Leonard Kirui and they are blessed with three beautiful children. Emily lives in Sergoit in Eldoret, where she practices farming. On her piece of land, she plants maize, which she sells to her clients who happen to be her neighbors. However, she does not only depend on the maize sales for family upkeep but also sells milk from her cows to her neighbors and to one of Kenya’s big suppliers of milk called Kenya Cooperative Creameries.

She was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by an existing client who is also her neighbor. Emily will use the loan she has applied for to buy things like maize seeds. She would like to more land in the next year so that she can increase her production and income.

loans.use: For maize planting, like buying maize seeds

loans.name: Mukaila

texts.en:
Mukaila A. is an electrician and he also sells electrical items at retail prices. He is a hardworking man and is so determined to lift his business above poverty.  

He is 41 years old and married with three children. His eldest child is 19 years old. His children are excelling in school. His wife sells sarongs to support their home. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more electrical items to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni S. oeprates a bookshop and is requesting a loan to buy more stock of text books. Poni is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a secretary. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a pharmacy.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy stock of text books

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio se dedica a  trabajar como panadero asalariado; dicha actividad constituye su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la mantención de su familia, pues con su esposa tienen 2  hijos con las edades de 8 y 15 años.

Tiene su domicilio en la  Zona de Villa Ingenio de la  ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillo) para la construcción de su casa .
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonio is employed as a salaried baker; this is his family's main source of income, which supports his wife and two children, who are 8 and 15 years of age. He lives in the Villa Ingenio area of El Alto. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies (cement, sand, bricks) to build his house. This is his second loan with Impro; his good repayment history qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 32 years old. He has been running a welding business for six years. He also practices commercial farming together with his wife.  He was previously employed in a manufacturing company.  He hopes to expand his business and to improve his standard of living.  He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a welding machine and materials such as welding rods. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and welding rods

loans.name: Susan Cherotich

texts.en:
Susan Cherotich is a 38 year old mother. She is married to Stephen K., who is a farmer, and they are blessed with five children.

Susan practices farming, just like her husband, on their farm in Sergoit in Eldoret. For the last ten years she has been specializing in farming maize   which she later sells for a profit. She also sells milk from the cows she owns. Most of her customers are from Eldoret town. 

She is happy to say that she was introduced to KADET by a KADET employee who was marketing KADET in her home area. Susan plans to use the money from the loan she has applied for to get seeds for maize planting. 

Her future goal is to be able to make more capital and also to buy more land to increase her output.

loans.use: to be seeds for maize farming

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 56 years old, married and has four children. He has been rearing poultry in his farm for eight years. He sells eggs and broilers to hotels and to local residents for special events such as weddings. He also grows vegetables and rears dairy cattle for commercial purposes. He was previously an employee before he retired to operate this business. 

He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him on managing his business because his business has improved.  He hopes to expand his business and to increase the market territory for his products. He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy broilers and chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy broilers and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Produce and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Ridah Jemwetich

texts.en:
Ridah Jemwetich, 49, is married to Dominic Jerop and they are blessed with three wonderful children. Ridah and her husband are both farmers in Sergoit in Eldoret. They have been farming for the last twenty years. They specialize in maize which they sell to their neighbors and to the biggest maize supplier in Kenya called National Cereals and Produce Board. She also sells milk from her cows to increase the family income.

Ridah was introduced to KADET by one of her neighbors who is also a KADET client. She will use the loan  for farming and to pay school fees of Ksh 1,000 for her daughter.

 Her goal is to build rental houses on her land in order to increase the family income.

loans.use: To prepare land for maize farming

loans.name: Matiko

texts.en:
Matiko M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Matiko is 38 years old and is married to a driver. She has four children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells honey at retail prices to her customers. She is 30 years old and married with four children. She is the only person in her community that does this business. She is well known in her community and this gives her high patronage. Honey is used in Nigeria for a lot of things like marriage and making herbal medicines. 

Mary hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more honey to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more honey to sell

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
El señor Norberto Terán R. tiene 51 años. El señor Norberto vive solo con sus 4 hijos, trabaja todos los días en su carpintería fábrica inmuebles (mesas, sillas, roperos, camas, puertas y ventanas).

El señor Norberto vive en colomi zona este sobre la carretera Cbba-Santa Cruz, en su domicilio es donde tiene su carpintería. Todo los inmuebles lo que hace, vende en el mismo domicilio, que también realiza pedidos al gusto del cliente. El  señor Norberto es conocido en la zona por la actividad a la cual se dedica y por ser una persona muy trabajador; Que también entrega puntual a los pedidos que tiene.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de madera para su taller de carpintería, fabricar inmuebles (mesas, sillas, roperos, puertas, camas y ventanas) el cual tuvo una elevación de precio y lo que tenía planeado gastar ahora no le alcanza. El señor Norberto espera poder incrementar con la compra de más madera fabricara mas inmuebles, con un siguiente préstamo de tal forma que gane lo suficiente para poder mejorar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norberto Terán R., 51, lives alone with his 4 children. He works every day in his carpentry shop making furniture (tables, chairs, armoires, doors and windows). Norberto lives in Colomi, an area along the Cbba-Santa Cruz highway; his shop is in his home. His home is also his store. He also makes items to order. He is well-known in the area for the work he does and for being a very hard-working person, who delivers his completed orders on time. He will use the funds to buy wood for his shop. Wood has gone up in price and what he had planned to spend now isn’t enough. He hopes to increase his supply of wood so that he can make more furniture. A future loan will make it possible for him to earn enough to make improvements to his home and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 38 years of age. He has a quarry where he mines building stones and sells them to people constructing new houses. He has been in this business for 13 years and has four employees. He is happy to be a member of Faulu Kenya, since he can access loans to expand his business. He hopes to buy a lorry to transport stones from the mines to his customers' construction sites. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to purchase more land for quarrying.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for quarrying

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling fish and vegetables

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is an ambitious 41-year-old man who has been operating a barber shop for six years.  He also practices mixed farming for commercial use and for his own consumption.  His wife is also a business-lady who runs a green grocer shop.  Joseph uses his money to educate his four children, provide for his family's basic needs and to pay wages to his two employees.  

He appreciates that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his sales have increased hence his living standards have improved.  He saves part of his income with Faulu Kenya and he plans to take a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to open up a salon.  Therefore, he wants to buy a hair blow drier, hair products and hair drier.  He hopes to establish a permanent home for his family in the future.

loans.use: Equipment and supplies for salon

loans.name: Luz De Fe 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is the coordinator of her group Luz de Fe (Light of Faith), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty industrial town north of the Capitol, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Francisca is excited to be taking her first loan from Esperanza and she is excited at the opportunity to grow her business and have access to low cost capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a fantasia, small store which caters towards women, by investing in merchandise such as blouses, jeans, hair products and accessories. She will use the profits to invest in saving towards the future of her children who she wants to send to University and being able to purchase her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Hair products, clothes and accessories for resale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR ROLANDO SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE TRANSPORTE URBANO DE PASAJEROS, EL COMENZO CON ESTE ACTIVIDADPORQUE NO ENCONTRABA TRABAJO CON EL RUBRO DE SUS ESTUDIOS QUE ES MUY COMUN EN BOLIVIA QUE PERSONAS PROFESIONALES POR LA FALTA DE EMPLEO SE DEDIQUEN A SER CHOFERES, SACO UN PRESTAMO DEL BANCO PARA COMPRAR UNA MOVILIDAD Y ASI TENER ESTOS INGRESOS YA QUE EL NO PUDO SOLO VER QUE SUS PAPAS LE DEN DINERO ACTUALMENTE ESTA TRABAJANDO DE CHOFER QUE TRABAJA DESDE TEMPRANAS HORAS DEL DIA HASTA ALTAS HORAS DE LA NOCHE, AHORA EL SE ENCUENTRA  MUY FELIZ CON SU MOVILIDAD YA QUE CONOCE A NUEVAS PERSONAS Y TIENE MUCHOS CLIENTES Y NO TIENE QUE PREOCUPARSE PARA LLEVAR EL PAN DE CADA DIA A SU HOGAR. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO REALIZARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU VEHICULO.
ES UN JOVEN MUY TRABAJADOR Y ESTA AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Rolando provides urban public transportation services. He went into this line of work because he couldn’t find employment in his chosen career. It is very common in Bolivia for professional people, who can’t find work, to become drivers. He took out a bank loan to buy his vehicle in order to have a source of income so as not to depend on his parents for money any longer. He works as a driver from very early in the morning until very late at night. He is happy with his vehicle because he gets to meet new people and he has many customers so he does not have to worry about earning his daily income. He will use the requested funds for vehicle maintenance and repair. He is a very hard-working young man and he’s grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
