William is a 26 year old married man with one child.  He buys milk from farmers and distributes to hotels and to other consumers in his residential area. His business is located in Kiserian which is a few miles away from Nairobi. He has two employees to assist him in the business.  

His dream is to buy his own dairy cattle and to be a major supplier of milk in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy more milk for sale. William's wife is a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more milk for sale

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr:
Mbavu C. est présidente du groupe de crédit Rafiki, elle lève la main sur la photo , cliente au 10e  cycle de credit, âgée de 42 ans, mariée. Elle est mère de  13 enfants  parmi lesquels   9  etudient,3 sont marié et le cadet n’a pas l’âge scolaire. Son mari est huissier dans une coopec. Signalons que cette maman a mis au monde à deux reprises des jumeaux.
Elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre de 10$ reçu de son voisin sous forme d’assistance  non remboursable. Elle est vendeuse ambulante  des souliers usagers dans la ville de Goma. Il y a 14 ans qu’elle exerce cet activité de vente des  souliers usagers. Elle vend également des pommes de terre à domicile pour accroitre ses revenus.
Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima, Mbavu C. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant   20 paires des souliers usagers.
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de changer d’activité en ouvrant une petite boutique de vente des produits divers, et à la longue achéter une parcelle pour sa famille.
 Mbavu C. rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grace à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
Ce groupe est  composé des 21 membres majoritairement femmes et un seul homme. Il sièd de signaler que la cliente Kabuo K. est malade et elle a été representée par son mari, d’où deux hommes visibles sur la photo.
texts.en:
Mbavu C. is the president of this loan group named 'Rafiki'; she is the one raising her hand in the group photo. She's on her 10th loan, aged 42, and married. She is the mother of 13 children of whom nine are enrolled in school, three are married, and the youngest is not yet of school age. Her husband is a bailiff in a co-op. Please note that this mother has two sets of twins. She began her little business with her own working capital of US$ 10, received from her neighbor as a non-reimbursable loan aimed at helping her situation. She goes around the streets of Goma selling used shoes. She has been in this business for 14 years. She also sells potatoes out of her home to add to her income. With the micro-finance institution Hekima's loan, Mbavu C. hopes to raise her profit by buying 20 pairs of used shoes. In future, she plans to change businesses by opening a little general store and in the long run she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land for her family. Mbavu C. thanks MFI Hekima for the loans that she has received without any tangible assets as collateral because it is thanks to these loans that she manages to support her children. This group is made up of 21 members, all women with the exception of one man. Please also note that our client Kabuo K. is ill and her husband represented her, for which reason there are two men visible in the group photo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 20 pairs of used shoes for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Adereni

texts.en: Adereni sells medicines and groceries to make a living. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She hopes to own a big pharmacy stall in the future. She is 45 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a policeman and he also supports their home. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicines to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is 26 years of age. She has a series of businesses such as selling charcoal, chips, and shoes.  She has two employees who assist her in these businesses. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her about keeping proper records in her businesses.  She hopes to expand her businesses and improve her living standards in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to add stocks of charcoal, ladies and children’s shoes, and potatoes for cooking chips.

loans.use: Charcoal and shoes for resale; potatoes making chips

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sewing machines and work supplies

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this drink business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. She is 40 years old and married with three children. Her children are doing well in school. Iyabo’s husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. 

Iyabo hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and stronger. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 49-year-old married man with six children. Two of the children are in school. He has been selling charcoal and cattle for ten years. He buys cattle from farmers at a lower price and sells them to butchers. He has one employee to assist him in his businesses. He was previously employed as a driver. He describes himself as hardworking and honest. 

Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, his business has grown and his profit margin has increased. He hopes to expand his charcoal business to a wholesale and to improve his standard of living in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow. 

In the photo are Elijah and his wife.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, bread, cooking oil and other items for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.en: Mira J. is a widow who has been managing her household on her own. She has a son, who is 23. The son is a member of a farm association. She and her son make their living by raising cattle. Three years ago, Mira bought some sheep and started breeding. In spite of all the difficulties, she was able to save $340 and invest in purchasing cattle. Now her monthly income constitutes around $135. Mira has applied for this loan as she hopes to buy a cow to feed and subsequently sell its milk. This coming fall, she plans to marry her son. It is refreshing to see how people of a relatively old age show this much perseverance and genuine desire to achieve success in their businesses. They are like the runner who has run all the way and, when everybody expects he will fall down from exhaustion and fatigue, suddenly looks ahead and with a smile begins to pick up his pace. Mira is the leader of this group. Mira’s partners are: Gulsyina, 51, is a widow. She has two children. To make a living, Gulsyina keeps some cattle. Her children provide a tremendous help looking after the cattle. Gulsyina's monthly income from trading in cattle is around $95. Gulsyina needs a loan to invest in increasing the total population of her livestock. Toktobubu, 48, is married and has two children. Her husband is an electrician. They keep cattle and sell some of their livestock from time to time to meet their needs. Toktobubu needs a loan to invest in purchasing more cattle. Jyldyz, 49, is divorced. She is the mother of three children. All the children help their mother look after the livestock. The eldest son is a farmer; the other two children still go to school. Jyldyz has applied for this loan to increase the total population of her livestock. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3 P's concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Divina Luz 3 Group

texts.en:
Olfa is the coordinator of her group, Divina Luz (Divine Light). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many Dominican clients have recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in L. Alcarrizos: a dusty, industrial town north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Olfa is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and to have the opportunity to access capital at low interest rates. She plans to use this loan to invest in her beauty salon by purchasing more hair products as well as adding a small clothes business to complement her salon. She will use the profits to invest in an inverter for her home to help mitigate the effect of frequent blackouts and to save towards the future of her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair products and clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sewing machines and work supplies

loans.name: Suior's Group

texts.en: Suior K. is the leader of this group. She has reached an old age and still works. She has been working for her whole life with the sole purpose of providing a happy and decent life for her family. Suior, even at this age, does not want to sit on a couch watching TV. Her main activity is raising cattle: the activity which has been passed down from generation to generation and has finally reached her. Suior has many years experience raising cattle and this has made her a professional livestock raiser. Now, despite being a widow, she does not feel old and alone. She just does not have time for that. All her children are grown–up and live separately with their families, except the youngest son, Rahatbek. According to the Kyrgyz tradition, the smallest child stays with the parents and looks after them. Her son purchases cattle and Suior looks after them. Rahatbek is just twenty four years old. However, having a mother like Suior, he does not need to be afraid of lacking in experience. Five years ago, he started this business with three sheep which he bought at the cattle market. He sold them after raising them and was able to earn good money. At this time Suior needs a loan to purchase five to six sheep for feeding and resale. Suior’s partners are: Borukchu D., 70, is retired. Borukchu and his wife want to start a business. Their children are all married and live separately. Borukchu plans to purchase cattle to sell after feeding. Therefore, Borukchu has applied for this loan to buy cattle. Sonunbubu I., 68, is a mother of seven children. Her husband is a professional livestock raiser. He is retired now and has sufficient time to get engaged in raising cattle. Sonunbubu hopes to obtain this loan to invest in purchasing cattle. Jyldyzhan A., 43, and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. They have two children. Their daughter goes to college and their son is a school student. Jyldyzhan hopes to obtain this loan to invest in increasing his cattle population. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of both its customers and the society), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please click here If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase five or six sheep for feeding and resale

loans.name: Aydelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Aydelina del Carmen L. G. desde muy joven se dedica a la realización de calzado, en sus inicios trabajo en varios talleres donde aprendió esta hermosa labor.  Luego de un tiempo decidió independizarse y en el 2005 junto con su esposo instala un pequeño taller de calzado.   

Este es un negocio familiar el cual ha ido creciendo  según  L. esto es debido a que ellos  se han distribuido el trabajo adecuadamente, ella se dedica a la administración y comercialización del producto mientras su esposo se encarga de la producción junto a su hijo mayor y cinco trabajadores.  
 
Actualmente ella necesita del préstamo para invertir en materia prima para la producción de sandalias finas, veraniegas y de cuero que es lo de mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Aydelina del Carmen L. G. has made shoes since she was a young girl; she learned by working in various shops. In time, she decided to become independent and in 2005, together with her husband, she set up her own small cobbler's shop. This is a family business that has been steadily growing. According to her, this is due to the fact that they share the workload adequately: she administers the shop and sells the product while her husband, together with their oldest son and five employees, manufacture the goods. She currently needs financing to invest in raw materials to make fine Summer, leather sandals, which are in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem sells blocks at retail prices. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is requesting a loan of  N100,000 to purchase more blocks to sell. He is a hard working man and is determined to lift his business above poverty. He is 55 years old, married with 5 children. Kareem’s wife sells groceries to help her husband provide the basic needs for their family. He says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more blocks to sell

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
La Señora O. M. Maria Estela tiene un tamo su casa de habitación ubicada frente a la parada de buses del mercadito Santa Ana, ahí ella puso su negocio desde hace ocho años poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su tramos antes solo vendía refrescos y repostería solo contaba con una sola vitrina empezo con un capital de C$ 4,000.00  aporte de su esposo.
La Señora O. en la actualidad tiene un tipo comedor en su casa que vende comida y una mini librería que vende utiles escolares y para oficina con ayuda de sus hijas anteriormente era ama de casa tiene año y medio de trabajar con ceprodel y sus financiamientos los a invertido para su negocio del cual le dedica tiempo abre su negocio a las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde tiene nietas que le llegan a ayudar a despachar a los clientes
texts.en:
Maria Estela O. M. operates a business in her home, which is located across from the bus stop at the small Santa Ana market. She started her business eight years ago, and little by little she has been expanding its stock. At first, she only sold soft drinks and pastries and had only a single display case. She began with a capital investment of 4,000 Nicaraguan cordobas (NIO), which was contributed by her husband. Currently, Mrs. O.' business includes a snack bar in her home where she sells food, as well as a mini-bookstore offering school and office supplies. Her daughters help her with her work. Before she started this business, she was a housewife. She has worked with Ceprodel for a year and a half, and she has invested the loans in her business. She dedicates a great deal of time to her business, keeping it open from six in the morning until five in the evening. She also has grandchildren who come and help her serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying items for her business, including food ingredients and office supplies

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: Née en 1963 Sègbomè au Bénin, C. Anne-Marie vit depuis environs 6 ans à Atinkanmey, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais actuellement, Anne-Marie vit avec deux de ses enfants, et assure seule leurs charges. Anne-Marie n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Anne-Marie dispose d'un congélateur où elle vend de l'eau en sachet (communément appelée "Pur Water") en gros à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Anne-Marie vend également des produits de toilette et des cartes de recharge téléphonique à son domicile. Anne-Marie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi dans les kiosques, en ce qui concerne l'achat des cartes de recharge. Anne-Marie mène cette activité depuis 28 ans environs et a déjà obtenu trois crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Anne-Marie sollicite un autre crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et d'acquérir un nouveau congélateur ; ce qui lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Sègbomè (Benin), Anne-Marie C. has lived for the past six years in the Atinkanmey neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow, mother of three children, all having attended school. Currently she lives with two of her children, and provides their support. Anne-Marie has only attended primary school. To meet her different challenges, Anne-Marie makes use of a freezer to sell bags of congealed water (commonly called “Pure Water”), wholesale from her house. As a parallel activity, she sells beauty products and telephone recharge cards from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and also in the telephone kiosks, with regard to the telephone recharge cards. She has been running this business for about 28 years and has already been granted three loans from ALIDé, all correctly reimbursed. Anne-Marie is requesting a new loan so that she can strengthen her activity and buy a new freezer. This will allow her to expand her activity and increase the number of customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell smoked fish

loans.name: Kulshara's Group

texts.en: The heroes of this story are these people who always have a positive outlook and look for extra ways of using the opportunities around them. They have children and, for the sake of them and their future, these people are making great sacrifices every day. Kulshara is the leader of this group. She is forty three years old. Her husband is a member of a farm association. When he has free time he works as a taxi driver. Together they have raised five children. Two of her daughters are married while the other three children are school students. Kulshara is a housewife. Besides running a household, she has about five sheep. Whenever they need money they sell sheep to meet their needs. Sometimes they butcher the sheep and sell the meat. This activity brings them around 45 dollars a month. They started keeping sheep ten years ago. Originally they bought three sheep, fed them and sold them. This made them a pretty decent profit and became their usual way of earning money. As a result, they have been able to raise their children without obstacles. Kulshara is applying for a loan to buy one cow to produce milk for sale. Kulshara has four partners: Turganbubu, 56, raises cattle. Currently she has a horse. Her children have grown up and Turganbubu is already raising her grandchildren. Her husband is a retired man and he actively helps her look after the cattle. Turganbubu hopes to obtain this loan to buy a cow. Salkynbubu, 58, is the wife of a school teacher. She stays at home and looks after cattle. Salkynbubu is the mother of eight children. All her children have grown up and now make their own living. Salkynbubu has applied for this loan to buy some sheep. Sharapat, 58, is the mother of eight children. All her children are grown–up and live separately. Sharapat and her husband are retired. They keep some cattle and need a loan to purchase cattle. Ainura, 47, has two children. Her husband works in the local municipality. Ainura has a small shop and sells foodstuffs. She needs a loan to purchase some sheep. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of both its customers and the society), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please click here If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy 1 cow to produce milk for sale

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora ALEJANDRA G. FERNANDEZ, se dedica a la Lecherìa, asimismo siembra maíz para la venta de choclos en el mercado lanza en su época, entrega leche al mòdulo de su zona, vive en la Maica Sud parada 10.

Es casada hacen 20 años tiene tres hijas entre 18 y 7 años de edad.  Su esposo trabaja la tierra en las siembras y cosechas y asimismo trabaja como albañil durante el año en diferentes obras de construcción.

Quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, tiene una vivienda a medio construir de 2 habitaciones.  Quiere comprar con el crédito soya para el alimento de sus vacas durante el año.
texts.en:
ALEJANDRA G. FERNANDEZ is a dairy farmer; she also farms corn, which she sells in the Lanza market in her area. She sells the milk to the area's milk processor. She lives in Maica Sud, stop 10. She has been married for 20 years and has three daughters, ranging between 18 and 7 years of age. Her husband is a fieldworker during planting and harvest and also works as a bricklayer year-round at various construction sites. They want to improve their living conditions. They have a two-bedroom, still unfinished home. She will use the funds to buy a year's worth of feed for his cows.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed (soy) for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Oluwabumi

texts.en: Oluwabumi has a bookstore. She is happy in this business because of the opportunity to educate people with her books. She is a hard-working and friendly woman. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more books to sell. She hopes to grow her business to be a classic bookstore in the future. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. Her children are still young and they are dependent on her. They attend school. Her husband also works to support their household. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar E. es un señor risueño, trabajador, horrado, con un buen sentido del humor y optimista. Este señor de 63 años aun recuerda como si fuera ayer como 1960 aprendió el proceso de la realización de cazado según comento el empezó con lo más mínimo pero con el tiempo se fue especializando y luego decidió poner su propio Taller de Calzado.

En este le ha ido muy bien y tiene bastantes solicitudes es por ello que necesita del crédito para comprar la materia prima como Brasil, azulón, cuero, pega, plantilla, hilos, suelas, clavos etc. para la producción de zapatos y sandalias artesanales.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar E. is an agreeable, hard-working, honest, optimistic man with a good sense of humor. He is 63 years old and remembers 1960, when he learned to make shoes, as if it were yesterday. He tells us that he started out with the barest minimum skills but, in time, began to specialize and eventually set up his own shoe shop. He has done well with it and has many orders. This is why he needs financing to buy raw materials like: leather, soles, adhesive, thread, nails, etc. to make artesanal shoes and sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Waly Daan 3 Group

texts.fr: Waly  Daan 3 est un groupe de 6 femmes domiciliées  au quartier Noflaye  a Bambilor et qui évoluent dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus d’un an. Pour ne pas rester inactives ces femmes ont choisi de s’occuper en vendant des draps, tissus, de l’huile de palme, des parfums, des œufs et du miel. Cette activité les aide a subvenir a leurs besoins quotidiens. Elles sollicitent un crédit de 600 000 frs destine a l’achat de produits commercialisés  en vue de renforcer leurs activités. L’objectif vise par ce groupe est d’accroitre l’offre et  par conséquent  mieux développer la clientèle. Le femme dont le visage n'est pas visible n'est pas membre du groupe et c'est pour ca qu'on a couvré son visage.
texts.en:
Waly Dann 3 is a group of six women who live in the Noflaye district of Bambilor. They have been involved in the business sector for more than a year. To remain active these women have chosen to sell sheets, fabrics, palm oil, perfume, eggs and honey. This work helps them to meet their daily needs. They are requesting a credit of 600,000FRS to buy merchandise in order to strengthen their business. The goal of this group is to increase their supplies, which will allow them to further develop their client base. The woman whose face is covered is not a member of the group, which is why her face was covered up.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock and sell manioc flour

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca Adriana M. A. vende en la esquina opuesta al mercado central en una acera tiene de vender 20 años de estar ubicada ahí, su financiamiento lo solicito porque nesecitaba surtir su negocio de mercadería que ya no tenia.
La Señora M. A. tiene tres hijos de los cuales los ha sabido sacar adelante se esfuerza enormemente para ellos los tres dos de ellos ya son profesionales pero estan desempleados la otra hija esta estudiando pero los tres le ayudan a vender en el negocio.
Vienen a vender a las ocho y media de la mañana y se van tipo seis de la tarde diario de lunes a domingo  ellos venden hogdog, gaseosas, pollo frito con papas hamburguesas, shanwis.
Anteriormente la señora M. vendía cosmético ambulante pero luego decidio poner su negocio  con un capital de C$ 3,000.00 que los ahorro, ahora ella ya cuenta con un mejor mobiliario para sus clientelas ya no se asolea dio a hacer un toldo y tiene mejor acondicionado su negocio. Ella me manifestó que todo lo que tiene es gracias a ceprodel porque con los financiamientos que le hemos dado a podido salir adelante junto con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca Adriana M. A. has been operating her business from the corner opposite the central market for nearly 20 years. She is asking for a loan because she would like to stock her store with merchandise that she doesn't have yet. Señora M. A. has three children. She knew she had to work very hard to move forward for them. Two are already professionals but are unemployed right now. Although her other daughter is a student, all three help her with sales. Seven days a week, she comes to the market at eight-thirty in the morning and stays until around 6 in the evening. They sell hotdogs, sodas, fried chicken with french fries, hamburgers and sandwiches. Previously, Señora M. peddled cosmetics but then decided to put 3,000 C. that she had saved into starting a business. Now her business has more furnishings her clients can enjoy, gets more sunshine better airconditioning and has an awning. She tells us that all this success is thanks to Ceprodel because we gave her the financing she needed to get ahead and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the business including mayonaise, sauces, bread, sausage, chicken and potatoes

loans.name: Gulbayra's Group

texts.ru:
Сагындыкова Гульбайра – лидер данной группы. Гульбайра уже достигла преклонного возраста, а именно ей уже пятьдесят лет. Однако Гульбайра не спешит на покой. Её трое детей давным давно взрослые люди. Старшый сын холост, работает в фирме в Бишкеке, а дочь замужем. Самый младший сын также пока не женат и работает в мебельном цехе. Имея таких детей любая мать предпочла бы сидеть дома и отдыхать. Но это не стихия Гульбайры, которая всю жизнь находиться и любит находиться в водовороте повседневной жизни, в труде. На данный момент она продаёт скот на скотном рынке. Гульбайра начала свой бизнес пять лет назад, когда она вместе с мужем откормили и продали одного бычка, а вырученные деньги пустили в оборот. Сейчас бизнесом занимается в основном сама Гульбайра, но постоянно пользуется поддержкой мужа. Муж Гульбайры работает в школе. И как у всех работников этой сферы у её мужа не совсем высокая зарплата. И благодаря деятельности Гульбайры им живётся довольно – таки неплохо. За эти годы Гульбайра достигла многого: купила участок земли под застройку в г. Бишкек (столица Кыргызстана), выдала дочь замуж. Её ежемесячный доход составляет около пяти тысяч сомов ($110). Гульбайра решила обратиться за кредитом, так как хочет купить двух бычков для перепродажи. В будущем она планирует женить сыновей, построить дом, и расширить бизнес за счёт увеличения поголовья скота. 

У Гульбайры четыре партнёра по группе:

Бейшембаевой Динаре тридцать семь лет. Она вдова. У Динары две дочери. Обе учатся в средней школе. Динара работает системным администратором в госрегистре. Динара хочет получть этот кредит и купить электропечь, DVD плейер и пылесос. 

Малчиевой Жаныл пятьдесят два года. Её супруг – специалист в Госрегистре. А сама Жаныл реализует товары в магазине. У Жаныл трое сыновей. Двое из них до сих пор живут с родителями. Жаныл надеется получить кредит и купить два мешка сахара для перепродажи. 

Кадыровой Ырысбубу шестьдесят семь лет. Ырысбубу и её муж – пенсионеры. Но современная жизнь показала, что человек при желании и воли может стать кем захочет в любом возрасте. Ырысбубу – бизнес леди. Она продаёт крупнорогатый скот и лошадей. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы купить трёх баранов.

Токомбаевой Болгонай пятьдесят пять лет. Болгонай вырастила шестерых детей. Все дети уже выросли и устроились в жизни. Болгонай до сих пор трудится. Она производт женскую трикотажную одежду на заказ. Она надеется получить кредит и купить тридцать мотков трикотажной нити.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulbayra S. is the leader of this group. She has reached an old age, and specifically, she is already fifty years old. However, Gulbayra is no hurry to rest. Her three children have become adults a long time ago. The oldest son is single and works at a company in Bishkek, and the daughter is married. The youngest son is also single and works at a furniture factory. Having such good children, any mother would have preferred to stay home and rest. But this is not Gulbayra’s calling. She spends and has spent her life in a water funnel of everyday life, in hard work. Currently, she sells livestock at the livestock market. Gulbayra started her business five years ago, when she and her husband fattened and sold one bull and put the profit into turnover. Now, Gulbayra is primarily involved in the business, but always uses her husband’s support. He works at a school. And just like many employees in this field, her husband’s salary is not high at all. Thanks to Gulbayra’s business, they live fairly well. Gulbayra achieved a lot over the years: bought a plot of land in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan) to be used for construction, married off her daughter. Her monthly income is about five thousand som ($110). Gulbayra decided to request a loan because she wants to buy two bulls for resale. In the future, she plans to marry off her sons, build a house and expand the business by increasing the livestock headcount. Gulbayra has four partners in the group: Dinara B. is thirty-seven years old. She is a widow and has two daughters, both of whom attend school. Dinara works as a system administrator at the city registry. She wants to obtain this loan in order to buy an electric oven, DVD player and vacuum cleaner. Janyl M. is fifty-two years old. Her husband is a specialist at the city registry. And Janyl sells merchandise at a store. She has three sons, two of whom still live with their parents. Janyl wants to obtain the loan and buy two bags of sugar for resale. Yrysbubu K. is sixty-seven years old. She and her husband are retired. Current life, however, showed that a person with desire and will can become whoever she wants to be at any age. Yrysbubu is a businesswoman. She sells cattle and horses. She needs the loan to buy three sheep. Bolgonay T. is fifty-five years old. She raised six children, all of whom are grown and lead independent lives. Bolgonay still works. She makes women’s knitwear to-order. She hopes to obtain the loan and purchase thirty rolls of knit thread.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls for resale

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: este cliente es originario de la cuidad de leon, ha resibido diferentes creditos con el animo de mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que ha tenido varios creditos, como construccion de vivienda, compra de motos,y este ultimo para lo antes mencionado.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a native of the City of Leon. He has received a number of different loans with the objective of improving his living standard. He has already had a number of loans that he used for construction on his house, to buy a moto-taxi, and this one for the purpose mentioned (to buy a computer.)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get fresh supplies for her shop

loans.name: Ramon Isabel

texts.es: este cliente es orginario de la comarca las mercedes,quezalguaque, se dedica al trabajo de transporte de carga pequeña,es casado su esposa es ama de casa, el a tenido 7 creditos con esta empresa siempre para mejoramiento en la venta de servicio,mejorando la unidad con los ahorros y el credito.
texts.en:
Ramon Isabel A. S. comes from the area of Las Mercedes, Quezalguaque. His business is transporting small quantities of cargo. He is married, and his spouse is a housewife. He has had 7 previous loans with this organization, and he has always used them to increase the level of sales for his services; he has also improved his vehicle using the loan funds along with his savings.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tires for his small truck

loans.name: Elija

texts.en: Elija is a commercial motorcyclist and he derives much joy in conveying his passengers from one part of his city to another. The demands for his services are increasing and he hopes to hire a person to join him in his business. He hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase a motorcycle to boost his business. He is 34 years old and married with three children. His wife sells groceries to support their home. He hopes to own a big transport company in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Alioza Marinlyn

texts.es: Alioza tiene 43 años, hace algún tiempo se tuvo que separar del padre de sus 3 hijos ya mayores, y con el menor vive  en la casa de su madre, en un barrio populoso ubicado al sur de la ciudad.Su labor cotidiana es aplicar los bordados de las chompas tejidas que le  provee una  fábrica reconocida. Recoge una vez a la semana  las prendas y  después tiene que bordar en la parte delantera de las chompas, flores o paisajes de la sierra, que son muy solicitados en otros países. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que se mantiene muy ocupada y  es beneficioso, porque le pagan regular  por cada bordado a crochet  y también de acuerdo a los detalles de las agujas, dependiendo de la complejidad y el tiempo empleado. Cuando tiene mucho trabajo su hija la apoya, ya que cuanto más bordados realiza, mayores son sus ganancias. Y de ese modo quiere brindarle una educación  superior a su hija.Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, y  ratifica su compromiso de pagar las cuotas  establecidas oportunamente, porque su deseo es seguir contando con posteriores préstamos que le permitirán continuar  trabajando. Además  en su banco comunal se siente a gusto porque todas las integrantes  son responsables.Con el dinero que solicita, Alioza  comprará lanas de diversos grosores  y colores, para que su trabajo sea de un buen acabado y obtenga cada vez  mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alioza is 43 years old. She has been separated from the father of her 3 grown children for some time. She lives with her youngest child in her mother's house in a populated neighborhood located south of the city. She works daily doing embroidery on knit sweaters that are produced by a well-known factory. She collects the garments once a week and later applies the embroidery to the front of the sweaters, including flowers or the landscape of the mountains. These sweaters are in high demand in other countries. She likes this work very much, since it keeps her occupied and is profitable because they pay for each embroidered item according to the details of the needles, the complexity and the time spent. When she has a lot of work she supports her daughter, since the more embroidery she does the higher her earnings. In this way she wants to provide a college education for her daughter. This is her 7th loan from MFP, and she affirms that she is committed to making her payments according to the set schedule, because she wants to continue to take out loans that will allow her to continue working. In addition, she likes her communal bank because all of the members are responsible. With the money that she requests Alioza will buy wool of various thicknesses and colors, so that her work will provide a good finish to the product and she will have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy materials for embroidery

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: D. Juliette est née le 15 Juin 1967 et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. C'est une célibataire qui vit seule et supporte seule ses charges. Juliette vit en effet, au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Juliette n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Juliette mène comme activité, la vente de chaussures et des tenues pour hommes et pour dames. C'est à Lomé au Togo, mais aussi au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou, que Juliette s'approvisionne. Mais Juliette vend ses produits devant sa maison à Agla. Juliette exerce cette activité depuis 12 ans et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Juliette a bien effectué tous les remboursements des crédits antérieurs qu'elle a obtenus. Juliette voudrait augmenter le stock de ses produits et diversifier son activité, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Juliette sollicite un quatrième prêt. Plus tard, Juliette envisage ouvrir une boutique pour y vendre ses produits et attirer plus la clientèle.
texts.en:
Juliette D. was born on 15th June 1967 and has two children, both of whom are at school. She is a single woman who lives alone and covers her expenses herself. Juliette lives in the Agla neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She went to primary school only. In order to provide for her needs, she has a business selling shoes and clothes for men and women. Juliette gets her supplies in Lomé in Togo, but also on the Missebo market in Cotonou. However, she sells her products in front of her house in Agla. Juliette has been carrying out this business for the past twelve years and has already benefited from three loans from ALIDé. She made all the repayments on the previous loans she took out. Juliette would like to increase her stock of products and diversify her business in order to satisfy her customers more. For this reason she is applying for a fourth loan. Later on, Juliette is planning to open a shop to sell her products there and attract more customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of second hand clothing for women and men, as well as shoes

loans.name: Asociación Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Asociación sin Fronteras está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras provenientes de Masaya ciudad de la flores y cuna de folklor nicaragüense. La coordinadora de este grupo es la señora Lidia de los Ángeles P. S. ella comercializa artesanías y cosméticos desde hace cuatro años. 

P. con el préstamo adquirirá nueva mercadería en ambos productos para seguir aumentando el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 

La otras integrantes son Socorro   Benita Rodríguez la cual aproximadamente desde hace 15 años se dedica a venta de papel a las comiderias las cuales lo ocupan para servir la comida y Felipa Lorena E. vende en las calles del municipio de Tipitapa verduras y pan. Ambas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios para que estos progresen.
texts.en:
The group “Asociación sin Fronteras” (Association Without Borders) consists of three hardworking and enterprising women from Masaya, the city of flowers and the cradle of Nicaraguan folklore. The group coordinator is Sra. Lidia de los Ángeles P. S., who has been selling handicrafts and cosmetics for four years. She will use her loan to acquire new merchandise so that she can continue increasing her business and improve her living conditions.

The other members are Socorro Benita Rodríguez who, for approximately 15 years, has been selling paper to establishments that sell food. Felipa Lorena E. is a street vendor in the town of Tipitapa who sells vegetables and bread. Both of them will invest the loan in their respective businesses in order to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis, tiene su domicilio en la Calle Portocarrero en la zona de Villa Copacabana, esta casado con la Sra. Roxana, quien es comerciante de ropa, el Sr Luis trabaja como taxi libre y ademas tiene en las mañanas contratos con escolares a los cuares lleva a sus respectivos colegios, el es muy amable y esta feliz de que se le otorgue un crédito kiva ya que le gusta que su vehiculo siempre este en buen estado. tiene 2 hijos y el siempre trata de dar un ejemplo de responsabilidad y trabajo a ellos.Esta muy agradecido com Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Luis has a home on the Portocarrero Street in the Villa Copacabana neighborhood. He is married to Roxana, who sells clothing. Luis works providing taxi service. Also, in the mornings he has contracts with students who he takes to their respective schools. He is very friendly and is happy to be granted a loan, since he wants his vehicle to always be kept in good condition. He has 2 children and he always tries to give a good example of responsibility and hard work to them. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal A. A. is a hard working man who is determined to excel in his business and family. To make a living in Ibadan, he sells rechargeable phone cards at retail prices to his customers. He hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He hopes to expand his business. His greatest challenge in business is funds and he hopes to overcome the challenge. He is 64 years old and married with seven children. He is not only a husband and father; he is also a happy grandfather. His wife sells pastries to support her husband. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cards to sell

loans.name: Aynakul's Group

texts.ru:
Сардарова Айнакуль – лидер данной группы. Айнакуль шестьдесят два года. Она мать троих детей. Двое из детей учатся в ВУЗах, а младший сын учится в школе. Муж Айнакуль – член крестьянского хозяйства. Он занимаетс я хозяйством и держит живность. По выходным выходит на скотный рынок и перепродаёт скот. Дети активно помогают своим родителям. Айнакуль – представитель очень редкого ремесла. Она изготавливает национальные ковры из натурального войлока, известные под названием “ширдаки”.  Айнакуль уже тридцать лет занимается этим древним ремеслом и является настоящей мастерицей своего дела. Её ширдаки имеют славу далеко за пределами родной республики. За прошедшие годы Айнакуль участвовала на многих ярмарках как у себя на Родине, так и зарубежом. В 2004 – году Айнакуль посетила Швейцарию, а также Казахстан. В данное время она является членом НПО “Алтын Кол”, что в переводе означает “золотые руки”. Её ремесло приносит около пяти тысяч сомов в месяц. Айнакуль не хочет останавливаться на достигнутом и хочет увеличить оборот, расширить бизнес. Она хочет найти иностранных инвесторов и выйти на мировой рынок. Её мечта – показать всему миру культуру кыргызского народа. Сейчас Айнакуль нуждается в кредите. Она хочет вложить средства для расширения своего дела. В ближайшем будущем семья Айнакуль собирается справлять семидесятилетие мужа и ещё раз съездить заграницу. 

Партнёры Айнакуль по группе:

Мамбетсадыковой Эльмире двадцать шесть лет. Эльмира также занимается изготовлением национальных ковров из войлока “ширдаков”. Её муж – частный предприниматель, член крестьянского хозяйства. Эльмира обратилась за кредитом, так как хочет вложить средства в оборот, и иметь больше заказов. 

Токсоновой Бейшебубу сорок лет. Муж Бейшебубу – частный водитель. Бейшебубу – мать четверых детей. Она изготавливает “кийиз” – материал из шерсти для изготовления национальных ковров.  Бейшебубу надеется получить этот кредит и купить шерсть.

Асанкожоевой Талайкуль сорок два года. Вместе с мужем она растит четверых детей. Муж – частный строитель, член крестьянского хозяйства.  Талайкуль изготавливает сидушки, ширдаки и другие изделия. Она надеется получить этот кредит и вложить в оборот, а также на закупку шерсти.

Жапаровой Айзаде тридцать два года. Айзада изготавливает национальные изделия из войлока, а её муж занимается частным предпринимательством. У них четверо детей. Айзада обратилась за этим кредитом, так как хочет вложить средства в оборот и найти иностранных покупателей.

Бекдолотовой Сайракан тридцать восемь  лет. У Сайракан  один двенадцатилетний сын, и муж. Муж работает воителем в городском водоканале, а сама Сайракан помогает мужу заниматься параллельно закупкой скота. Закупкой занимается муж, а Сайракан ухаживает за скотом. Они решили обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить корову.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aynakul S. is the leader of this group. She is sixty-two years old and a mother of three children. Two of the children attend universities, and the youngest son goes to school. Aynakul’s husband is a member of a farm collective. He is involved in the household work and keeps livestock. He goes to the livestock market on the weekends and resells livestock. The children actively help their parents. Aynakul is a representative of a very rare craft. She makes national rugs out of natural felt, known as “shirdaki”. Aynakul has been involved in this rare craft for thirty years and is a true master of it. Her shirdaki are known far beyond the borders of her native republic. Over the last few years, Aynakul participated in many tradeshows, both in her homeland and abroad. She visited Switzerland in 2004 and also Kazakhstan. Currently, she is a member of NGO “Altyn Kol,” which means golden hands. Her craft brings in about five thousand som per month. Aynakul wants to find international investors and take her business to the world market. Her dream is to show the culture of the Kyrgyz people to the world. Now Aynakul needs a loan. She wants to invest money into expanding her business. In the near future, Aynakul’s family plans to celebrate the husband’s seventieth birthday and travel abroad once again. Aynakul’s group partners are: Elmira M. is twenty-six years old. She is also involved in making national rugs out of felt (shirdaki). Her husband is an entrepreneur and a member of a farm collective. Elmira requested the loan because she wants to increase turnover and also to purchase wool. Beyshebubu T. is forty years old. Her husband is a private driver. Beyshebubu is a mother of four children. She makes “kiyiz” – wool material used for making national rugs. She hopes to obtain this loan and purchase wool. Talaykul A. is forty-two years old. Together with her husband, she is raising four children. Her husband is an independent construction worker and a member of a farm collective. Talaykul makes sidushki, shirdaki and other goods. She hopes to obtain this loan and increase turnover, and also purchase wool. Ayzada J. is thirty-two years old. She makes national goods out of felt, and her husband is a entrepreneur. They have four children. Ayzada requested this loan because she wants to increase turnover and find international customers. Sayrakan B. is thirty-eight years old. She has a twelve-year-old son and a husband. Her husband works as a driver at the municipal water canal, and Sayrakan helps him with the livestock sales business. The husband buys the livestock, and Sayrakan takes care of it. They decided to request the loan in order to buy a cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kikoni Bakyara Tweyambe Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
K. Mauda, shown at the top left in the small photo, also appears in the group photo as its leader.

With a sense of determination to see that all her children attain an education before she gets to 55 years old, evergreen 40-year-old Mauda is an exemplary woman. She works hard on a daily basis to feed her children and buy them all the essentials they need for school, notwithstanding her modest business.

Mauda’s business operating area can be found in the premises of Ntungamo teachers college in western Uganda. She principally runs a retail shop business which, according to her admission, makes her 30,000/= a week and even more in the course of a month.

Mauda’s main challenge has been a lack of enough capital to expand and consolidate her business. She has been doing her business’s trivial round for the last thirteen years and she figures her business location has played into her hands for the most part.

Mauda’s future plans are to expand her business into a roaring one once she obtains a loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. is a businesswoman who loves her business. She sells groceries, plastics and sachet water at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is married with three children. Her children attend school and they are excelling in school. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es:
El grupo restauración lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, responsables y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora María Luisa Pavón S. quien por medio de una ayuda que le brindaron sus hermanos puso un pequeño caramanchel donde comercializa desde gaseosa, cigarros, comida, CD y DVD.

Desde hace cuatro años tiene este negocio el cual ha ido creciendo y en el que invertirá el crédito para la compra de mercadería.

Uno de sus compañeros de grupo es Eddy José Enríquez C. quien por las mañanas vende de forma ambulante cosa de horno postre nicaragüense a base de maíz y por las tardes comercializa discos. Mientras Ángela María U.  Ramírez quien anhela tener su casa y terreno propio se dedica a la comercialización de tortillas por las mañanas y café, leche y pan por las tardes.
Ellos invertirán los créditos en sus respectivos negocios para acrecentarlos.
texts.en:
The Restroration Group consists of three hardworking, responsible, and strong individuals. One of them is Sra. María Luisa Pavón S. who, with the help of her siblings, built a small covered pavilion where she sells sodas, cigarettes, food, CDs, and DVDs. Her business was established four years ago and has been growing. She will use this loan to buy merchandise.

One of the other group members is Eddy José Enríquez C. who works in the morning as a street vendor selling Nicaraguan baked desserts made of corn. In the afternoons, he sells records. Meanwhile, Ángela María U. Ramírez hopes to have her own house and land. She sells tortillas in the mornings and coffee, milk, and bread in the afternoons. They will invest their loans in order to expand their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tusiimye Development Group

texts.en:
John L. is a friendly 42-year-old married man. He has nine children who are between the ages of 6 and 18, and he also cares for a few orphans. He hopes that his family will always stay in good health.

John is a mechanic in Mantabulirwa. He is successful in his business because he makes a strong effort to have good customer care. He has been in this business for ten years now.

John dreams of expanding his business to make it larger. Today he is taking his 2nd loan with Pearl for 600,000 UGX to buy a tool box, spanners (wrenches), a pair of pliers, hammers and nails.
 
John's picture appears in the top left corner and he also appears in the group photo.

loans.use: To buy a tool box, spanners, a pair of pliers, etc.

loans.name: Fanny Luz

texts.es:
Fanny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 23 años, ella es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene un local alquilado cerca a la Plaza Armas del Cusco, donde expende sus productos de platería y ya son dos años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Los ingresos de la socia Fanny fueron afectados por la caída del turismo en la ciudad del Cusco. La poco afluencia de turistas se debe a las fuertes precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron durantes los meses de enero y febrero haciendo que muchos local cerraran por falta de ventas, pero Fanny es una joven impetuosa se sigue adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Fanny usará el préstamo para comprar más platería.  El sueño de la socia es tener su propia  tienda y así de esta manera vender más y tener más ingresos económicos y darse una mejor calidad de vida.    
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the Communal Bank "Sacsayhuaman", which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 23 years old. This hardworking and enterprising young woman managed to open her own business selling handicrafts. She has a rented location near the Plaza Armas in Cusco where she sells products made of silver. Fanny has already been in this business for two years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work. Her earnings were impacted by the slump in tourism in the city of Cusco. The lack of tourists that resulted from the heavy rains during the months of January and February caused many businesses to shut down due to a lack of sales. However, Fanny is a determined young woman who pressed forward despite these adversities. She will use this loan to buy more silver. Her dream is to have her own shop so that she can sell more and generate additional income that will provide her a better quality of life.

Fanny is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silver

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a widow with two grown sons. She rents a small store at the market and sells all kinds of clothing. She has been in this business for 13 years. She started this business when she lost her job. During this time, she invested all the additional income from her garden in this business. It has become the main source of her income. 

Lubov would like to start a second location at the market. To do so she needs to get a loan. Lubov is asking for 20,000 UAH, which she is going to spend on rent and additional merchandise. Lubov is going to hire one employee, giving someone she knows an opportunity to make a living too. Lubov's business goal is to purchase the store she is renting now. She hopes that starting the second location will help her to do so.

loans.use: To pay rent and buy merchandise for a second location

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tièssiri est composé de 5 femmes toutes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le quartier Bougoufiè de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. 
Le groupe Tièssiri fait le commerce d’articles divers avec les céréales, les habits, des condiments, des cosmétiques, des ustensiles en plastiques, du bois de chauffe, des fruits et légumes, des portes monnaies, de l’encens, etc.
 Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles décidèrent d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les sept précédents.
Ce  nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 4  chargements de camions en bois de chauffe, 2 colis d’ustensiles plastiques, 3 douzaines de porte monnaie, des matières premières pour la préparation d’encens (3kg de n’gueni, 4flacons d’eau de Cologne et de parfums), 10 corbeilles de papayes,  2 sacs de riz et des condiments pour la préparation du riz. 
Elles s’approvisionnent du Burkina Faso et  à la foire du grand marché de Ségou et effectuent leurs ventes aux marchés, à domicile et en ambulant, au comptant en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle diverse et variée.  
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31 600FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer à assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire, les frais de santé et la scolarisation des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Tièssiri group is composed of 5 women, all of whom are married and are on average 41 years old with 3 children. They live in traditional extended households in the Bougoufiè area of Ségou (4th Administrative Region of Mali), and know each other through neighbourhood relations. The Tièssiri group sells various items along with cereals, clothing, condiments, cosmetics, plastic utensils, firewood, fruits and vegetables, purses, incense, etc. With the goal of increasing their working capital and diversifying the goods that they sell, they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), with whom they are on their 8th solidarity (group) loan, after having properly repaid the seven previous ones. This new loan will be used to buy 4 truckloads of firewood, 2 packages of plastic utensils, 3 dozen purses, raw material for the preparation of incense (3 kg of n'gueni, 4 flasks of eau de cologne, and perfume), 10 baskets of papayas, 2 bags of rice, and condiments for the preparation of rice. They get their supplies in Burkina Faso and at the grand market fair in Ségou, and make their sales at the markets, at home, and door-to-door, in cash at retail and on credit, to a diverse and varied clientele. They intend to realize an average monthly profit of 31,600 FCFA, which will be used to ensure their ability to feed themselves and to pay for the health and education costs of their children. Their long-term goal is to obtain a house that they can use as a home.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals and kola nuts

loans.name: Sinignèssigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinignèssigui est composé de cinq  femmes ayant en moyenne 46 ans, 4 enfants et sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames. Elles vivent  dans le village de Ouélegana : région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et d’entre aide dans les activités hivernales.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers  et alimentaires.
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, elles ont décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt de groupe. Le premier a été bien remboursé. 
Ce deuxième prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 180sacs de feuilles de baobab, 140sacs de fakoye, 5 sacs de sel iodé, 1sac de riz et 50kg de poissons séchés ou fumés. Elles se ravitaillent  à la foire de Ségou et dans les villages de Benzena, Wessebougou, Donzana et Sonkebougou. Les produits sont revendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile, en ambulant et dans les différents marchés de Ségou. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.000FCA qui sera utilisé pour les soins de santé et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sinignèssigui group is composed of five women who are all married and, on average, 46 years old with 4 children. They live in polygamous households in the village of Ouélegana, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali), and know each other through familial, marriage, and neighbourhood relations, and by helping each other during the winter. This group of women sells various food items. With the goal of increasing their working capital, they decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), with whom they are on their second group loan. Their first loan was repaid properly. This second loan will be used to buy 180 bags of baobab leaves, 140 bags of fakoye leaves, 5 bags of iodized salt, 1 bag of rice, and 50 kg of dried or smoked fish. They get their supplies at the market fair in Ségou and in the villages of Benzena, Wessebougou, Donzana, and Sonkebougou. The products are re-sold at home, door-to-door, and at different markets in Ségou, at retail, in cash or on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 26,000 FCFA, which will be used to provide for the health and education of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Hilda Doris

texts.es: Hilda, D. 52 años,es una  mujer muy laboriosa, vive con su esposo y 2 D. sus 4 hijos, en su casa ubicada en un barrio urbanizado, del sur D. la ciudad.DesD. hace 25 años, se dedica a la confección D. ropa para  militares como: polos, boinas, escarpines y pantalones. Durante este tiempo tuvo muchos altibajos en su labor, pero gracias a los contactos que le brinda su esposo, que es militar, viene surgiendo D. a pocos. Ella es la encargada D. hacer los trazos  y cortes en su casa y cuenta con la  ayuda D. sus dos hijas, y para la costura deriva las prendas a una  casa D. confecciones especializada, ya que éstas deberán tener un buen  acabado y refuerzo, que solamente realizan las máquinas especiales. A pesar D. que debe pagar  por el cocido, la confección D. estas prendas le es muy  rentable, pues  la  contratan por grandes  bloques D. prendas. Es por esta razón que Hilda sueña  instalar algún día su propia empresa, porque ya tiene una buena cartera D. clientes.Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus  cuotas puntualmente, ya que piensa  contar con posteriores créditos, porque  quiere  seguir progresando en su negocio.Con el dinero solicitado comprará  varios fardos D. telas para la elaboración D. escarpines militares, así espera lograr atender un gran  pedido que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 52, is a very hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and two of their four children. Her house is in an urbanized area south of the city. For 25 years she has been making military clothing like shirts, berets, slippers, and pants. During this time she has had many highs and lows in her work. Thanks to her husband’s contacts, he is in the military, the business slowly rises. She is in charge of making the patterns and cutting them out in her house. Her two daughters help her. She takes the clothes to a specialized sewing house because they need to have good finishings, and they need to be reinforced. This can only be done with special machines. Even though she needs to pay for the sewing, making these items is very profitable. They contract her to make large amounts of clothing. That is why Hilda dreams of one day setting up her own business. She already has a good customer list. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all of her payments punctually. She plans on having more loans in the future because she wants to keep progressing in her business. She will use the money she is requesting to buy several bundles of fabric to make the military slippers. This way she hopes to take care of a large order that is pending.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy several bundles of fabric for her business

loans.name: Abass

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abass M.  est âgé de 35 ans, marié  et père   de 2 enfants.  Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants, avec plusieurs autres ménages, dans le quartier Médine de  la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école, il débuta  très tôt le commerce auprès de son père qui tenait une boutique. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, il évolue seul  en optant pour  le commerce d’articles  divers et  d’huile alimentaire depuis maintenant 12 ans. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, il  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui,  il est à  son 3ème prêt individuel. 
Il compte utiliser ce prêt,  pour acheter, une barrique d’huile. Il  s’approvisionne sur place et effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de supporter ses charges familiales et de faire un peu d’économie.
texts.en:
Mr. Abass M. is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his wife and children, along with several other households, in the Médine area of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school, he began working very early on with his father, who owned a store. After several years of apprenticeship, he developed his own business, choosing to sell various items and cooking oils, which he has done for 12 years now. With the goal of increasing his working capital in order to realize higher profits, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners), with whom he is on his 3rd individual loan. He intends to use this loan to buy one barrel of oil. He gets his supplies in the area and makes his sales in cash, at retail, and on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. With this loan, he plans to realize a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA. This profit will allow him to provide for his family and save a little bit of money.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Don Ricardo de 50 años de edad,  desde joven ha trabajado para lograr tener su propio negocio, actualmente tiene una pulpería que junto con su esposa administran,  para poder dar la alimentación y estudio a sus tres hijos  que cursan la secundaria. El comenzó ahorrar parte de su salario de su trabajo anterior, luego con la liquidación pone la pulpería, y también la venta de leche agria ya que por las mañanas sale desde temprano a vender el cual su esposa despacha por la mañana. El negocio de la pulpería abecés se vende poco,  pero con su venta de leche agria se ayuda a equilibrar los gastos. Con este financiamiento lograra hacer un muro que es de mucha necesidad para reguardar la seguridad de su casa y por ende su familia ya que el cerco lo tiene cerrado con laminas de zinc. Para esto necesita comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra. Planes a futuro lograr cerrar toda su solar, a si como poder ayudar a sus hijos con una buena educación.
texts.en:
Don Ricardo is 50 years old. From a young age, he worked so that he could have his own business. He currently manages a grocery store with his wife so that they can feed and educate their three children who are attending high school. Ricardo began saving part of his salary from his previous job. He later opened the store using his severance pay. In addition, he sells sour milk in the mornings. He leaves early with whatever supply his wife gives him. The sales from the grocery business are sometimes few, so selling sour milk helps to keep the expenses in balance.

With this loan, Ricardo will be able to build a wall that is greatly needed to provide security for his home and his family. The area is currently closed off with sheets of zinc. He will buy the necessary construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron so that the work can begin. His plans for the future are to close off the entire patio and provide his children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to build a security wall

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
Madame Rokhaya D.  est une femme mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est âgée de 54 ans et sollicite pour la première un prêt de 500 000 FCFA pour les besoins de son activité. En effet, elle est commerçante de divers produits et gère depuis 2008 sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale dans son quartier à Fahu II dans la ville de Thiès.
C’est après avoir constaté que le quartier manquait de boutique de ce genre, qu’elle décida avec l’aide de son fils qui l’a financé, de satisfaire les besoins de boutique de ce nouveau quartier de Thiès.
Cependant, avec l’argent demandé, elle compte renouveler le stock au niveau de sa boutique en s’approvisionnant en marchandises nécessaires.
texts.en:
Ms. Rokhaya D. is a married mother of 5 children. She is 54 years old and is seeking her first loan of 500,000 FCFA to support her business. Indeed, she sells various goods and has run her own general food store since 2008 in the Fahu area in the city of Thiès. It was after having noted that the area lacked a store of this type that she decided, with the help of her son who financed her, to open her store and satisfy the purchasing needs of this new area of Thiès. With the money from this loan, she intends to replenish her stock by supplying her store with the necessary merchandise.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her store with various products

loans.name: Benna Tatiana

texts.fr: K. Benna Tatiana est née le 06 Juin 1986 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Benna Tatiana réside depuis son jeune âge au quartier Vodjè à Cotonou. C'est une célibataire sans enfant qui vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Benna Tatiana a très peu fréquenté. Depuis 8 ans, dans le but de se prendre en charge et d'assurer ses besoins, Benna Tatiana vend des tissus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Benna Tatiana s'approvisionne dans une boutique au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou. Benna Tatiana a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Benna Tatiana désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire ses clients. Mais Benna Tatiana ne dispose pas des moyens financiers nécessaire à l'atteinte de son objectif. C'est pourquoi Benna Tatiana sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Benna Tatiana K. was born on 6 June 1986 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Benna Tatiana has lived in the Vodjè area of Cotonou since she was young. She is unmarried without children, lives by herself, and supports herself on her own. Benna Tatiana had a very limited education. For 8 years, with the goal of providing for herself and meeting her needs, Benna Tatiana has been selling fabric at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She gets her supplies at a store in the Missèbo market in Cotonou. Benna Tatiana has already obtained two loans with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and repaid them both properly. Benna Tatiana wants to raise the level of her business and better satisfy her customers. However, she does not have the necessary financial means to achieve her objective. This is why she is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 55 años y es casada. Elba es una madre de 8 hijos de la cuales 5 son independientes y los demás todavía están a su lado.

Elba es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de venta de artesanía y así de esta manera ayudar al ingreso económico del hogar. Elba tiene su propio taller de fabricación de artesanía de tipo muñequearía y los vende en diferentes sitios por ejemplo los días lunes y martes vende  de forma ambulatoria en el centro arqueológico de “Kenko” y los sábados ende en la feria del barrio popular de “San Blas”. Elba usará el préstamo para comprar por ejemplo tela, mantas, chompas y chullos.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elba is a member of the Communal Bank "Sacsayhuaman", which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, five of whom are independent while the others still live with her.

Elba is a hardworking and enterprising mother who managed to open her own business selling handicrafts in order to help with the household income. She has a workshop where she makes “muñequearía” style handicrafts and sells them at different locations. For example, on Mondays and Tuesdays, she sells as a traveling vendor at the “Kenko” archaeological site. On Saturdays, she sells at the popular neighborhood fair called “San Blas”. Elba will use the loan to buy fabric, blankets, sweaters, and caps.

She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, blankets, sweaters, and caps

loans.name: Hector Enrique

texts.es: Héctor, de 26 años, vive  con su pareja y su hija Valeria (1), en la casa de sus padres.Trabaja durante los días útiles de la semana  brindando servicio de transporte, en su  motocarro,  por los distritos de la ciudad. Inicia su labor a las 6  de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, y una vez por semana  descansa; En ésta actividad ya lleva 3 años, tiempo suficiente en el que terminó de pagar su movilidad. Inicialmente su labor le era dificultosa,  ya que no conocía las calles; ni los desvíos, pero ahora el plano urbano lo tiene en la mente, de ese modo brinda  un servicio oportuno a sus pasajeros.
