Se siente a gusto con lo que hace, y con el tiempo anhela comprarse otra moto, para que su pareja también empiece a dedicarse al oficio de transporte.Es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se compromete de  pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, porque quiere seguir contando con posteriores créditos, ya que los considera de gran ayuda para el progreso de su labor.Tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  llantas además de  repuestos para  su motocarro, y de ese modo brindar un servicio eficiente a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Héctor is 26 years old. He lives with his life partner and their one year old daughter, Valeria. They live in his parents’ house. On the weekdays he works offering transportation services in his “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) in the districts in the city. He starts work at six in the morning, and he works until nine at night. Once a week he rests. He has been doing this for three years. This was enough time for him to finish paying for his vehicle. At first his work was hard for him. He did not know the streets or the detours. Now he has the urban layout in his head, and he can provide expedient service to his passengers. He likes what he does. In time he would like to buy another vehicle so that his life partner could also start to work in the transportation service. This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to make all of his payments on time because he wants to continue to count on future loans. He considers the loans to be a great help in the progress of his work. He plans to use the money he is requesting to buy tires and replacement parts for his motocarro. That way he can offer efficient service to his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and replacement parts for his motocarro

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Feliciana vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, en donde tiene su propio negocio de comida, que durante varios años ha logrado administrar. Tiene 58 años de edad, y se siente muy activa en sus ventas, el cual comenzó solo vendiendo enchilada y con dinero prestado de una amiga, luego para aumentar las ventas recurre al financiamiento de Afodenic en donde ha logrado aumentar las variedades de comida de fritanga. Ya que logro cambiar su negocio de comida por la artesanía ya que ante era ese su negocio. Con este préstamo quiere reparar las divisiones de los cuartos es decir levantar paredes nuevas ya que las que tiene son de madera y están en malas condiciones lo que le es de gran necesidad personal para una privacidad y mejor comodidad de su familia. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en la variedad de ricos platos de comida día a día, ya que es su medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Doña Feliciana lives in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino, where she has a food business that she has managed for several years. She is 58 years old and very active in making her sales. Using the money loaned to her from a friend, she started selling enchiladas. She later increased her sales with the help of recurring loans from AFODENIC, which she used to expand the variety of fried foods that she produced. Selling food was a change for her since she previously made handicrafts in her previous business.

With this loan, Feliciana wants to repair the room divisions within her house. She will have new walls erected that are made of wood since the existing ones are in bad condition. This is of great personal necessity since it will give privacy and greater comfort to her family. Her plans include creating a variety of flavorful dishes to serve every day in order to earn income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to erect new room dividers (walls) in her house

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania nacio el 11 de Noviembre de 1954, en Atilleros Vallegrande casada con don plasido, tiene 4 hijos y hace 35 años que compro una parsela en la foresta a 10 km de El Torno, dos de sus hijos trabajan con ella y los otros dos se encuentran en edad escolar, son una familia muy unida y cariñosa y la Sra. Melania siempre esta pensando en el bienestar de sus familia. 

La Sra. Melania trabaja en la agricultura, siembra papa, maiz, mani, cebolla, y tambien tienen 2 hectareas de citrico como: naranja, mandarina, saca ella su producto al mercado de el torno, ella atrabaja con su esposo y 2 de sus hijos  quienes le ayudan en la siembra y posterior cosecha de sus productos y despues lo comercializan en el mercado de la zona.

Uno de los deseos de la Sra. Melania es ver a sus hijos profesionales y a la larga hecer construir su casita en mejores condiciones para la comodidad de su familia.

El dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de Papa, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Melania was born on November 11, 1954, in Atilleros Vallegrande. She is married; her husband's name is Plasido, and she has 4 children. Thirty-five years ago, she bought a parcel of land in the forest, 10 km from El Torno. Two of her children are school-age and work with her. They are a very united, loving family, and she is always thinking about their wellbeing. Melania works in agriculture, growing potatoes, corn, peanuts and onions, and she also has 2 hectares of citrus trees, including oranges and tangerines. She sells her products at the market in El Torno. She works with her husband and two of her children, who help her plant and later harvest her crops, then sell them in the local market. One of Melania's dreams is to see her children become professionals and, in the long term, build a stronger house for the comfort of her family. She will use the funds from the loan to buy seeds to plant potatoes. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plastic plates

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria María M. E. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 12 años tiene un puesto de venta de frutas  y tajaditas frente al mercado central esquina opuesta. Es madre soltera de tres hijos dos en edad escolar y  el mayor le ayuda a vender en su negocio.
Anteriormente la Señora M. trabajaba en el Mayoreo el Bisne como trabajadora ayudante de venta tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel de los cuales con estos financiamientos siempre los invierte para su negocio y para hacerles alguna mejora al mismo.
Se esfuerza para salir adelante junto con sus hijos viene a vender a las 6 de la mañana y se va a las 12 del día a su casa para ponerse a freír las tajaditas en su casa para la venta del día siguiente.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria María M. E. has worked as a merchant at the market for 12 years. She has a vending post in front of the central market on the opposite corner where she sells fruit and plantain chips. Gloria is a single mother of three school age children. The oldest child helps her with making sales at her business.

Sra. M. previously worked at the wholesale market in Bisne as a sales assistant. She has been a client of CEPRODEL for three years and has always used her loans to invest in or make improvements to her business. Gloria strives to move forward along with her children. She comes to work at 6am and leaves at 12pm so that she can go home to prepare the plantain chips that she will sell the following day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits such as grapes, apples, mangos, bananas, and watermelons

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es una señora trabajadora y emprendedora la cual se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías nicaragüenses y cosméticos en Costa Rica. Ella inicio con este negocio porque un día que recibió la visita de su hermana quien le llevaba cajetas, pinolillo y otros productos típicos a su centro de  trabajo (un Auto lavado) a trajo mucho la atención de sus clientes los cuales estaban muy interesados por dichos productos.

Es en se momento según comento Marisol que se le ocurre empezar a comercializar esos productos en ese país en un comienzo era poco pero este ha ido creciendo y aumentado poco a poco.

Actualmente ella esta en Nicaragua junto a sus dos pequeñas una de 18 años que esta embarazada y otra de 10 añitos construyendo su casa que es su mayor anhelo y deseo para lo cual ocupara el crédito en la compra de materiales y mano de obra.
texts.en:
Marisol is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells Nicaraguan handicrafts and cosmetics in Costa Rica. She started this business when her sister visited her one day and brought “cajetas” (caramel treats), “pinolillo” (a Nicaraguan drink mix), and other traditional products to her workplace (at a car wash). These products drew a lot of attention from her customers, who were very interested. At the time, Marisol says it occurred to her that she should start selling these products in Costa Rica. She started out small, but over time her business has grown and increased gradually. At the moment, she is in Nicaragua with her two children. One is 18 years old and pregnant, while the other is 10 years old. Marisol’s greatest wish is to build a house, so she will use this loan to buy materials and pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build her house

loans.name: Rosa Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Ríos es socia del banco comunal El Arenal en honor al mercado donde trabajan, es una mujer  luchadora que siempre busca lo mejor para su familia vende auto lujos para todo tipo de vehículo  no  tiene horario fijo  ni días de descanso y esta  actividad comparte con los  quehaceres de su hogar.

Rosa, su esposo  y sus tres hijos de 22, 19 y 5 años  viven en una casa arrendada  en el sector de la feria libre, siendo este uno de los mercados más grandes de la ciudad de Cuenca, su esposo trabaja desde los doce años en la venta de artículos y lujos para carros y sus dos primeros hijos les ayudan en el negocio.

Nuestra socia se encuentra un año trabajando con su banco comunal y con el dinero obtenido  ha podido incrementar el negocio. Con el crédito que reciba próximamente comprará  más artículos como guardafangos, maquetas, forros, plumas, espejos, entre otros auto lujos.

El sueño de nuestra socia es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa Ríos is a member of the El Arenal communal bank, named in honor of the place where they work. She is a tenacious woman who is always looking to provide the best for her family. She sells accessories for cars. She does not have a fixed work schedule nor days off; she always has to share her time between this work and her household chores. Rosa, her husband, and three of their children (22, 19, and 5 years of age) live in a rented house in an area near the Feria Libre, which is one of Cuenca’s largest markets. Her husband has worked for the last 12 years selling accessories for cars; her two oldest sons help him. She has collaborated with the communal bank for a year and has used the funds acquired to increase her stock. With this next loan she will buy more stock items, like: fenders, wheel rims, seat covers, mirrors, windshield wipers, among other vehicle accessories. Her dream is to have her own home someday.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car accessories and parts.

loans.name: Petrona Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Petrona Francisca P. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación ubicada en el barrio de Guadalupe, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo no tiene carga que mantener pero es una señora muy trabajadora siempre le ha gustado tener su propio negocio.
Tiene tres años de tener su negocio empezó su negocio con un capital de C$ 1,500.00 aporte de su esposo ella atiende su negocio desde la siete de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche diario hasta los días domingo. Este financiamiento lo solicito para surtir su negocio ya que ella tiene una demanda porque tiene una escuela de frente y vende productos escolares. Ya tiene 10 año de trabajar con Ceprodel y lleva cuatro créditos y le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio y ahora tiene otra refrigeradora y más mobiliario para su propia venta
texts.en:
Señora Petrona Francisca P. runs a corner store from her home in the Guadalupe neighbourhood. Her husband is supportive but doesn't have many responsibilites as his wife is very hardworking and has always enjoyed having her own business. Petrona has had the business for three years and started it with a $1,500 contribution from her husband. She works at the store from 7am to 9pm every day, even Sundays. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy stock for the store. There is a demand for her wares as there is a school opposite, and she sells school supplies. She has already worked with Kiva partner Ceprodel for 10 years and has had four loans which have helped her improve her business. She now has another refrigerator and more fittings for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells smoked fish at Elmina market.  Esi has no educational background.  She is a single parent living with her three children.  She is responsible for paying school fees for the children and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to process (smoking method) for sale. She hopes to use the profits she gets as a result of the loan, which served as increased capital, to save to give the children a meaningful education.

To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally-made oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale. Smoking the fish preserves the fish to keep longer before going bad.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to process

loans.name: María Argentina

texts.es:
La Señora María Argentina A. C. es comerciante desde hace 26 años tiene una fritanga que empieza a operar desde las cinco de la tarde hasta las diez de la noche de lunes a domingo  su negocio está ubicado en los semáforos de la Roberto González en una caseta ahí ella alquila.
Tiene cinco hijos pero solo uno depende de ella el resto de sus hijas le ayudan a atender el negocio anteriormente la señora A. C. era ama de casa empezó su negocio con un capital de C$ 500.00 vendiendo solo lo que era  tajadas.
Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nuestra institución en los cuales la señora se siente muy Feliz y satisfecha ya que con esos financiamientos ella le invierte al negocio y de las ganancias ella ha podido ir acondicionando su negocio y su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Señora María Argentina A. C. has been a businesswoman for 26 years. She runs a fried food snack stall from 5pm until 10pm every day of the week. The rented stall is located near the traffic lights on Roberto González Street. María has five children but only her son is still dependent on her. Her remaining four daughters help her in the business. Before she started the business, she was a housewife. She started with an investment of $500 selling only fried plantains. María has worked with our institution for four years and feels very pleased as she has invested the money in the business, and with the profits she has been able to continue equipping the stall and improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a table for her business

loans.name: Las Cometas Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue sacada en la papelería de Mireya Hernández Gómez, es integrante del grupo Las Cometas que está ubicado en la comunidad de Tepeji del Río en el estado de Hidalgo de México.   Ella se dedica a la papelería y novedades que inició hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía y hacer de esta forma más atractivo su negocio. Sus clientes piensan que da un buen servicio y siempre trata de tener algo nuevo aunque sea pequeño por que en realidad le faltan aún muchas cosas.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente emocionada y feliz.  Tiene 32 años, estudió hasta el 6to  año de primaria,  tiene 3  hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón).  Quiere este crédito para surtir su papelería y tener variedad. de artículos.   También  tiene la esperanza de tener más surtida su papelería para poder agrandar su negocio.

María Mayel Sánchez Pérez es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudió hasta el 3er año de preparatoria,  tiene 2 hijos (1 mujer y 1 varón).  Ella es estilista  inició hace 2 años una estética. Solicita el préstamo para comprar tintes, líquidos y demás materiales para mejorar el servicio que da a sus clientes. 

El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes, los otros integrantes son:

•	Pérez Gómez Yadira (calzado)
•	Pérez M. Felipa Elvira (colchas)
•	Fernández Quiñones Mará Edith (calzado)
•	Mejía B. Abelina (pulseras de fantasía)
•	Sánchez Pérez Araceli (estilista)
•	B. C. Raquel (bisutería)
•	Gómez R. Alejandra (antojitos mexicanos)
•	Méndez Gómez Antonia Bertha (conejos)
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Mireya Hernández Gómez’s stationery shop. She is a member of the “Las Cometas” (Comets) group, which is in Tepeji del Rio, in the state of Hidalgo, México. She has sold stationery items and novelties for about a year now. She is asking for funds to buy more stock items so that her store will be more attractive. Her customers believe that she provides good service and she always strives to have new items to offer, even if just a trifle; she still needs lots of products. At this moment, she is happy and thrilled. She is 32 years old, finished 6th grade and has three children (2 girls and 1 boy). She wants the funding to stock her store and have a variety of items available. She hopes to expand her stock so that her store business will grow. María Mayel Sánchez Pérez is the group president. She is 26 years old, finished high school and has two children (a boy and a girl). She is a hair stylist and opened her beauty shop 2 years ago. She is asking for funds to buy hair dyes, liquids and other supplies to improve customer service. The group is made up of 10 members. The others are: • Pérez Gómez Yadira (shoes) • Pérez M. Felipa Elvira (bedspreads) • Fernández Quiñones Mará Edith (shoes) • Mejía B. Abelina (costume bracelets) • Sánchez Pérez Araceli (hair stylist) • B. C. Raquel (notions) • Gómez R. Alejandra (Mexican fast-food snacks) • Méndez Gómez Antonia Bertha (rabbits)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise and make her store more attractive.

location.town: Tepeji del Río, Estado de Hidalgo

loans.name: Basilidesa Hidelisa

texts.es: Basilidesa, D.  55 años, es una mujer D. carácter muy jovial, está casada y tiene  3 hijos ya mayores, solo vive con su esposo-albañil- en su casa ubicada al sur D. Lima.DesD. hace 8 años, se dedica a la venta D. ropa  y zapatos, preferentemente D. marca. Se inició ofreciendo a sus familiares y vecinos, y D. a pocos se hizo conocida, por lo que este negocio le es muy rentable. Cuando no tenía capital su esposo la apoyaba,  es por esta razón que no descuida sus labores del hogar, además está contenta con lo que hace y en la actualidad con lo que gana  ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, porque a veces su esposo, que es  albañil, no tiene trabajo. El mayor anhelo D. Basilidesa  es tener todas las variedades D. prendas D. vestir, D. esta manera vendería en mayor cantidad y sus utilidades serían mayores.Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP, y quiere seguir pagando sus cuotas a tiempo, para continuar  trabajando. Y en su banco comunal se siente muy feliz, porque se lleva con todas las integrantes ya que son responsables.Con el dinero comprará cantidad D. prendas D. vestir, para D. ese modo brindar una mayor variedad  a su clientela, y a  buen precio.
texts.en:
Basilidesa, 55, is a very jovial, married mother of three adult children. She lives just with her bricklayer husband in her house located in the south of Lima. For the last 8 years she has sold clothing and shoes, preferably brand-name. She started off selling to her family members and neighbors. Gradually, she became well-known and now the business is quite profitable. When she needed capital, her husband would help out and this is why she doesn’t neglect her household duties. Besides, she’s happy because her husband, who is a bricklayer, sometimes is out of work. Basilidesa’s greatest wish is to have all the various varieties of clothing items available so that she can sell more and her profits will be higher. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she wants to continue to make her repayments on time so that she can continue working. She is happy in her communal bank because she gets along well with her fellow members because they are all responsible. She will use the funds to buy clothing items in bulk so that she will have lots of items to offer her customers at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Alofohoin

texts.en: Alofohoin D. sells flour and cooking oil outside of her home in Lomé, Togo. She is divorced and has four children. She began her business in 2000 and is now asking for her second loan from WAGES to replenish her supply of stock. Specifically, she plans to purchase 15 sacks of flour for resale. This loan will help keep Mrs. D.’s customers satisfied and ensure that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: To purchase flour for resale

loans.name: Flore

texts.fr: Née le 17 Décembre 1977, Z. Flore vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AKEREBOUROU Raoul, Flore est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble au quarier Yagbé à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Flore est une couturière qui exerce son actiivité dans son atelier de couture situé dans son quartier. A côté de cette activité, Flore vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son atelier. Flore s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Il y a environs 5 ans que Flore a commencé à mener cette activité. Flore a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle en cartes de recharges téléphoniques, Flore sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé, en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on 17 December 1977, Flore Z. has lived for about ten years in the Yagbé area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Raoul Akerebourou, Flore is the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. The family lives together in the Yagbé area in Cotonou. The couple support the various family expenses together. Flore is a dressmaker who runs her business in her dressmaking workshop, located in her area. Along with this business, Flore sells rechargeable phone cards at her workshop. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Flore began running this business about 5 years ago. She has already obtained one previous loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid it properly. Faced with the numerous demands of her customers for rechargeable phone cards, Flore is seeking another loan with ALIDÉ in order to increase the stock of her products and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread for sewing, poplin, and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi T. is a fisherman. He goes out to sea to fish. He gives some of the fish to his wife to smoke (process) and sell and he sells the rest to the market women at Elmina. Kofi has received a junior high education. He is married and has four children. His wife is a fishmonger. Kofi has been doing this fish business for some time now. With the support of his wife, he is able to take good care of his family. The loan he will receive will be used to buy a personal boat for fishing. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a house on already purchased land. Kofi is leaning with one of the boats he rents for fishing. At the time of visit, he had already sold the fish he caught for the day.

loans.use: To buy a personal boat for fishing.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.en: Amavi A. is married to a mechanic and has three children. She lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, Togo selling corn, rice, alcoholic beverages, and a variety of other products. She began this business in 1998 and is now asking for her second loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to replenish her supply of rice and corn as well as tomatoes and liquor. With this loan, Mrs. A. will keep her shelves full and her customers happy.

loans.use: To purchase rice, corn, tomatoes, and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Betzaida

texts.es: Betzaida, de 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus  2 hijos pequeños, en una casa  ubicada en una populosa zona al sur de la ciudad.Antes  sólo administraba el negocio de alquiler de cabinas de Internet,  que instaló  su esposo en su casa; pero desde hace 3 meses,  también realiza bordados  a polos de algodón, mientras atiende el negocio de su esposo. A diario realiza estos bordados para un mayorista que los recoge terminados, y trabajar  la  llena de mucha satisfacción,  pues se siente  muy contenta por la agilidad  que tiene en sus manos, y está muy agradecida con su amiga que la recomendó. Este negocio le parece muy rentable, por las buenas ganancias que le genera, y lo realiza en la tranquilidad de  su casa, sin descuidar a sus hijos. Además está satisfecha porque ahora puede trabajar y ganar  su propio dinero.Es el primer préstamo que tiene, y se compromete a pagar las cuotas establecidas puntualmente. Espera llevarse  bien con las integrantes de su banco comunal ya que quiere trabajar con posteriores créditos.El dinero solicitado lo invertirá  en la compra de diversidad de hilos, para realizar su trabajo efectivamente, y así continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Betzaida, 33, lives with her husband and two, small children in a house located in a densely-populated area in the south of the city. She used to just administer an Internet service, renting Internet booth time that her husband set up in their house. But, for the last three months she has been doing embroidery on cotton polo shirts while watching over her husband’s business. She works on her embroidery daily and delivers her finished products to a wholesaler. Working makes her feel much fulfilled because she is happy with the agility in her hands and very grateful to her girlfriend that recommended her. She believes this business is profitable because it generates good earnings and she can do it in the tranquility of her home without neglecting her children. Besides, she is satisfied because she can now work and earn her own money. This is her first loan and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She hopes to get along well with her fellow communal bank members because she wants to be part of subsequent loans. She will use the funds to buy a variety of threads so that her work will be more efficient and continue thereby to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery thread.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos en el pueblo joven Fernando Belaúnde, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona se caracteriza por tener habitantes de bajos recursos, cuenta con servicios de agua, luz y desagues, pero no cuenta con  calles asfaltadas  ni veredas. La vivienda de Fernando tiene techo de calamina con piso de tierra.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte publico en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. El pertenece a una asociación de Mototaxistas que tiene un paradero ubicado en el frontis de una universidad y que recorre rutas dentro de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Fernando sale muy temprano para aprovechar las horas donde hay mayor afluencia de personas que van a sus centros de labores y regresa a su domicilio a las 8 pm aproximadamente despues de haber hecho su jornada diaria. Los ingresos que haya tenido en el dia le sirven para apoyar a su esposa en la alimentacion y gastos del hogar.

Actualmente Fernando se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de un nuevo motor para su unidad movil, ademas desea cambiar las llantas y brindarle mantenimiento en general, asi no tendra problemas con su unidad y podra brindar un buen servicio.

Fernando nos comenta que anteriormente deseaba adquirir una mototaxi pero tuvo que desistir porque estas unidades eran demasiado costosas para los ingresos que obtenia, actualmente sigue queriendo adquirir una nueva unidad movil, pero primero quiere que su unidad actual se encuentre en perfecto estado.
texts.en:
Fernando is 55 years old, and he is married. He lives with his wife and three children in Fernando Belaúnde, a new town in an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. The area is characterized by having inhabitants with few resources. They have water, electricity, and sewage services. But, they do not have asphalt streets or sidewalks. Fernando’s house has an aluminum roof and a dirt floor. He offers public transportation services in a “mototaxi” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle, which is used to transport cargo and passengers). He has been doing this for ten years. He belongs to an association for mototaxi drivers, which has a stop located in front of a university. He covers routes within the city of Chiclayo. Fernando leaves very early to take advantage of the hours when there are more people who are going to their work centers. He returns home at approximately 8:00 p.m. after having done his day’s work. The earnings he has for the day help his wife with the food and the household expenses. Fernando is currently asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy a new motor for his mototaxi. Also, he wants to change the tires and perform general maintenance. That way he will not have problems with his mototaxi, and he will be able to provide good service. Fernando tells us that earlier he wanted to get a mototaxi, but he had to give up because they were too expensive for his income. He still wants to get a new one, but first he wants the mototaxi he currently has to be in perfect condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for his mototaxi

loans.name: Amigas Progresando Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Amigas Progresando y tiene este nombre porque todas las Señoras son amigas y son de Progreso.  Está ubicado en la comunidad de Progreso de Obregón en el estado de Hidalgo, México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes y es la 1ra vez que realiza un crédito juntas.

Idania Aurora E. Díaz es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 30 años, estudió hasta el 3er año de preparatoria,  no tiene hijos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de carne que inició hace 15 años. Se solicita el préstamo para comprar animales para su carnicería.  Sus clientes piensan que es una persona responsable porque vende buena carne a precios justos. 

María Isabel González García es otro integrante de este grupo. Tiene 47 años, estudió hasta la primaria, tiene 4 hijas (dos de 24, una de 26 y otra de 30).  Ella se dedica a la costura que inició hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar telas. Sus clientes la buscan porque es una mujer responsable y su costura tiene garantía por lo que les asegura buena calidad.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente capaz de solventar el préstamo y con muchas ganas de trabajar.   Quiere este crédito para comprar material para hacer uniformes para el ciclo escolar que viene y tener surtido su negocio para darles una buena atención y calidad a sus clientes.   También espera con sus ganancias pintar su casa y poder comprarse un comedor. 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
•	Idania Aurora E. Díaz (Carnicería)
•	Ma Angélica C. R. (Bisutería)
•	Yolanda A. Zúñiga (Ganadería)
•	Angélica A. Ávila (Venta de comida)
•	María Guadalupe González García (Manualidades)
•	Diana González C. (Venta de blancos)
•	Miriam B. Zúñiga (Abarrotes)
•	Mónica B. N. (Ropa interior)
•	María de los Ángeles González C. (Miscelánea)
texts.en:
Amigas Progresando (Friends Progressing) is the name of this group. It has this name because all of the women are friends and they progress. They are located in the Progreso de Obregón community in the state of Hidalgo, México. The group is comprised of ten members. This is the first time they have had a loan together. Idania Aurora E. Díaz is the president of the group. She is 30, and she went to school until the third year of pre-university. She does not have children. She sells meat, a business she started 15 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy animals for her butcher shop. Her customers think she is a responsible person because she sells good meat at fair prices. María Isabel González García is another member of this group. She is 47, and she has an elementary school education. She has four daughters (two are 24, one is 26, and the other is 30). She has been working as a seamstress for ten years. She is asking for a loan to buy fabric. Her customers seek her out because she is a responsible woman and her sewing has the guarantee of being good quality. As she is asking for this loan, she feels capable of paying the loan, and she has a great desire to work. She wants this loan to buy material to make uniforms for the school cycle that is coming. She wants to have her business stocked in order to give her customers good, quality service. She also hopes to use her earnings to paint her house and to be able to buy a dining room. The other members of the group are: • Idania Aurora E. Díaz (Butcher Shop) • Ma Angélica C. R. (Costume Jewelry Sales) • Yolanda A. Zúñiga (Livestock) • Angélica A. Ávila (Sells Food) • María Guadalupe González García (Handicrafts) • Diana González C. (Sells Pillows) • Miriam B. Zúñiga (Groceries) • Mónica B. N. (Underwear) • María de los Ángeles González C. (Miscellaneous)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals and fabrics for their businesses

loans.name: Séraphine

texts.fr: G. Séraphine est née le 03 Juin 1952 et vit depuis 23 ans à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHOUASSA Rodolph, Séraphine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont présentement à sa charge. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Séraphine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis 35 ans, Séraphine mène comme activité, la vente de céréales (haricot, riz, maïs, etc.) dans sa boutique size à Agla. De façon secondaire, Séraphine vend également du charbon de bois. L'activité de Séraphine lui procure des revenus qu'elle utilise pour assurer ses différents besoins et ceux de sa famille. Séraphine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Séraphine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé et les a tous bien remboursés. Séraphine sollicite un troisième prêt afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de se faire plus de profit après la vente de ses produits. Dans l'avenir, Séraphine ambitionne acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Séraphine G. was born on 3 June 1952 and has lived for 23 years in Agla, an area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Rodolph Ahouassa, Séraphine is the mother of three children, all in school, of whom two are currently in her care. The couple provide for the family together. Séraphine never attended school. For 35 years, she has run a business selling cereals (beans, rice, maize, etc.) at her store located in Agla. As a secondary activity, Séraphine also sells charcoal. Her business provides her with an income that she uses to meet her various needs and those of her family. Séraphine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already benefited from two loans with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), both of which she repaid properly. She is seeking a third loan in order to increase the stocks of her products and to make a higher profit after selling her goods. In the future, Séraphine dreams of acquiring a plot of land.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals (beans, rice, maize) and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and resale of yams

loans.name: Amparito Maribel

texts.es: Amparito, de 39 años, está separada, desde hace  tres  años, y solo vive con sus 2  hijos menores, en la casa de su madre.Se dedica a la venta  de abarrotes, en la tienda que está instalada en su casa, ubicada en un barrio muy populoso, de la zona sur de Lima. En este negocio  ya lleva cerca de 8 años, inicialmente su pareja la apoyaba, pero ahora su madre la apoya cuando tiene que salir a realizar compras. Está contenta con esta actividad, porque le es muy rentable, sobre todo por las mañanas, y ya en la tarde se dedica al  bordado de polos de algodón, por invitación de una  amiga. Le gusta bordar porque  puede realizar este trabajo sin descuidar su tienda, y también gana algo de dinero por este trabajo. Por el momento esta empeñada en implementar su bodega, para que en el futuro este mas surtida y obtenga mejores ganancias.Este es su primer crédito, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de acuerdo a las fechas establecidas, ya que piensa contar con posteriores préstamos, porque sabe son  de mucha ayuda  para su negocio.Amparito invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de  gran cantidad de  abarrotes, de primera necesidad, para mantener su bodega siempre surtida, y así pueda brindar una buena  atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amparito is 39 years old and was separated three years ago. Now, she lives alone with her two youngest children in her mother's house. She has a grocery business and operates the small store from her home which is in a very populous neighborhood in the south of Lima. She has had this business for nearly eight years. At first her partner would help her but now its her mother who helps out when she has to purchase merchandise. She is happy with this activity because its very successful, particularly in the mornings. In the afternoon, after her friend suggested it, she embroiders cotton polo shirts. She likes her embroidery work because she can do it without leaving her business and is able to earn a little from this labor. At the moment she is very committed to setting up her store so that in the future she has more stock and sees greater profits. This is her first loan and she has promised to make each payment in agreement with the dates established. She knows that they are very helpful in her business. Amparito will use the requested loan to buy a larger quantity of high-priority groceries so that she can keep her store well stocked and so she can provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to establish her store

loans.name: Waly Daan 2 Group

texts.fr: Waly  Daan 2 est un groupe de 5 femmes domiciliées  au quartier Noflaye de Bambilor et qui ont la particularité  d’exercer la même activité de vente de légumes, de poissons, de produits de beauté d’hygiène  et de lessive. Pour éviter l’oisiveté et la dépendance  totale ces femmes ont décidé de s’investir dans le commerce afin de pouvoir subvenir a leurs besoins personnels. Ce crédit pourra leur permettre d’augmenter leur part du marche et par conséquent  d’accroitre leurs revenus.
texts.en:
Waly Daan 2 is a group of five women who live in the Noflaye district of Bambilor and who share the particularity of carrying out the same business of selling vegetables, fish, beauty and health products and washing powder. In order to avoid being idle and totally dependent, these women decided to invest in a business in order to be able to provide for their personal needs. This loan will allow them to increase their market share and as a result enhance their income.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: Astan

texts.fr:
Madame  Astan Djiré   est âgée de 33 ans, mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari  dans une famille nucléaire   au   quartier Hamdallaye « B » de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant   fréquenté l’école coranique au détriment de l’école classique, pour des considérations religieuses, elle l’abandonna en classe de 6ème  année (système éducatif Malien) pour s’adonner au petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait de l’encens. Après plusieurs années passées à ses côtés, riche de  cette connaissance dans les activités commerciales, elle  commence à évoluer seule en optant pour le commerce d’articles divers, thermos, draps de lits, couvre lits etc, depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété publique. 
 Dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de mieux mener son activité, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 20 complets draps et 15 thermos. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et effectue sa   vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de contribuer pour les événements sociaux et pour les dépenses familiales. 
Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de prêt-à-porter.
texts.en:
Mrs. Astan Djiré is 33 years old, married and mother to five children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the Hamdallaye "B" district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having been to a Koranic school rather than a classic school, for religious reasons, she abandoned her schooling in the 6th grade of the Mali education system in order to go into a small business with her mother who sold incense. After several years at her side and having gained a rich experience in commercial activity, she began to develop a business alone, opting for the sale of various articles including thermos flasks, bed sheets, bedovers etc.. and has been doing this for ten years now. She enjoys a large customer base and pubic renown. With a view to increasing her business and in order to carry it out more effectively she has turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has taken out an individual loan which she is planning to use to buy 20 sets of sheets and 15 thermos flasks. She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of women and men. With this loan she envisages making a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA. This profit will allow her to contribute to social events and to family expenses. Her ambition is to open a prêt-à-porter shop.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets and thermos flasks

loans.name: Erika De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Sra. C. tiene 17 años de experiencia en el negocio, ella fue ere dedada de su mama en este rubro actualmente tiene una pulpería y un comedor para brindarle más atención al cliente. 
Ella esta solicitando el crédito para surtir su venta y comprar más productos de lo que no tiene ya que piensa vender ropa también.
texts.en:
Sra. C. has 17 years of experience in the business that she inherited from her mother. She currently manages a general store and a diner where she spends most of her time tending to her customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to restock her store by purchasing products that she does not have. She also has plans to sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with more merchandise

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. is married and has two children. She sells fabric and ladies wear such as panties and skirts. She moves from house to house to sell her goods at Elmina. Dorcas has received a senior high education.  Her husband is a teacher. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will serve as additional capital to purchase more fabric and ladies wear to sell. She hopes to use the new profits that will come as a result of the loan to educate her children who are still in school. Mrs. A. is getting ready to start her normal routine of moving from house to house.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and ladies wear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying poultry

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena K. is a married woman with one child. She has been through junior high school.  Helena sells palm oil in large and smaller quantities at Elmina. She has been selling palm oil for some time now. Her husband is a driver. Helena uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Helena will use the loan to purchase palm nuts to produce palm oil and palm kernel oil as additional oil for sale. The new profits that may accrue as a result of the loan will be used to further her children’s education.

In the picture, she was bottling the oil she has been able to produce.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts to produce palm oil

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha es una comerciante y ala ves ama de casa, ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio tienen una pulpería, de igual manera distribuyen ropa en zona norte de nuestro país, tiene una hija en España el cual le ayudara con su crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is a merchant and a homemaker. Together with her husband, she manages a general store. They also distribute clothing in the northern part of the country. She has a daughter in Spain who will help with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Dominga Patrocinia

texts.es: Dominga, de 49 años, tiene 4 hijos, vive solo con los tres  menores y con su esposo en su casa propia.Durante todas la mañanas se dedica a su trabajo de niñera, cerca de su casa, hasta las  2 de la tarde; y a partir de las 3  saca su stand de ropa  a la puerta de su casa, donde  vende hace muchos años. Este negocio le agrada mucho, porque  le genera buenas ganancias; sobre todo al dar a crédito las prendas, a sus vecinas. Es por esta razón que durante todos los fines de semana se dedica íntegramente  a la comercialización de ropa, ya que son días muy transitados. El mayor anhelo de Dominga es tener una buena cantidad de prendas de vestir, y sobre todo que sean exclusivas, y muy cotizadas por las jovencitas de su barrio, ya que son las que tienen mayor salida.Es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ratifica la  puntualidad en sus cuotas programadas, porque desea seguir contando con posteriores créditos ya que busca seguir progresando.Con el dinero solicitado comprará  gran cantidad de prendas de vestir y también zapatos escolares, para atender el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dominga is 49 years old and has 4 children. She lives with her husband and her 3 younger children in their own house. She makes a living as a nanny, and works near her home from morning until 2 in the afternoon. At 3 p.m. Dominga opens up a clothing stand at the entrance to her home, where she has sold clothing for many years. She really likes this business because it generates good profits; she gives most of the credit to the items she sells and to her neighbors. On weekends she dedicates all of her time to selling clothing, since those are very busy days for her business. Dominga’s greatest wish is to have a large quantity of garments, especially the ones that are sought after by young girls in the neighborhood, as those are what sell the most quickly. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she is known for making her payments punctually. She hopes to be able to receive additional loans, since she wants to continue making progress with her business. Dominga will use the money she has asked for to purchase a large quantity of garments as well as school shoes so that she can meet the orders of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a large quantity of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Inés está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Inés Asunción A. la cual se dedica la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace cinco años. De la misma manera sus compañeras de grupo Gloria Elena Rodríguez y Ángela  del Socorro M. comercializan estos productos.

Ellas además de estar en el grupo y ser muy unidas formaron una alianza de negocio donde juntas compran las cosechas y luego se distribuye esto se da con el objetivo de adquirir los productos a un precio más accesible. Actualmente con el préstamo compraran cosechas de jocotes y tamarindo que es la fruta de temporada.

Mientras la señora Filomena Susana Rodríguez se dedica a comercializar ropa desde hace ocho años e invertirá el crédito en dicho producto especialmente en ropa de verano por la temporada.
texts.en:
The Santa Inés group consists of four working women. One of those women is Inés Asunción A., who has made a living selling fruits and vegetables at the Masaya market for the past five years. Likewise, her fellow group members Gloria Elena Rodríguez and Ángela del Socorro M. also sell these products. Along with being the group and being very united, they formed a business alliance where they purchase the crops together and then distribute them. This helps them acquire the products at a better price. With the loan, they plan to purchase plums and tamarind crops, which are now in season. Meanwhile, Filomena Susana Rodríguez has made a living selling clothes for the past eight years and plans to invest her portion of the loan in summer clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plum and tamarind crops; purchase summer clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying food items

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua S. sells doughnuts at Elmina. She is a single mother of two children. Efua has not received any formal education. The money she is able to generate from her doughnut business is used to care for her children. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar, and other ingredients to make the doughnuts that she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

She was sold out of doughnuts at the time the picture was taken. She was therefore asked to demonstrate how it is done.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Pro Mujer(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de tres y un año, su esposo trabaja como mensajero en la Comercializadora de productos cosméticos Yanbal, vive en la urbe cuencana donde se puede disfrutar de la belleza colonial de su Centro Histórico, los ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente y su gastronomía que  hacen  de ésta ciudad  uno de los lugares más visitados de nuestro país por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

Nuestra  socia se dedica a  los quehaceres de su hogar, al cuidado de una sobrina y los días sábados trabaja haciendo la limpieza en casas ajenas hasta el medio día, su amiga Alexandra la animó a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que se agruparon en el banco Comunal Pro Mujer para sacar adelante a sus familias y tener más y mejores oportunidades de superación personal y económicamente.

Este es su primer crédito y con el va a montar un  pequeño bazar  para lo cual comprará tarjetas, peluches, regalos, bisutería, útiles escolares, ropa,  entre otros artículos de uso personal y para el hogar. Tiene como meta retomar sus estudios ya que se retiro de primer curso.

Sandra D. es otra socia del banco comunal Pro Mujer, vive en la urbe de la ciudad con su esposo y sus tres hijos que se encuentran de 22, 21, 17 años todos estudian tanto en la universidad como en el colegio, la casa no es propia sino de sus suegros ahí tienen un departamento independiente, como su esposo es médico veterinario de profesión tiene su consultorio en la misma casa para ahorrarse el arriendo.

Sandra es empleada privada trabaja en un local  de recaudación punto pago del consumo de energía eléctrica de la ciudad en el que se encuentra  hace cinco  años, su horario de labores es de  lunes a sábado  de 8 a.m. a  6 p.m.

Este es su primer crédito con la institución y con el dinero que reciba va a pagar la matrícula de su hijo  en la universidad. 

El  sueño más anhelado es poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Adriana is 21 years old, married and has two children, ages 3 and 1. Her husband works as a courier at the Yanbal cosmetics factory. They live in the city of Cuenca, where they can enjoy the colonial beauty of a historical center. The rivers nourish the city, people and gastronomy, making it one of the most visited places in the country by natives and foreigners. Adriana dedicates herself to the household chores and caring for her niece. On Saturdays, she works cleaning other people's homes until midday. Her friend Alexandra encouraged her to join this group of enterprising women, which joined forces with Kiva partner Comunal Pro Mujer to make headway for their families and to have more and better opportunities for personal and economic advancement. This is the group's first loan, and with her portion Adriana plans to start a small bazaar for which she will purchase cards, stuffed animals, gifts, jewelry, school supplies, clothing, and other personal and household products. Her goal is to resume her studies since she has a first-grade education. Sandra D. is another member of the community bank, and she lives in the city with her husband and their three children, ages 22, 21 and 17, all of whom are either studying in college or high school. It is not her own home, but her in-laws live in a separate area. Because her husband is a veterinarian, he runs his office out of the home to save on expenses. Sandra has worked as an employee at a private collection agency for the city's electric company for the past five years. She works Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. This is her first loan with the community bank, and with the money she plans to pay for her son's university education. Her biggest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items to start a bazaar; pay for son's education

loans.name: Mayra Azucena

texts.es:
La Sra. Mayra Ríos trabaja como asalariada en el Hospital España de Chinandega como Enfermera encargada de pacientes con Infección  Renal Crónica (IRC). 
Ella va a utilizar este crédito para cubrir gastos universitaR. de ella ya que esta por recibirse.
Ella es madre soltera de un niño, pero gracias a Dios y a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante con el y darle una buena educación.

Este es el primer crédito que solicita con la Institución en el cual se siente agradecida con la Institución por darle la oportunidad de progresar y apoyarla en su necesidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra Ríos works as a salaried employee at the Spanish Hospital of Chinandega. She is a nurse who is charge of the patients with chronic renal infection.

Mayra will use this loan to cover the university expenses for herself that she is about to incur. She is a single mother with a son, but thanks to God, her work allows her to move forward so that she can provide him a good education.

This is the first loan she has requested from the Institution. She is grateful to CEPRODEL for giving her the opportunity to progress and supporting her in this need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for university expenses

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
María Elizabeth tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector El Cardo del caserío Tongorrape, una zona agrícola del distrito de Motupe, ubicado a una hora y cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años al comercio de abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio nació de la necesidad de contar con una actividad que le genere ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia cuya economía depende de la agricultura, una actividad que no genera ingresos permanentes.

Ella ofrece en su pequeño negocio todo tipo de golosinas y bebidas a sus clientes, este negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus vecinos ya que la zona queda un poco alejada de la ciudad, ella prefiere comprar productos en pequeñas cantidades y siempre viaja a la ciudad de Chiclayo para surtir su negocio con productos frescos, el negocio tiene bastante acogida y ella desea ampliarlo con la compra de una mayor variedad de abarrotes, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.

Maria Elizabeth es una persona bastante confiable y entregada a su familia. Su anhelo es seguir apoyando a a sus padres en lo que la necesiten. Ella es muy estimada por las personas que la conocen y por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth is 25 years old, single and lives with her parents in the area of El Cardo of the city of Tongorrape, an agricultural zone in the district of Motupe, located an hour and 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has made a living for the past four years selling groceries out of a small convenience store installed in her home. The business started out of the necessity to find an activity to generate income to solve personal expenses and support her family, whose finances depend on agriculture, which isn't permanent income. At her small business, she offers all kinds of snacks and drinks to her customer. This is very useful to her neighbors since the area is located a little ways outside of the city. She prefers to buy products in small quantities and always travels to the city of Chiclayo to stock her business with fresh products. The business has been well-received, and she wishes to expand it by purchasing a wider variety of groceries. For this, she has requested for the first time from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1500 soles to achieve her objective. María Elizabeth is a very reliable person who is devoted to her family. Her goal is to keep supporting her parents. She is very highly regarded by people who know her and her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Nafy

texts.fr: Nafy M. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIANNAH MALARY depuis le 20 juillet 2006 et a été 7 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêts qu'elle toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits (bananes, mangues oranges etc. Son activité lui a généré des profits qui lui ont permis de construire un habitat familial. Elle appui également son mari pour la prise en charge de la scolarité de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Nafy M. is a 41-year married woman, the mother of nine children. She has been a member of the « Banc Villageois » of DIANNAH MALARY since July 20, 2006. She has received seven loans in a row, each of which she has managed well and fully repaid. She has a small business selling fruit (bananas, mangoes, oranges, etc.). Her business has generated profits which have allowed her to build a house for her family. She also depends on her husband in order to pay for their children's schooling.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her sales business

loans.name: Lester Alexander

texts.es: El Sr. Lester Alexander Méndez  M.. Es de oficio profesor de educación secundaria, padre de dos hijos uno en edad escolar, es casado actualmente esta estudiando en la universidad para mejorar su nivel académico. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera llegar a terminar de construir su casa porque esta es la única forma de llegar a tener una vivienda con un techo digno.
texts.en:
Sr. Lester Alexander Méndez M. is a high school teacher. He is married and the father of two children, one of whom is in school. Lester is currently studying at the university to improve upon his academic level. He has taken five loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used for making improvements to his home. Lester hopes to finish the construction of his house because it is the only way for him to achieve a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to continue with the construction of his house

loans.name: Elsa Maribel

texts.es: Elsa, de 40 años, es separada y vive en la casa de su madre, con ella y sus dos hijos menores.Tras haberse separado de su esposo  trabajó en diversos oficios, pero en vista que estaba descuidando la crianza de sus hijos pensó en dedicarse a la venta de gaseosas y helados, en el primer piso que su madre le cedió. Ya lleva quince años en el negocio y se siente a gusto. En la actualidad  vende también cervezas, en gran cantidad durante  los fines de semana, ya que durante este  tiempo se hizo muy  conocida por sus vecinos, y gracias a ellos su negocio le genera buenas ganancias. Esta muy motivada en  seguir trabajando y tiene planeado, para los meses siguientes, ingresar al bordado de chompas, por la invitación de una vecina, ya que realizaría esta labor  mientras atiende su negocio. Para más  adelante, anhela instalar en su amplio local, unas cabinas de Internet, para empezar en el negocio de alquiler de internet.Este es su séptimo préstamo con MFP y se compromete a  pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, como lo ha venido haciendo. Además se lleva muy bien con las compañeras de su banco comunal ya que dice son muy responsables y trabajadoras.Elsa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de varias cajas de cervezas,  y otra parte la invertirá en comprar cantidad de  hilos, de varios colores, para iniciarse en el bordado de chompas.
texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old, is separated from her husband, and lives in a house with her mother and her two minor children. Since she has separated from her husband she has worked in several offices. She saw that she was neglecting the upbringing of her children. So she decided to work selling sodas and ice cream from the first floor of her mother’s house. She has worked for fifteen years in this business and she has enjoyed it. Actually, she also sells beer. The largest quantities of beer sales are during the weekends. She is well known to her neighbors and thanks to them her business has generated a good income. She is very motivated to continue working. In the upcoming months she is going to begin to knit sweaters. Her neighbor, who knits, invited her to join her in this work. She can knit while she works in her store. In the future she would like to install booths with Internet access in her large location. She would like to sell time on the Internet. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she promises to punctually pay all her payments as she has done in the past. Also, she is well regarded by the other members of the community bank who are very responsible and very hard working. Elsa would like to purchase cases of beer with part of this loan and with the other part she would like to buy yarn in many colors in order to begin knitting sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy many cases of beer

loans.name: Eliot

texts.en:
A. Eliot resides in Nyarushanje, Rukungiri. He is into agriculture as a means of subsistence for himself, his wife, and his family of two children. He is an individual client obtaining loans from Pearl Microfinance and his motive is to enable him to develop and reinvest in his business.

One of Eliot’s major drawbacks since he ventured into this agriculture-based business has been expensive farm inputs and the loans have enabled him to handle this. He anticipates his prospects in subsistence farming will get better once he can access a loan to be able to buy farm inputs and manure to produce better farm output.

loans.use: To buy manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juana Licelda

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Licelda R.  tiene una Pulpería en su casa de habitación que está ubicada en el municipio del viejo.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para pagar todos los impuestos del año en curso, además va a comprar un poco de mercadería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc.

La Sra. Licelda es madre soltera de un hijo pero con mucho esfuerzo ha podido educarlo y salir adelante con el. Además dice que gracias a la ayuda que  ha tenido por parte de CEPRODEL  ha podido salir adelante para educarlo y surtir su pulpería para mantener su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Licelda R. has a store in her home, which is located in the town of El Viejo. She will use this loan to pay her annual taxes. In addition she will buy some merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other items.

Sra. Licelda is a single mother with a son. With great effort, she has been able to move forward and provide him with an education. She also thanks CEPRODEL for the support that allowed her to pay for her son’s education and restock her store so that she can maintain an active business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & pay her annual taxes

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 27 años y es casada. Elba tiene una hija llamada Daira que tiene 06 años.

Evelin es una mujer emprendedora trabajadora que se las ingenio para trabajar, ella y su esposo abrieron un pequeño taller de confección  de artesanía de tipo muñequería en su domicilio. Evelin también se dedica a la enseñanza de artesanía en dos lugares en el colegio “Pukllaysunchis” y en la “Dirección Regional de Turismo”, ella enseña a construir artesanía de tipo muñequería con materiales de cera de papa y tecnopor. Evelin usará el crédito para comprar materiales como por ejemplo tecnopor, silicona, lanas, mantas, hilos, fibra y mantas. Ella actualmente no esta estudiando pero con las ganancias que logre de su negocio podrá estudiar antropología. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Evelin belongs to the “Sacsayhuaman” Community Bank in the Arariwa Association. She is 27 years old and is married. She has a daughter named Daira who is six years old. Evelin is an enterprising, hardworking woman who is clever with her work. She and her husband opened a small workshop in their home where they make folk-art such as dolls. Evelin also teaches folk-art in two schools: “Pukllaysunchis” and the “Dirección Regional de Turismo”. She teaches how to make folk-art dolls with materials such as paper mache and styrofoam. Evelin will use this loan to buy materials such as styrofoam, silicone, wool, blankets, thread and string. Actually, she is not studying now, but with the earnings from her business she hopes to study Anthropology. This member of the cooperative is thankful for the opportunity offered through the bank and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Evelin will use her loan to buy materials such as styrofoam, silicone, wool, thread, and yarn.

loans.name: Ventana Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado Ventana al Futuro y está conformado por 19 perseverantes socias, pertenecientes a la comuna de Pitrufquén, ubicada a 30 km. de la ciudad de Temuco. Se dedican a diferentes negocios independientes, principalmente a la venta de quesos, ropa, leña, banquetería; fabricación y venta de pan integral, sopaipillas y taller de costuras.
La socia entrevistada fue Marisol, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en 1º fila, ocupa el 4º lugar de izquierda a derecha y viste jeans gris y polera estampada. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa principalmente de mujer y por encargos vende ropa de hombre y de niño, en su casa, a vecinos y otros contactos. Viaja frecuentemente a Santiago a comprar su mercadería. Marisol invertirá este préstamo en ropa de otoño-invierno. 
Su sueño es tener una tienda en el centro de la ciudad. Su motivación son sus 3 hijos de 22, 20 y 14 años, a los cuales paga los estudios. Para Marisol, Fondo Esperanza ha sido muy importante en su negocio, ya que no tuvo ningún impedimento para la obtención de  préstamos. Además le ha sido muy útil la educación emprendedora que ha recibido, con respecto a la administración de su dinero.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.  Si bien esta zona fue dañada por el reciente terremoto que afectó a Chile, este Banco Comunal no sufrió graves efectos por el mismo.
texts.en:
This community bank is named Ventana al Futuro and it is made up of 19 persevering members from the community of Pitrufquen, 30 Km. from the city of Temuco. They work in different independent businesses, mainly selling cheese, clothing, firewood, catering; making and selling whole grain bread, sopaipillas and tayloring shops. The member interviewed was Marisol, the president of this group. In the picture she is in the first row, fourth from the left. She is wearing gray jeans and a printed shirt. She sells clothes for women in particular, and by request, for men and children. She sells clothes from her house to neighbors and other contacts. She travels frequently to Santiago to buy merchandise. Marisol will invest this loan in fall-winter clothing. Her dream is to have a store in the city's downtown. Her motivations are her sons of 22, 20 and 14, for whose studies she pays. For Marisol, Fondo Esperanza has been very important in her business, because she did not have any problems getting the loans. In addition, the entrepenurial education she has received has been very useful for her in regards to managing her money. Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located at 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Chile's Capital) and has a number of lake beaches and very atractive native flora and fauna. It's worth mentioning that in this region live 50% of the Mapuche indigenous people of the country. Even though this area was damaged by the recent earthquake that affected Chile, this community bank did not suffer major damage because of it.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise: fall-winter clothing

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: Née le 05 Avril 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Irène est mariée à ECLOU Edgard, un mécanicien auto. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a cinq ans environs que Irène s'est installée avec sa famille au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Irène vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, couscous, savons, conserves de sardine, lait, huile végétale, mayonnaise, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Irène s'approvisionne. Irène exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a bénéficié une fois déjà de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Irène sollicite un deuxième crédit en vue de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on April 5, 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. H. Irène is married to Mr. ECLOU Edgard, an auto mechanic. The couple have two children, who are both in school. Five years ago, Irène and her family settled in the Sènadé district in Cotonou. The couple jointly ensure that the various family expenses are covered. To address their needs, Irène sells a variety of goods (pasta, couscous, soaps, canned sardines, milk, vegetable oil, mayonnaise, etc.) out of her home. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for eight years and has benefited already from one loan from ALIDé that she repaid. Irène is requesting a second loan with the aim of bolstering her business and satisfying the burgeoning number of demands from her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods (pasta, canned foods, sardines, sugar, soaps)

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos ya independizados, actualmente vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años al transporte publico en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el cubre rutas dentro de la ciudad de Olmos y sus caseríos. Estas unidades son de mucha ayuda en la zona ya que son el unico medio de transporte que utilizan los pobladores de las zonas rurales para llegar a sus caseríos.

Segundo es una presona muy entregada a su trabajo, el nos comenta que esta actividad le hace sentir util, activo y que disfruta mucho de ella. El problema es que los caminos de la zona son muy accidentados y esto siempre causa daños en los vehículos. En esta ocasión, su mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas técnicas que necesitan de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Segundo es muy conocido y respetado por los vecinos de la zona en donde vive. Ellos lo consideran una personas bastante responsable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudarlos cuando lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Segundo is 62, married, and with three grown children who are on their own. Currently he lives with his wife in the Olmos district, located in Lambayeque province, an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past four years he has worked in public transport with a mototaxi (motorized vehicle used to transport people and cargo). He covers the routes inside the city of Olmos and its farm villages. These transports are a big help in the rural areas where they are the only means of transportation that the poor can use to get to their farms. Segundo is very dedicated to his work. He tells us that this work makes him feel useful, active, and he really enjoys it. The problem is that the rural roads are very rough and this always causes damage to vehicles. Now his mototaxi has begun to experience some technical problems that urgently need repair to be able to run correctly. That is why he is asking for a loan for the first time with Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 new sols. He plans to use it to repair and maintain his vehicle. Segundo is well-known and respected by the neighbors in the area where he lives. They consider him a very responsible person who is always ready to help them when they need him.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintence expenses of his mototaxi

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán pomares  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor M. Bermúdez   realiza su trabajo como chofer de la ruta de bus Somotillo Rodeo Grande dándoles servicio de viajes a todos los clientes de las comarcas.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar de  30 bolsas de cemento  6 quintales de hierro para la construcción  de su casa de habitación y de esta manera tener una mejor condición de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. M. Bermúdez lives in the neighborhood of Germán Pomares in the town of Somotillo. He works as a chauffeur along the Somotillo Rodeo Grande bus route. Jose provides travel services to all of his customers from the region.

He is requesting a loan to buy 30 bags of cement and 6 quintales (1 quintal = 100 kg) of iron so that he can build his house and achieve a better standard of living for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement & iron for the construction of his house

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Antonio C. O.. Se desempeña como agente de seguridad en un colegio publico es casado, padre de tres hijos en edades escolar y cada crédito le han beneficiado  por que no existe otra forma para la mejora de sus vivienda ya que para acceder un crédito de vivienda muchos casos no clasifican porque piden muchos requisitos desde la propiedad inscrita en el registro catastral y los salarios con un ingreso 10 veces superior a los nuestros es por esto la importancia de estas instituciones que si benefician a persona de bajos ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Antonio C. O. works as a security officer at a public school. He is married and the father of three school age children. Juan has benefited from each loan he has received because he has no other resources for improving his home. He has already accessed several housing loans. In most cases, he would not qualify because many loans have several requirements that may include property with a registered deed and an income that is ten times what he is currently earning. For this reason, it is important that there are institutions that benefit low-income people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. C. B. tiene un taller de Reparación de Bicicletas y a la vez vende accesorios y repuestos para reparación de los mismos. 

El va a utilizar el crédito para comprar llantas, neumáticos, breques, cadenas etc. Todo para surtir el negocio y salir adelante.
El Sr. C. es padre soltero de un hijo el cual lo ha criado solo pero que gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido darle todo lo necesario para educarlo y salir adelante.

El Sr. C. tiene además una granja de Cerdos la cual la ha venido formando con las ganancias que ha generado su negocio y los créditos que le ha otorgado la Institución ya que a la fecha son 26 créditos los que ha tenido con CEPRODEL.

Por tal razón el dice estar muy agradecido por la ayuda que le ha brindado  la Institución  todos estos años ya que el es un cliente que prácticamente Inicio con CPEODEL y siempre ha sido un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Sr. C. B. has a bicycle repair shop where he also sells accessories and spare parts. He will use this loan to buy bicycle rims, tires, brakes, chains, and other items so that he can restock his business and move forward.
