Sr. C. is a single father with a son who he is raising alone. Thanks to his efforts, he is able to provide him with everything he needs to get an education and succeed.

Sr. C. also has a pig farm that he started with the earnings generated from his business and the loans provided by the Institution. To date he has received 26 loans from CEPRODEL. For this reason, he says he is very grateful for the assistance the Institution has provided all these years. He practically started with CEPRODEL and has always been an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bicycle rims, tires, brakes, chains, and other items

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya es un año que forma parte del banco comunal. Ella dice quien la invito en participar fue una de sus colegas. 
  
Gloria tiene 24 años y es soltera. Gloria estudió en la Universidad San Antonio Abad del Cusco la carrera profesional de Educación y se especializo para enseñar al nivel primario. Ella trabajó en el colegio particular “Rosa de América” durante tres año y ahora esta esperando la contrata nacional de docentes para trabajar para el estado. Gloria necesita especializarse porque el estado peruano solo esta contratando personas que tengan especialidad en educación, grado de maestría o doctorado y por eso Gloria esta estudiando una maestría en la universidad particular “Cesar vallejo” y paga una mensualidad de 500 soles. Gloria usará el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de su maestría y para gastos personales. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the communal bank “Sacsayhuaman," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. It has been a year since she became a member. She says that one of her colleagues invited her to participate. Gloria is 24 years old and single. She studied in the San Antonio Abad University in Cusco, in the education department, and she specialized in teaching at the primary level. She worked in the private school “Rosa de América” for 3 years and now is hoping to be hired as a national teacher so that she can work for the state. Gloria needs to specialize, because the Peruvian state only hires people who have an educational specialty at the level of a Master's or Doctorate, and for this reason Gloria is studying toward the Master's degree in the private university "Cesar Vallejo," for which she pays 500 Peruvian soles per month. Gloria will use the loan to pay her monthly fees and for her personal expenses. She is very pleased with the opportunity provided through these means, and is committed to making the payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay monthly educational fees for Master's program in education

loans.name: Joel De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Joel De Jesús Hernández M.. Se desempeña como botone en un hotel de playas tiene mas de cinco años en esta actividad conduce vehículos para transportar cliente  hacia y desde las habitaciones y otros lugares que ofrece el hotel. Este crédito lo solicito para comprar materiales de construcción para mejora en su vivienda. Es padre de 3 hijos dos en etapa escolar. Y dice que estos créditos le han beneficiado porque de otra forma es difícil hacer cambios en nuestros hogares.
texts.en:
This is Sr. Joel De Jesús Hernández M.. He has worked as a bellhop at a beach hotel for more than five years. Joel also drives the transport vehicles to take the customers to their rooms and other places around the hotel.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials to improve his home. He is the father of three children, two of whom are in school. Joel says that these loans have been beneficial because it would be difficult for him to secure another resource that would allow him to make changes to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make home improvements

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
T. Nickson, 65 years old and married, is a farmer based in Nyabitete, Rukungiri. He is married with four school-going children.

Nickson has a long track record in the agriculture business, spanning a period of over fifteen years. In this period, he says lots of challenges and pitfalls have crossed his way. For example, he says the lack of funds to pay laborers and to buy good quality manure has been a constant problem. However, he believes that with the loan, some of these problems will be history. 

With persistence and hard work, Nickson’s business has seen the light of day to up to now. He is hoping to improve on his only dependable source of livelihood with this loan. With it, he will be able to mulch his plantations and provide more manure for them.

loans.use: To mulch and buy more manure for his plantations

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Circumstances have not been in N. Richard‘s favour over the last several months as he has had to endure bad yields and adverse weather conditions which have affected Nyabitete Cell, Rukungiri.

Richard is a farmer, just like his wife, and the teamwork they have together is helping them succeed. They work so hard to ensure that once they have children of their own, they will be able to take good care of them and save for their future.

Richard has been in the agriculture business for the last thirteen years and attributes his longevity in this field to his work ethic. He plans to shift to a more commercialized form of agriculture, which he believes will help him to jump out of his poverty trap.

With the loan, Richard believes he will be able buy more manure, like cow dung, and other fertilizer for better productivity.

loans.use: To buy manure and other fertilizer

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Cándida Rosa C. Narváez. Se desempeña como supervisora de camarera en donde tiene que revisar cada actividad que hace cada camarera es madre de cinco hijos. Actualmente no tiene casa propia y espera con este crédito comprar un lote de terreno para luego empezar a construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Cándida Rosa C. Narváez works as a waitstaff supervisor. She is responsible for reviewing each activity that a waiter performs. Cándida is the mother of five children. She currently does not have her own house and hopes to use this loan to buy a plot of land so that she can later begin building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land where she can build a house

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La Sra. Petronila B. presta servicio de taxi  los usuarios, ella vive en el municipio del Viejo.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de algunos repuestos para reparar el taxi como llantas, pie de vías, Reparación de caja de cambios, etc. Y a la vez darle mantenimiento ya que es él, el que le proviene la alimentación diaria. 

Este es el segundo  crédito que tiene con la Institución y el primero lo pago muy bien en tiempo y forma y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución ya que dice estar muy agradecida con CEPRODEL, por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Petronila B. provides taxi service to those who want to use it. She lives in the town of El Viejo. Petronila will use this loan to buy spare parts because there a few items on her taxi that need to be repaired such as the rims, tire treads, gearbox, etc. Her vehicle needs to be maintained because it provides for her daily needs.

This is the second loan she has received from the Institution. She repaid her first loan on time and hopes to continue working with the Institution. Petronila says she is very grateful to CEPRODEL for the support that has been provided to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance & repairs to her taxi

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
R. Caroline is a married woman with four children who resides in Kazindiro, Rukungiri district. She is a farmer who has been operating the business together with her family for twelve years. The major problem they have faced has been a lack of capital to purchase farm inputs and carry out much needed farm improvements like mulching.

With hard work, they have been able to make the best out of the little their farm can give them and this is why Caroline needs a loan. She will be to able to mulch her farm and buy more manure for it so that it will give her better yields that will pull her out of the poverty pit.

Caroline is such a hardworking and devoted lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To mulch her farm and buy more manure for it

loans.name: Bella Vista Group

texts.es:
BELLA VISTA es un banco D. emprendimiento que se fundo en la zona que lleva el mismo nombre, esta conformado por 10 socios quienes en su mayoria se dedican al comercio informal y a otras actividades para poder sostener a sus familias. La mayoria D. los socios viven en la misma calle por lo que son muy conocidos entre ellos.

Fue elegida la Sra Rufina como presidenta D. la asociacion, ella actualmente es viuda y tiene un hijo quien le ayuda a su Mama en todas las cosas que requiera sobre todo cuando la Sra se dedica a la venta D. comida a los trabajadores D. la fabrica D. ladrillos que esta la Zona, tambien se dedica crianza y venta D. perros, tiene a la fecha 18 perros a los cuales cria con mucho cariño, ella dice que casi son como hijos por lo cual les brinda esa atencion. indica tambien que usara el prestamo solicitado para el incremento D. capital en su tienda

La Sra Rogelia esta casada y se dedica la confeccion D. ropa, tiene hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar, es muy responsable y trabajadora y con el dinero del credito comprara telas al por mayor para la confeccion D. sus productos. 
y como ella los demas integrantes tambien invertiran en el incremento D. capital para sus negocios y en algunos casos el inicio D. uno, y D. esta manera mejorar la condicion D. vida D. sus familias.

Todos los socios estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
"Bella Vista" is a communal bank located in the neighborhood of the same name. It is formed by 10 members, the majority of whom work in informal commerce and other activities to support their families. The majority of the members live on the same street and so they know each other very well. Rufina was elected president of the association. She is a widow and has a son who helps his mother in every way that she needs, especially when Rufina is selling food to the workers in the brick factory that is in the neighborhood. She also raises and sells dogs. At this date she has 18 dogs that she is raising with a lot of affection. She says that they are almost like children to her, and as such she provides them with a lot of attention. She tells us that she will use the loan requested to increase the capital in her store. Rogelia is married and makes clothing. She has small children who are school-aged. She is very responsible and hardworking, and with the money from the loan she will buy fabrics at wholesale in order to make more of her products. Like Rogelia, the other members of the group will invest the loan proceeds in their businesses and in a number of cases, will start a new business. In this way they will improve the living conditions of their families. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Kenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Kenia  Del Carmen Aragón Z.. Es soltera sin hijos actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria. El crédito lo solicito para comprar materiales de construcción para iniciar la construcción de su casa. Ella expresa que la única manera de tener una casa es a través del financiamiento que hacen estas micro financieras las cuales proveen servico financieros de acuerdo al salario de cada cliente.
texts.en:
Kenia Del Carmen Aragón Z. is single and does not currently have children. She works as a primary school teacher. The loan she requests is to buy construction materials to start construction on her house. She says that the only way to have a house is through the loans that these micro-finance organizations make; they provide financial services according to the salary of each client.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials such as sand, cement, cement blocks and quarried stone

loans.name: Sara Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Sara Patricia H. Alemán. Se desempeña como asistente de tesorería en una alcaldía del municipio tiene mas de veintidós años de experiencia en dicha actividad es madre de un hijo en edad escolar los créditos le han ayudados para mejorar su nivel de vida este crédito lo solicito para construir un cuarto de habitación y lleva varios créditos con CEPRODEL y espera que siempre existan estas instituciones que beneficien a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Sara Patricia H. Alemán works as an assistant treasurer in a city hall. She has more than 22 years of experience in this activity. She is the mother of a son who is school-aged. The loans have helped her to improve her living standard. The loan she requests will be used to build a room in her home. She has had a number of loans with CEPRODEL, and she hopes that these institutions that benefit low-income people will always exist.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, concrete blocks, cement, support beams and other materials

loans.name: Myriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Myriam del Socorro M., es madre soltera de  una hija mayor de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de comida en su casa de habitación, ella labora con este tipo de negocio desde hace 20 años ha salido adelante con el apoyo de su hija que le ayuda en su negocio, el financiamiento lo solicito para comprar mercaderia para mi mismo negocio y para hacerle mejoras a mi negocio.
La Señora M. se sacrifica bastante para sacar adelante a su hija.
La señora M. ya lleva con nosotros dos créditos en los cuales me manifestó que sus financiamientos los invierte para su negocio y para hacerles mejoras a sus condiciones de vida, ya que son créditos que le han  dado oportunidad  para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Myriam del Socorro M. is a single mother of a grown daughter. She has a store where she sells food in her home. She has worked in this type of business for 20 years. She has gotten ahead with the support of her daughter, who helps her with the business. The loan that she requests is to buy merchandise for this store to improve the business. Señora M. sacrifices a lot in order to help her daughter to get ahead. She has had 2 loans with us, which she tells us that she used to invest in her business and improve her quality of life, because these loans have given her the opportunity to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and pots for her business

loans.name: Iris Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Iris Consuelo V. V., tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es costurera, y madre soltera de una hija que estudia para ser enfermera, ella elabora prendas de vestir y las vende en el Mercado Oriental.

Ella solicita de un prestamo para la compra de materiales de constrcccion con el objetivo de remodelar del porche de su vivienda, esto le permitira mejores comodidades en su hogar y la satisfacción personal de ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida para su hija, dentro de los planes a largo plazo, esta la apertura de una boutique de ropa, esto con el fin de competir en el mercado de ropa usada, que se le ha venido dando a lo largo de dos años para la fecha.
texts.en:
Iris Consuela V. V., 46, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is a seamstress and a single mother of a daughter who is studying to be a nurse. She makes garments and sells them at the Eastern Market.

Iris is requesting a loan to buy construction materials with the goal of remodeling her porch. This will make her house more comfortable and increase her personal satisfaction by being able to provide better living conditions for her daughter. Her plans in the long term are to open a clothing boutique so that she may better compete in the used clothing market, which she has been doing for the past two years to date.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy construction materials to fix her house's porch

loans.name: Frutos De Vida Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado Frutos de Vida y está conformado por 18 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos se dedican a diferentes negocios independientes tales como: repostería, fabricación de monturas y espuelas, costuras, venta de ropa usada, leña y carbón y reciclaje de cobre, bronce y aluminio.
La socia entrevistada fue María Magdalena, quien es la presidenta de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra sentada en 1º fila, en el 4º asiento de izquierda a derecha. Ella vende materiales reciclables como cartón, botellas, metales, fierros y chatarras (como las latas de bebida), negocio al cual se dedica desde hace 39 años. Tiene 2 hijos ya adultos y su hija también pertenece a este grupo y vende comida rápida. 
María Magdalena invertirá este préstamo en mercadería, ya que ella no solo recolecta, sino que también compra lo que necesite. Además tiene la motivación de comenzar con la venta de papas fritas en un carrito que armó de a poco con préstamos anteriores, el cual se ubica en su casa. Para ello comprará aceite, papas, papel, aderezos (ketchup y mostaza) y servilletas. 
Para ella ha sido muy importante trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un gran apoyo económico, moral y motivacional, gracias a las reuniones semanales de grupo en donde comparte con sus compañeros y aprende sobre cómo debe administrar su negocio. Para María Magdalena es muy importante mantenerse ocupada y útil, ya que hace un tiempo tuvo depresión y su negocio le ayudó a recuperarse.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.  Si bien esta zona fue dañada por el reciente terremoto que afectó a Chile, este Banco Comunal no sufrió graves efectos por el mismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Frutos de Vida. It is made up of 18 members, residents of the city of Temuco. They work in different independent businesses such as: pastrymaking, manufacturing of saddles and spurs, sewing, selling used clothes, firewood and charcoal, and recycling copper, bronze and aluminum. The member who was interviewed was María Magdalena, the president of the group. In the photo, she is seated in the first row, fourth from the left. She sells recyclable materials such as cardboard, bottles, metal, iron, and scrap (such as beverage cans). She has been at the business for 39 years. She has two adult children and her daughter also belongs to this group and sells fast food. María Magdalena will invest this loan in merchandise, since she doesn't only collect but also buys whatever she needs. She also has the motivation to begin to sell french fries in a cart she outfitted a little with previous loans. The cart is at her house. For this she will buy oil, potatoes, paper, condiments (ketchup and mustard), and napkins. For her it has been very important to work with Fondo Esperanza. It has been a big financial, moral and motivational support, thanks to the weekly meetings in which she shares with the other members and learns about how to manage her business. For María Magdalena, it is very important to stay busy and useful. Some time ago she was depressed and her business helped her to get better. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is 670 kilometers from Santiago ( the capital of Chile). It has a series of lake beaches and very striking native flora and fauna. It's worth noting that in this region live 50% of the Mapuches, an indigenous group that exists in our country. This area was damaged by the recent earthquake that affected Chile, but this communal bank suffered no ill effects from it.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Oil, potatoes, paper, condiments and napkins

loans.name: Cristóbal Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Cristóbal Antonio A. es comerciante desde hace 18 años, su trabajo lo desempeña por toda Chinandega, tiene su taxi propio que es su medio para trabajar y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que estan en edad escolar y todavía dependen de el y su esposa.
Ambos son trabajadores se esfuerzan por el pan de cada día y estudios de sus hijos los financiamientos obtenidos con ceprodel le han ayudado al señora A. a mejorar tanto su negocio como su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Cristóbal Antonio A. has been a businessman for 18 years. He performs his work throughout Chinandega. He has his own taxi, which is his means of working and advancing his three children, who are of school age an still depend on him and his spouse.

Both are workers. They strive for their daily sustenance and their children's education. The financing obtained through CEPRODEL has helped Sr. A. improve both his business and his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his home and his means of transportation

loans.name: William

texts.en:
K. William is a diligent farmer who is married with four children. He carries out his farming activities at Rutabago, Rukungiri district. He has been a farmer for a long time, a period dating back to the early 90‘s.

Some of the major challenges that have constantly made William lag behind include a lack of farm inputs and insufficient capital to transport his produce to the more lucrative bigger markets in the urban centers of western Uganda.

William foresees a favorable change in his circumstances if he can access a loan that can be repaid over a long period so that it could benefit him. He believes he will be able to improve his farm by mulching and be able to transport some of his produce to the bigger markets.

loans.use: To mulch his farm by employing labor to collect the grass as well as provide transport for his farm produce

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana Basilia R., tiene un tramo en el mercado central ubicado en el sector madera lleva mas de de 20 años de estar con su negocio.
Los financiamientos la señora R. los solicita para comprar mercaderia que le llegan a vender a su negocio  y para comprar madera para que con la ayuda de su esposo elaboren los productos que en su negocio venden ya que con la ayuda de Dios tienen un taller en su casa y ahí elaboran algunos de los productos que venden o que les encargan.
La señora R. es madre de cinco hijos todos en edad escolar lucha por vender y sacar el bocado diario para sus hijos, en la entrevista nos manifestó que con estos créditos ella ha mejorado su calidad  de vida,  tambien ella se ayuda con la elaboración de piñatas.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Basilia R. has a section in the wood sector in the central market. She has had her business for more than 20 years. She is seeking financing to buy merchandise that she will sell in her business and also to buy wood so that with the help of her husband they can make the products that they sell in their business, since, with the help of God, they have a workshop in their house, and there they make some of the products that they sell or are ordered.

Señora R. is the mother of five children, all of school age. She works hard to sell and to obtain daily food for her children. In the interview, she declared that with these loans she has improved their quality of life. She also helps herself by making piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her buisness and wood for furniture

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey first began welding as a boy growing up in Nevada City, CA. 

“I got into it because it was fun. It just came easy to me.”  

Combining a natural talent with metal, an eye for design, and his enthusiasm for off-road vehicles, Joey opened his own custom welding and metals fabrication shop, Infamous Metal Works. 
 
Over the past several years, Joey has built a dedicated client base, first by taking on side-work for customers while working at a metal fabrication shop, and now through his own business. These loyal customers, now friends, strongly encouraged Joey to start his business when the opportunity presented itself in 2007. Their support, as well as the customer referrals they send, has been critical over the past two years, and Joey has built up a brand name for himself without putting much effort into marketing. 
 
In the next year, he would like to increase sales through his website and to hire another employee to help him and his two part-time workers to manage the increasing work load. 

“I wish I could say that I make my own schedule, but I’m here 10-14 hours a day, 7 days a week. There’s always something to do, whether it’s helping customers, ordering parts, or setting up the machines.” 
 
A $10,000 loan will allow Joey to purchase a steel-cutting machine that will expand his design capabilities and attract new customers. 

“I can design a part on my computer, and then use the machine to cut it into the steel. It will open a lot of doors to grow my business.”

loans.use: New eqiupment to increase efficiency and design new parts

loans.name: María Nela

texts.es:
La señora María Nela M. V. tiene 34 años de edad,  casada, Madre de tres niños, dos de ellos en edad escolar, comerciante desde hace  nueve años su negocio lo tiene ubicado a cuatro cuadras del Mercado central, ahí ella alquila ese local.
La señora V. anteriormente era ama de casa pero con el tiempo le fue gustando el trabajo de su esposo y ahora los dos administran ese negocio, abren el negocio a las ocho y media de la mañana y lo cierran alas cinco y media de la tarde de lunes a sábados los días domingos lo dejan para sus hijos.
Tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel, este financiamiento ella lo solicito para comprar algunos tipos de venenos para plagas ya que es un producto que no deja de vende y el cual casi no tenia en existencia esperando que este producto le ayude a las ventas malas que ha tenido. En los financiamientos que le hemos dado le han ayudado a remodelar su casa y su negocio ya que ahora tiene mejor acondicionado su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Nela M. V. is 34 years old and married. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are school-aged. She has been a merchant for nine years. Her business is located four blocks from the Central Market. She rents her place of business. Ms. V. used to be a homemaker, but over time she came to like her husband’s business and now the two of them administer it. They open the business at 8:30 in the morning and they close it at 5:30 in the afternoon, Monday through Saturday. They spend Sunday with their children. She has been working with Ceprodel for five years. She is requesting this loan to buy various types of poisons for pests because this is a type of product that always sells well. She hasn’t had this product well stocked and she has been waiting to buy it to help her with the poor sales she’s been having. The loans we have given her have helped her to remodel her house and her business. Her business is now better equipped and her quality of life is better.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for my business, such as poison for ants, other pests, etc.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA EULOGIA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BALONES PARA NIÑOS DE GOMA Y CUERO DESDE HACE NUEVE AÑOS, TAMBIEN TIENE SU PUESTO EN EL MERCADO AGUSTIN LOPEZ DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, LA SEÑORA ES MUY ANTIGUA EN LA INSTITUCION, ESTA EN UN BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO VILLA PARAISO, ELLA ES LIDER DE SU GRUPO DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE. LOS CREDITOS LO UTILIZA PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIAL. LA SRA. EULOGIA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE HIJOS PEQUEÑOS ES TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Eulogia has been making rubber balls for children for nine years. She also has her own stall in the Agustín López Martket in the city of Cochabamba. She has been with the institution for a long time. She is in the “Villa Paraíso” entrepreneur’s bank. She is the leader of her group and she has shown herself to be very responsible. She uses the loans to buy materials. Eulogia is married and she has young children. She is hardworking and responsible. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have shown by granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and other materials

loans.name: Nory Isabel

texts.es:
Nory A. de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, en su vivienda cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básico, su esposo es chofer ellos tienen 3 hijos de 26, 20, 18 años. 

Debido a la necesidad económica ella tuvo que abandonar su trabajo como comerciante informal. Hace 15 años atrás Nory y su esposo vendieron un auto que tenían y el dinero lo utilizaron para tener una papelería. 

En estos tiempos ella cuenta con un local propio en el Fortín. Trabaja desde las 06h00 de la mañana, su hija mayor le ayuda. Ha implementado vender ropa y perfumes en la papelería. La delincuencia es uno de de los factores de alto riesgo en su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, ropa, zapatos para incrementar su negocio. En el futuro quiere que su negocio se expanda a las provincias del Ecuador.
texts.en:
Nory A. is 41 years old and lives in the suburbs of Fortín de Guayaquil. She has the basic services of water and light in her home. Her husband is a driver and they have three children ages: 26, 20, 18. For economic reasons she had to leave her job as an informal merchant. Fifteen years ago Nory and her husband sold a car they had and used the money they got to open a paper store. Right now she has her own store in Fortín. She starts working at six in the morning and her daughter helps her. She also sells clothing and perfumes in the paper store. One of the high risk factors in her business is delinquency. She wants to buy notebooks, clothing, and shoes with her loan money to increase her business. She would like to expand her business to all of Ecuador in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, clothing, shoes

loans.name: Belinda Walkiria

texts.es: La Señora Belinda C. es comerciante del mercado central en Chinandega donde atiende su propia pulpería vendiendo todo tipo de productos como comestibles y productos personales destacandose por ser muy trabajadora y muy esforzada. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de los productos para la pulpería, entre estos comprará los comestibles, productos personales y también desea comprar en menor cantidad ropa para niños. La Señora C. tiene dos hijos y se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante y es importante destacar que  su negocio lo abre diario sin descansar ni un solo día tiene 7 años de tener su negocio y lo empezo con la ayuda de su mamá  que la apoyo dándole el capital para que ella saliera adelane.
texts.en:
Belinda Walkiria C. T. is a business owner in the Central Market. Her business is located 1 block west and about one meter south of Calvary Church. She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise like children's clothing and personal hygiene products. Mrs. C. has two children. She works hard to help them get ahead. She opens for business everyday without fail, and she has been in business for seven years. She began with the help of her mother, who supported her by providing the capital so her daughter could get ahead. Mrs. C. has been working with Ceprodel for some time, and she says that because of the loans she has received, her business has prospered and her living conditions have improved.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of merchandise for my business like: toys, children's clothing, shampoo, deodorant, toothpaste, shoe polish

loans.name: Ananius

texts.en:
M. Ananius is a courteous and approachable married man of 56 years with six children, all going to school. He resides in Bikungu Cell of Rukungiri.

Ananius sells produce, principally rice, to his customers who are mostly traders who come from all over the area and some of them with trucks. He has been banking on this business for over twelve years and he is grateful that his business has been able to support him and his family.

However, Ananius has had to bear with a number of setbacks ranging from fluctuating prices, falling demand for rice sold in open markets to low yields from farmers. In a good period, though, when his business is booming, he notes that he can sell over 350 kilograms of rice a day.

With the loan that he is seeking from Kiva, he believes he will be able to buy more sacks of rice for his store.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Thelma Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Thelma Argentina Munguia tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en su localidad en el mercado central de Chinandega.Ella vende ropa de toda clase tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Ella trabaja arduamente para suplir los gastos de su hogar y la razón única por la que está solicitando el crédito hoy en día es para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa ya que la necesita a lo inmediato para continuar comercializandola y de esta manera obtener los ingresos pertinentes y sobre todo suplir la demanda de sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
Thelma Argentina Munguia C. has a business in her house, which is two blocks away from the central market. She sells all types of clothing and sometimes buys clothing in bulk for adults, teens or children, depending on how much money she has saved up. She has two children, but neither of them depend on her financially. She works for herself and to cover her household expenses. This is the first loan Thelma has taken out with Ceprodel. She came to us because she was tired of working with lenders who squeeze everything out of small business owners, and so she decided to look into the loans that Ceprodel offers. She expects to keep working with us and, with God's help, to pay off her loans on time.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bulk purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia,  D. 47 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la casa D. su suegra con su esposo y  su última  hija, pues sus 2 hijos mayores se han independizado.Cada día alrededor D. la 4 D. la madrugada acuD. a la distribuidora central D. periódicos, para recoger los diarios que tiene que redistribuir  hasta  el mediodía, los lleva  a los diversos kioscos del distrito donD. vive. DesD. hace 2 años se dedica a esta labor, le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten cubrir  la alimentación y  educación D. su hija menor, ya que su pareja es un hombre muy  irresponsable que no se hace cargo D. su pequeña. A veces tiene dificultades en su trabajo, pero a Eusebia le gusta mucho trabajar como distribuidora D. diarios.  Y en los próximos meses quiere incursionar en la venta D.  productos D. belleza, con la finalidad D. incrementar sus ingresos, y así brindarle una mejor  calidad D. vida a su menor hija.Es el  séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además se siente satisfecha con sus compañeras D. crédito  porque son personas responsables, al igual que ella.Eusebia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra D.  revistas, porque hay mayores ganancias en las ventas,  y  con el resto del dinero comprará gran cantidad  D. productos D. belleza, para empezar en este negocio y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Eusebia, age 47, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and her youngest daughter. Her two oldest children are independent. Everyday at around four in the morning she goes to the central newspaper distributor to gather the papers that she needs to redistribute until noon. She takes them to various kiosks in the district where she lives. She has been doing this work for two years. It generates regular earnings, which allow her to cover the food and education for her youngest daughter. She does this because her husband is a very irresponsible man, who does not take care of his daughter. At times she has difficulties in her work, but Eusebia really likes her work as a distributor of daily papers. In the coming months she wants to venture into selling beauty products. She wants to do this to increase her earnings and give her youngest daughter a better quality of life. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She promises to make her payments punctually. She is happy with her loan colleagues because they are responsible people, the same as she is. She will use the money she is requesting to buy magazines because there are greater earnings selling them. She will use the rest of the money to buy a large quantity of beauty products to start in this business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy magazines to improve her business

loans.name: Pedro Ramon

texts.es:
Don Pedro Ramón S. O. es un productor que se dedica  a las actividades de trabajo agropecuarias sembrando granos básicos y a la compra y venta de ganado el cual vende a comerciantes que compran el ganado en la misma localidad para después venderlos a los mataderos.
Este crédito lo utilizara para comprar 4 novillos para engorde, don Pedro Ramón S. quiere comprar estos novillos con el objetivo de engordarlos por tres meses y después  venderlos una vez estos alcancen un mayor peso y tener una ganancia en el momento que realice la venta de estos. Este productor comenzó este tipo de trabajo sembrando granos y con la ganancia y el apoyo financiero que se le otorga por parte de Ceprodel comenzó comprando 2 novillos los cuales el vendía y de esa manera él ha venido invirtiendo la ganancia en la compra de mas reses para tener una mayor operatividad de trabajo y a la vez esto le genere más ingresos, antes de comprar ganado este productor solamente se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos como el cultivo de frijol y maíz esto para consumo y otra parte comercializarlo, con este financiamiento para la compra de novillos el espera que le genere más ingresos  ya que el solamente obtenía ingresos en épocas de invierno con las cosechas de los granos básicos ahora el tendrá  otra alternativa de trabajo en todo tiempo sobre todo en épocas de verano, esto le ayuda a resolver sus necesidades básicas en su hogar, el es casado tiene tres hijos dos de sus hijos estudian la primaria en una escuelita que hay en la comunidad del vi jagual de yali comunidad donde él vive. Este cliente tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel en todo ese periodo se le han otorgado 5 créditos para este mismo rubro o actividad de trabajo. 
El impacto y beneficio de este apoyo financiero ha venido siendo notable y de mucha importancia para este cliente debido a que esto le ha permitido mejorar y obtener otros ingresos que son de mucha ayuda a su familia, esto de alguna manera da un aporte al desarrollo del núcleo familiar y mejora su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro Ramón S. O. works in agriculture and livestock, growing basic grains and buying cattle which will later be sold for slaughter. He will use this loan to buy four young bulls for fattening. Pedro Ramón S. wants to buy these bulls in order to fatten them for three months and then sell them once they have gained weight so that he will make a profit on the sale. He began this type of work by growing grains, and with the profits and financial support from Ceprodel he bought two bulls which he later sold. He has continued investing the profits in the purchase of more cattle in order to have more work and higher income. Before he started buying cattle, he only grew basic grains like beans and corn for personal use and for sale. With this loan for the purchase of young bulls, he hopes to create more income. In the past he had income only in the winter with the harvest. Now he will have another option for work at all times but overall in the summertime. This will help him to meet basic needs in his home. Pedro is married and has three children. Two of the children attend a small primary school in the community. This customer has been working with Ceprodel for four years. In that time he has taken out five loans for this same purpose. The impact and benefit of this financial support have been very important for this customer because they have allowed him to improve his income and create new sources of income, which is very helpful to his family. This helps in a way to support the development of the nuclear family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four young bulls

loans.name: Andrea Olivia

texts.es:
La Señora Andrea C. M. es casada tiene tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo su negocio esta ubicado a cuadra aledañas al merado central, ambos administran el negocio, empezo su negocio con un capital de C$ 3,0000.00 fueron aporte de su esposo trabajan de lunes a domingo.
Ambos luchan por salir adelante, tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nosotros y le han sacado provecho a estos créditos ya que su calidad de vida es mejor  le dan gracias Dios y al banquito por que siempre los han apoyado para sus inversiones
texts.en:
Andrea C. M. is married and has three children who are in school. Her husband helps her manage her business, which is located a block from the central market. She began her business with a capital investment of C$ 3,0000.00 that was put up by her husband. They work from Monday to Sunday. Both Andrea and her husband struggle hard to get ahead. They have worked with Kiva partner CEPRODEL for four years, and have gotten a lot out of their loans, since their quality of life has improved. They give thanks to God and to their bank because they have always helped them with their investments.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling fast food: tacos, chicken and fries, and soft drinks

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
M. Fred is a happily married man with six school-going children. He and his family reside in Kibirizi parish, Rukungiri district.

Fred’s occupation over the last eleven years has been selling matooke (bananas) as a means of survival. He has faced a number of adversities in the course of doing his business’s trivial round. As it appears, his kind of business activity has many competitors since his location is full of farmers. As a result, he has found it hard to consolidate his finances.

The unreliability of customers, who keep changing preference, is also another problem Fred has had to grapple with. His business will be able to generate him more profits, he says, if he could find a stationery place to operate from, instead of being mobile whereby he has a bicycle from which he sells his matooke.

He says a loan will be his much needed tower of financial strength, whereby he will be able to acquire another bicycle and buy more matooke to sell. With that he says he will be able to build that dream family house and also educate all his children.

loans.use: To buy a new bicycle for his business and more matooke to sell

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra Damaris A. tiene un negocio de venta de carde de cerdo ubicado en el sector chaco frente al sector verdura  es casada con tres hijos en edad escolar.
Sus financiamientos siempre los ocupa para su propio negocio  para comprar chanchos o para remodelar su tramo cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  y ella administra el negocio su negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su esposo ya que el le dio la plata para que empezaran a vender en el mercado ya que la familia de él tienen sus tramos de venta de carde de cerdo. Con la ayuda del Dios ha sabido administrar bien su negocio e inculcarles a sus hijos las buenas costumbres sus financiamientos les ha ayudado a salir adelante e ir metiéndole poco a poco a su terreno que con puro esfuerzo lo compro.
texts.en:
Mayra Damaris A. has a business selling pork, located in the Chaco market across from the vegetable section. She is married and has three school-aged children. She always uses her loans for her business, buying pigs or remodeling her sales stall. She manages the business and receives help from her husband. She began the busienss with her husband's help; he provided the money so that she could begin selling at the market, since his family members also have stalls selling pork. She says that with God's help she has been able to manage her business well and also teach her children good manners. Her loans have helped her get ahead and also build little by little on the land which she bought through her own efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying some pigs in order to sell the meat at a good price

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es:
La Señora Juana Isidra G. B. es comerciante del Mercado Central  desde hace 26 años con ayuda de su esposo ella empezo con su negocio  tiene 6 hijas de las cuales dos  dependen de ella,  ella se sacrifica diario vende en el mercado  es una mujer luchadora que siempre ha trabajado en el campo y en su negocio.
La Señora G. invierte en su negocio  ella tambien se ayuda con la elaboración de dulces, ella hace cajetas y bollos en su finca y los viene a vender a su tramo, tambien sus financiamientos les han ayudado a salir adelante y ha invertido a su finquita
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Isidra G. B. is a merchant in the Central Market. Twenty-six years ago, with the help of her husband, she started up her business. She has six daughters, two of whom are her dependents. She sacrifices herself every day to selling in the market. She is a woman who is a fighter, who has always worked in the countryside and in her business. Mrs. G. invests in her business. She also helps in the manufacture of candy and sweets. She makes fudge and buns at her farm, and sells them at her market place. Her loans have also helped her to do well, and have been invested in her small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to purchase merchandise for my business:  tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Claribel Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Claribel del Socorro B. G., tiene su negocio de venta de productos varios en el mercado ubicado de la iglesia el calvario 175 vrs al oeste, es madre soltera tuvo dos hijos ya son profesionales y ninguno depende de ella.
Ella abre su negocio de lunes a domingo de seis de la mañana a cinco y media de la tarde tiene dos trabajadores  que le ayudan a ver el negocio sus financiamientos los ocupa para invertirlo en su negocio siempre compra lo que este a la moda en las temporadas para aprovechar y vender mas,  desde  hace 33 años que tiene su negocio  lo empezo con un capital de C$5,000.00  que fueron aporte de sus hijos  ya que ella siempre deseo tener un negocio propio  lleva alrededor de cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel  y manifestó que con sus creditos  ha salido adelante y su negocio ha incrementado bastante
texts.en:
Mrs. Claribel del Socorro Blandon Garcia has her business selling various products in the market located 147 meters west of the El Calvario church. She is a single mother with two children who are professionals now. Neither depends on her. She opens her business Sunday through Monday from 6:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. She has two workers who help her tend to the business. She uses her finances to invest in her business. She always buys what's in style for the season to make the most of it and sell more. She has had her business for 33 years. She started with C$5,000.00 of capital contributed by her children, since she always wanted to have her own business. She has been working with Ceprodel for around five years and she stated that with her loans she has been able to get ahead and her business has grown a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the business to purchase toys and children's clothes

loans.name: Gladys Antonia

texts.es: Gladys, de 40 años, vive en la casa de su suegra con su esposo-que es albañil- y 2 de sus 3 hijos, pues la mayor ya tiene familia.Desde hace 5 años, se dedica al bordado, gracias a la habilidad en sus manos, Gladys borda de 10  a 15 polos de algodón al día, con su infalible aguja. Ya está  acostumbrada a esta labor porque la realiza sin dificultad, desde la comodidad de su casa, y así no descuida sus labores; ni a su  familia. Este trabajo le agrada porque le es muy rentable, ya que cuanto mas avanza, mayores son sus ganancias. Hace poco recibió un gran contrato para bordar chompas de exportación, además cuenta con el apoyo incondicional  de su hija menor .Es por esta razón que  se siente muy contenta ya que  con las ganancias ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su casa, porque las ganancias del trabajo de su esposo, que es albañil, no cubre con todas las necesidades.Es el  séptimo préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y  ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además está contenta de trabajar con sus compañeras de su banco comunal pues son muy responsables y trabajadoras.El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de lanas e hilos, de diferentes colores y grosores, para realizar con tranquilidad los diversos bordados de varios pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 40, lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband, a bricklayer, and two of their three children. The oldest already has a family. Thanks to the capability of her hands, she has been doing embroidery for five years. With her infallible needle Gladys embroiders between 10 and 15 cotton polo shirts a day. She is used to this work, and she does it without difficulty from the comfort of her home. That way she does not neglect her chores or her family. She likes this work because it is very profitable. The more she progresses, the more she makes. A little while ago she got a contract to embroider sweaters for export. Also, she has the unconditional support of her youngest daughter. The reason she is so happy is that her earnings help cover the household expenses. Her husband, a bricklayer, does not earn enough to cover all of the necessities. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She reaffirms that she will make her payments on time. Also, she is happy to work with her colleagues in the communal bank. They are very responsible and hard-working. She will use the money she is requesting to buy wool and different colors and types of thread. That way she will peacefully work on the diverse embroidery for various orders that she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and thread to keep embroidering

loans.name: Julia Lily

texts.es: La señora Julia Lyli P. Sandobal es comerciante de este mercado  ubicado en el sector madera tiene  mas de 15 años de operar para esta actividad, su negocio lo inicio con poca mercadería solo tenia un tamo con un capital de C$ 5,000.00 que fueron ahorrad,  ahora tengo tres tramos y tiene bien surtido su negocio  siempre le ha gustado tener su negocio y trabajar por si sola tiene un hijo y un sobrino que le ayuda a vender en el mercado  tiene seis años de trabajar con ceprodel y con este tipo de financiamientos  los cuales le han ayudado bastante ya que su negocio a evolucionado grandemente la señora P. siempre ha sido comerciante le ha gustado depender de su esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Lyli Perez Sandobal is a merchant in this market located in the Madera sector. She has been doing this activity for more than 15 years. She started her business with little merchandise. She only had one section with C$5,000.00 in capital she has saved up. Now she has three sections and her business has a wide selection. She has always likes having her business and working for herself. She has a son and a nephew who help her sell in the market. She has been working with Ceprodel for six years with this type of financing. It has helped her a lot since her business has evolved greatly. Mrs. Perez has always been a merchant. She has liked depending on her own hard work and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some cribs and bottles

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora Petrona Cecilia E. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 16 años tiene un tramo de vena de verduras y frutas viaja  a la capital una vez a la semana a comprar mercadería  para abastecer su negocio, el tramo esta ubicado del alambra 1/2c al norte 1/2c al este en el callejon de verduras por el marisco.
Su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 1,000, abre su negocio diario sin descansar de cinco de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde sus financiamientos los ocupa par el mismo negocio  tiene tres hijos  y solo uno depende de ella  lleva seis años de trabajar con ceprodel  y ella manifiesta que con estos financiamientos en su desarrollo económico le han ayudado bastante ya que ha mejorado el negocio y a la vez su calidad de vida ha ido progresando grandemente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Petrona Cecilia E. has been a merchant in this market for 16 years. She has an assigned spot for selling green vegetables and fruit. She travels to the capital once a week to purchase merchandise to supply her business. Her spot is located a half-block to the north and a half-block to the east of the fence, in the alleyway for green vegetables, by the shellfish. She began her business with C$1,000 capital, and is open for business every day without taking a break, from five in the morning until four in the afternoon. Her loans are used for this very business. She has three children, only one is a dependent. She has spent six years working with Ceprodel, and she has demonstrated that these loans have helped her significantly in her economic development, as her business has improved and at the same time her quality of life has progressed tremendously.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cabbage, carrots, tomatoes, onions, scallops, plums, etc.

loans.name: Fernando Obdulio

texts.es:
Don Fernando Obdulio M. M., vive en una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada en el municipio de yali donde él se dedica a la actividad de trabajos agrícolas  específicamente al cultivo de café y a la ganadería. El crédito lo utilizara para darle asistencia técnica a su finca de café, en este periodo el necesita darle mantenimiento como es regulación de sombra, limpia y asistencia con insumos el va a comprar 12 quintales de abono y 12 quintales de urea y pago de mano de obra para la aplicación de los insumos.
Este cliente vive en una zona altamente productiva y por la característica de la zona que tiene una altura de 1000 msnm (mil metros sobre el nivel del mar) es apta para el cultivo de café que es la actividad principal de trabajo de este cliente, este productor comenzó su trabajo ayudándole a sus padres desde que el era pequeño y después le dieron como herencia 4 manzanas de café. Don Fernando con el crédito el espera darle la asistencia que necesita su finca o cultivo de café debido a que acaba de sacar la cosecha y en este periodo comienza a darle mantenimiento para garantizar la cosecha del próximo año ya que este tipo de cultivo da la cosecha una vez cada año, con esto el obtendrá mayores rendimientos y un producto de mejor calidad el cual le beneficiara a él a la hora de la cosecha, tomado en cuenta que este es un rubro de bastante importancia y uno de los principales  rubros de exportación en nuestro país.
Don Fernando Obdulio es casado y tiene 2 hijos la esposa le ayuda a los quehaceres de la casa y cuido de sus hijos él tiene una niña y un varoncito, el varón está estudiando la primaria y la niña no tiene edad todavía para la escuela.
Don Fernando tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y se le han otorgado 4 créditos para estas actividades de trabajo.
El impacto que obtiene este cliente es bastante importante ya que con este apoyo el podrá garantizar y asistir a sus cultivos obteniendo mayores rendimientos y un producto con mejor calidad, esto le beneficiara y mejora sus ingresos permitiéndole ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando Obdulio M. M. lives in a community located in the town of Yali. He does agricultural work, specifically in growing coffee and in cattle. He will use the loan to give technical assistance to his coffee farm. At this time he needs to give it maintenance such as shade regulating, cleaning and help with materials. He is going to buy 1,200 pounds of fertilizer and 1,200 pounds of urea and also pay the labor costs for the application of the materials. This client lives in a highly productive area. Due to the fact that the area has an altitude of 1000 meters above sea level, it is apt for growing coffee which is the main work activity of this client. This producer started his work helping his parents when he was small. Afterwards, they gave him 6.8 acres of coffee as inheritance. With this loan, Fernando hopes to give his farm and coffee crop the help that it needs. At this time, he just finished the harvest and he is starting to do maintenence to guarantee next year's crop, since this type of crop is harvested once a year. With this he will be able to have higher yields and a higher quality product. This will benefit him when the time comes to harvest, taking into account that this is a very important area and one of the main areas of export in our country. Fernando Obdulio is married and has two children. His wife helps him with the household tasks and in taking care of the children. He has a girl and a little boy. The boy is in elementary school and the girl isn't old enough for school yet. Fernando has been working with Ceprodel for 3 years and he has been given 4 loans for these work activities. The impact on this client has been very important since with this support he can guarantee and help his crops have higher yields and a higher quality product. This will beneifit him and improve his income allowing him to offer a better quality of life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Technical assistance for his farm- to purchase 1,200 pounds of fertilizer and 1,200 pounds of urea

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Reina Isabel C. C.. Es de oficio agricultor  junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos especialmente maíz y trigo los cuales tienen un desarrollo optimo en esos suelos el crédito lo solicito para mejoras en la finca como la realización de potreros y hacer nuevos pastos para el ganado y así separar los terrenos agrícola del ganado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina Isabel C. C. works in agriculture; together with her husband they grow basic grains such as corn and wheat which grow optimally in these soils. She requested the loan for farm improvements such as fencing fields and setting up pastures for the cattle to separate the farming lands from the cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wire to build fences and separate farming lands from cattle.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Maritza Isabel S. es comerciante del sector del barrio  Santa Ana, ella tiene su negocio en el parque central de Chinandega, ahí ella es la encargada de administrar los servicios higiénicos, a la vez elle puso una ventesita de bisutería y de productos de emergencias, toallas sanitarias, pamper, sánicos, toallas de mano etc. El negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 1,000 vendiendo solo lo que son caramelos, La Señora S. es un señora que se esfuerza por trabajar y sacar adelante a sus hijos son dos uno de ellos trabaja pero vive en su casa  le ayudan pero ella trabaja para la mantención del hogar.
Tiene 4 años de tener su negocio  y de trabajar con la institución  tiempo para agradecer ya que a través de estos financiamientos su casa ha venido mejorando y su negocio  tambien.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Isabel S. is merchant in the neighborhood of Santa Ana; she has a business in the central park of Chinandega where she is in charge of managing the restroom and personal hygiene services; she also setup a stand where she sells miscellaneous goods and emergency products for personal hygiene such as feminine pads, pampers, paper towels, etc. She started the business with a capital of C$ 1,000 selling candy. Mrs. S. is dedicated to working hard and providing a better life for her children; one son works but lives at home and helps her, but she works to provide for the household. She has 4 years with her business and also working with the organization; she is very grateful since through these loans she has been able to improve her home and business.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy miscellaneous goods, toilet paper, feminine pads, pampers.

loans.name: Nabuti B Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
Harriet N. is shown at the top right in the small photo and also in the big group photo.

Harriet is a hardworking 43-year-old married woman. She has six children who are between the ages of 4 and 21. The youngest one is in primary 1 and the oldest one is in senior 6.

Harriet is a fresh-food supplier and also does food sales in Kame Vendors area. It is a challenging business to be in because sometimes she does not have enough capital to buy her supplies and also because of the challenges of the different growing seasons. However, her business is good because she is able to generate 120,000 USH each week.

Harriet dreams of boosting her business to make it larger and she also dreams of educating her children. Today she is taking her 3rd loan with Pearl. She has requested 700,000 USH to buy more stock for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, greens and fresh garden foods to sell

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Albino tiene 38 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en la localidad de “Palmapampa” (selva central peruana) en su casa propia.

Dormirse en sus laureles nunca fue una opción para él, ya que en anteriores años laboraba en la agricultura, pero en la actualidad trabaja en el sector de construcción, sumadas ambas actividades lleva 20 años de arduo trabajo. Ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de sus familiares, pero siempre trabaja a cargo de sus ayudantes, además se siente contento con el trabajo, ya que le inspira mucha creatividad e innovación cuando quiere hacer un mueble de acuerdo a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Es por ello que le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que lo otorga buenos resultados. En el futuro quiere implementar su taller de carpintería adquiriendo herramientas modernas que le puedan generar mayores volúmenes de  muebles en un tiempo más corto.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más madera con el propósito de cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Albino is 38, married, and has three children. He lives in Palmapampa (central Peruvian jungle) in his own house. Resting on his laurels was never an option for him. In previous years he worked in farming, but now he works in the area of building. Counting both activities, he has 20 years of arduous work. At times he receives help from his relatives, but he always takes care of his helpers when he works. He is happy with his work. It inspires a lot of creativity and innovation when he wants to make a piece of furniture according to his customers’ tastes and preferences. That is why it is going very well for him in his business, and he gets good results. In the future he wants to set up a carpentry shop. He wants to get modern tools that will allow him to generate a greater volume of furniture in a shorter time. This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to keep making his payments. He will use the money he is requesting to buy more wood in order to finish his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Virginia Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Virginia Yolanda H. es comerciante del mercado central de Chinandega desde hace varios años donde tiene su propio negocio de talabartería que ha sabido administrar satisfactoriamente. Ella es viuda y el negocio fue heredado por su esposo por lo que ella ha logrado salir adelante por su gran dedicación en dicho negocio.

Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para comprar los productos de talabartería y así lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes que le buscan para comprar los productos. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente para los fines que ella misma ha establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia Yolanda H. R. is a businesswoman in the central market. For over 50 years she has had a leather shop, which he husband, Carmelo, oversaw. When he died, she became in charge of the business. It is located two blocks west of the Calvario Church and 15 “varas” (a vara is 20% less than a meter) to the north. The loan that Mrs. H. R. requested is to buy products for her business. It is to have what the customers most look for in her business. She started with C$ 10,000.00 from her children. Before that she was a housewife. Her business was small, and it was only the leather shop. Now she sells natural refreshments and pastries. She has worked with Ceprodel for four years. "Thanks to God that I knew how to administer my business and get ahead." Her grandchildren help her sell in her marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos para la talabartería

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
T. Leonard is a 54-year-old married lady operating a retail shop in Rukungiri. She has been in this kind of business for close to eight years now and she cites a lack of capital to expand her retail business as a major challenge she has had to come to bitter terms with.

In a week, Leonard anticipates she makes close to 49,000 shillings and highlights her good customer relationship skills as her major calling card. Her future plans are to expand into a wholesale business and also build a family house.

With a loan of 1 million shillings, Leonard says she will be able to drive to fruition her plan of expanding her shop into a wholesale business.

Leonard is an individual client of Pearl Microfinance although she has a man's name.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more items like sugar, oils, cereals, and so on

loans.name: Fernando Obdulio

texts.es:
Don Fernando Obdulio M. M., vive en una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada en el municipio de yali donde él se dedica a la actividad de trabajos agrícolas  específicamente al cultivo de café y a la ganadería. El crédito lo utilizara para darle asistencia técnica a su finca de café, en este periodo el necesita darle mantenimiento como es regulación de sombra, limpia y asistencia con insumos el va a comprar 12 quintales de abono y 12 quintales de urea y pago de mano de obra para la aplicación de los insumos.
Este cliente vive en una zona altamente productiva y por la característica de la zona que tiene una altura de 1000 msnm (mil metros sobre el nivel del mar) es apta para el cultivo de café que es la actividad principal de trabajo de este cliente, este productor comenzó su trabajo ayudándole a sus padres desde que el era pequeño y después le dieron como herencia 4 manzanas de café. Don Fernando con el crédito el espera darle la asistencia que necesita su finca o cultivo de café debido a que acaba de sacar la cosecha y en este periodo comienza a darle mantenimiento para garantizar la cosecha del próximo año ya que este tipo de cultivo da la cosecha una vez cada año, con esto el obtendrá mayores rendimientos y un producto de mejor calidad el cual le beneficiara a él a la hora de la cosecha, tomado en cuenta que este es un rubro de bastante importancia y uno de los principales  rubros de exportación en nuestro país.
Don Fernando Obdulio es casado y tiene 2 hijos la esposa le ayuda a los quehaceres de la casa y cuido de sus hijos él tiene una niña y un varoncito, el varón está estudiando la primaria y la niña no tiene edad todavía para la escuela.
Don Fernando tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y se le han otorgado 4 créditos para estas actividades de trabajo.
El impacto que obtiene este cliente es bastante importante ya que con este apoyo el podrá garantizar y asistir a sus cultivos obteniendo mayores rendimientos y un producto con mejor calidad, esto le beneficiara y mejora sus ingresos permitiéndole ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando Obdulio M. M. lives in a community, which is located in the Yali municipality. He does agricultural work. Specifically, he grows coffee and raises livestock. The loan will be used to give his coffee farm technical assistance. At this time he needs to perform maintenance like regulating the shade, cleaning, and providing care with supplies. He will buy 12 “quintales” (a quintal is 100 pounds) of fertilizer, 12 quintales of urea, and pay for the labor to apply the supplies. He lives in an area that is highly productive. The area is 1,000 meters above sea level and is suitable for growing coffee, which is his primary work. This producer started his work by helping his parents when he was young. Later they gave him four “manzanas” (a little over 3 acres) of coffee. Fernando will use the loan to give the necessary help to his farm or coffee crops. He just finished the harvest, and during this time he starts performing maintenance to guarantee the harvest for next year. This type of crop is harvested once a year. This way he will get greater performance and a better quality product. That will benefit him at harvest time. Keep in mind that this is a very important field, and it is one of the main products exported from our country. Fernando Obdulio is married and has two children. His wife helps with the household chores and takes care of their children. He has a daughter and a son. His son is in primary school, and his daughter is not yet old enough for school. Fernando has worked with Ceprodel for three years. He has received four loan for his work activities. The impact of what this client obtains is very important. With this help he will be able to guarantee and help his crops with greater production of a better quality product. This will benefit him and improve his income. That will allow him to give his family a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 12 “quintales” (a quintal is 100 pounds) of fertilizer, 12 quintales of urea, and pay for the labor to apply the supplies to help his farm

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene 6 hijos. Vive en la localidad de “Palmapampa” (selva central peruana), donde tienen su casa propia. 

En años anteriores trabajaba en el sector agrícola cultivando productos típicos de la selva tropical, pero actualmente se dedica a la carpintería, actividad que le brinda buenos resultados, por lo que ya tiene ganado clientes regulares. Es así que siempre le hacen pedidos de algún mueble y él lo trabajo acorde a los requerimientos de su cliente. Benito ya viene trabajando en su localidad desde haces 15 años y generalmente trabaja con sus ayudantes, pero cuando ellos descansan recibe la ayuda de sus familiares. Para el futuro piensa reincorporarse a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de café, con el propósito de diversificar sus actividades y obtener mayores ganancias para su familia.

Este es su décimo sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas en la fecha establecida. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita adquirirá dos motosierras para su taller de carpintería, de ese modo minimizará el tiempo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Benito is 42 years old and is married, with six children. He lives in the “Palmapampa,” the central Peruvian jungle, and has his own house. In years past, Benito worked in agriculture, growing products typical of the tropical region, but now, he works as a carpenter. This has worked well for him, and he now has several regular clients. They order a piece of furniture and he makes it according to their requirements. Benito has been working in this location for 15 years and usually works with assistants. When the assistants are not available, he receives help from his family. In the future, he would like to get back into agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee. This would diversify his activities and bring more earnings to his family. This is Benito’s 16th loan with MFP, and he has always made his payments on schedule. With this loan, he will buy two power saws for his woodworking shop. This will speed up production.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two power saws

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina, de 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores, pues el mayor ya está casado, su casa esta ubicada en un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad.Antes se dedicaba  a la costura, lo que  era muy agobiante y sobre todo porque descuidaba a sus hijos. Pero desde hace 6 años dejo atrás la costura, y empezó con  el  bordado de  chompas, desde entonces aplica los bordados a todas las chompas que le traen  y que finalmente son exportadas a otros países. Este trabajo le parece  fascinante, ya que puede trabajar en la tranquilidad de su  casa, y además, le pagan regular por cada prenda, dependiendo de la complejidad del paisaje que borda, y la cantidad del avance, es por esta razón  que prefiere realizar todos los bordados posibles. Para más  adelante  su anhelo es abastecerse con gran cantidad de lanas  para poder tejer  y  aplicar los  bordados con tranquilidad,  de ese modo calcula que sus ganancias serian mejores.Es el  séptimo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  se compromete a ser  puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.Además Guillermina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  diversos tipos de lanas, con las que aplicará mejor  los bordados a las chompas , y de ese modo espera entregar  oportunamente las chompas.
texts.en:
Guillermina, age 48, lives with her husband and their 2 younger children. Their eldest child is already married. Her house is located in a crowded neighborhood in the south of the city.

Previously, she was employed as a seamstress, but it was very exhausting work, and required her to neglect her children. She left her seamstress job 6 years ago and began embroidering sweaters. Since then she has applied embroidery to all the sweaters that are brought to her, and when they are finished they are exported to other countries. She likes this work a lot since she is able to work in the quiet of her home and, in addition, is paid a set price for each garment depending on the complexity of the design that she embroiders and the amount of work required. For this reason she prefers to accomplish as much embroidery as possible.

In order to get ahead, her wish is to supply herself with a large quantity of wool in order to be able to weave and apply embroidery consistently. She believes that in that way her earnings will be better.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with the payment of each one of her installments. Guillermina is planning on investing the loan applied for in the purchase of different types of wool with which she will be able to apply embroidery to sweaters more easily. In this way she hopes to be able to deliver sweaters on time.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase wool in order to continue embroidering.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos. Cuenta con un techo propio y su casa está ubicada en una localidad de la selva central peruana llamada “Palmapampa”.

Cuando notó que sus vecinos obtenías muy buenas ganancias por estos productos, inmediatamente decidió empezar a cultivar cacao y café. En el presente le va muy bien y sus ganancias le brindan seguridad y confianza, además cuenta con personal que la ayudan y facilitan el trabajo de cultivo y cosecha. Generalmente vende sus productos a los centros de acopio a un precio muy bueno, es por ello para el futuro anhela invertir en sus chacras, con las mismas ganas y entusiasmo que cuando empezó, pero también desea mejorar sus técnicas agrícolas para optimizar la calida de sus cosechas.

Este es su primero préstamo con MFP, por lo que le agradece la oportunidad de mejorar en su trabajo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará herramientas e insumos para el cultivo de cacao y café, para así minimizar los costos y tiempo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Florencia is 29 years old. She lives with her partner, the father of her three children. She has her own house, located in a part of the central Peruvian jungle called “Palmapampa.” Florencia decided to start growing cocoa and coffee when she saw that her neighbors were making good money with these crops. Now, the business is going well and her earnings provide her with security and confidence. Also, she has good people helping her with the cultivation and harvesting. Florencia generally sells her products to the markets at a good price. For this reason, she is just as enthusiastic about investing in her farm as she was at the beginning. She also wants to improve her agricultural techniques, to optimize the quality of her products. This is Florencia’s first loan with MFP, and she is grateful for this opportunity to improve her business. She commits to making her payments on time. With this loan she will buy tools and supplies for the cultivation of cocoa and coffee. This will minimize costs and labor.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural tools

loans.name: Heraclio

texts.es:
Heraclio tiene 39 años, es soltero y tiene 5 hijos. Reside en una comunidad de la selva central peruana llamada “Zorza”, donde tienen su techo propio.

Desde hace varios años tenía en mente en tener su propio negocio, donde se especializara en desarrollar productos para satisfacer a los comerciantes mayoristas. Es por ello que en la actualidad se dedica a la actividad agrícola, cultiva la hoja de coca y cacao, y cuenta con ayudantes con quienes trabajan en sus tierras arduamente. En su negocio le va muy bien, ya que con las ganancias obtenidas puede llevar felicidad a su familia y cumplir con los pagos a sus peones. Generalmente sus productos los vende a los centros de acopio en una localidad aledaña.
